Reviews.Title: “Stayed here 4/9/12 - 4/11/12”
Reviews.Author: Bandit973
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Lord Baltimore with my husband and 12 year old son April 9th through April 11th. The staff was very nice and accomodating. The problem is the hotel itself not the people. It is old and outdated. The rugs in the room were threadbare and stained. We all wore socks in the room always except when sleeping. The TV was old and big. I requested a refrigerator and it was old and scratched and so large it took up almost half the room. Years ago the hotel must have been lovely but it has apparently been left to deteriorate. There are alot of homeless people on West Baltimore Ave. which is why you need to ask for a key to the restrooms in the downstairs lobby. The bar does not get the local baseball games. We left Camden Yards that Monday night in the 8th inning and stopped for a nightcap at the deserted lobby bar. Apparently the owner will not spring for the fee so the guests can watch local Major League baseball games. As a total experience the hotel was not terrible considering we were out most of the time enjoying all Baltimore has to offer but I would advise anyone to shop around and compare.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the Radisson Lord Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: abcd1120
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to give the Lord Baltimore a more positive review. I would certainly give five stars to their staff, which is professional and friendly and eager to help. Kudos to Daniel and Russell and Josh. They were terrific. Although the lobby area is exquisite, our room was a disappointment. Hotwire assigned us this hotel for an attractive rate, but after reading TripAdvisor reviews I was quite concerned. I called the hotel the week before our arrival, and asked for a clean and quiet room on a high floor. Upon arrival we were upgraded gratis to a business-class room on the 14th floor. Even there, the level of housekeeping left me uncomfortable – used soap was left in the bathroom, and the overall impression was that a thorough cleaning was needed. The wallpaper was stained. The bolster pillows on the bed were old and lumpy and unusable, but there were three smaller pillows that were fine. Our sleep-number bed was comfortable enough. The room had benefitted from some updates, including some bathroom renovations and new carpet. Because the room faced the street, it really wasn’t completely quiet, but we were able to sleep through the street sounds. Perhaps I should have gone back to the lobby to address these issues, but we were tired from travelling and on our way to meet up with friends for dinner. Based on the excellent rate that we received on Hotwire, and the fact that they had placed us in a business class room, I’m not sure we could have done much better. I am glad that we chose to pay the extra money for valet parking. After coming back from dinner at night, I am not sure how comfortable I would have been walking in the area around the hotel. The Radisson could have a beautiful hotel in the Lord Baltimore, but it would require quite an infusion of cash. Its five-star staff deserves a property it could be proud of. The moral of the story: I have always had good results using Hotwire, but I wouldn’t take a Hotwire three-star hotel in the Baltimore Inner Harbor/Downtown area again. That Hotwire assigned the Radisson Lord Baltimore three stars was generous of them.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need to be updated”
Reviews.Author: jerrymNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 10, 2012 this hotels glory days have long past, the bathroom was terrible, outdated and mold on the ceiling. The room itself was tiny and the dial matress was horrible, the tv was old and many channels were full of static. I will not come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson just not that Rad!”
Reviews.Author: pengirl87
Reviews.Content: Was looking forward to going, and staying there, and seeing the Yankees game. We arrived at 1:30ish and we knew that check-in was not until three but we figured we would see if it would be possible. Approached the counter and asked if it would be possible to check-in and the response we received was "well what do you think I'm doing?" That left me a little bent already. Her attitude was not pleasant at all and she did not even try to fake it. We head up to the room. Surprised to find that there was no kind of fridge for beverages or anything. They still have the old TV’s inside of an armoire and when you go to pull, the TV out it was so shaky that we did not feel like it would safe to do. The bed was comfortable however; the curtains on the window next to the bed had a mystery substance all over it. The drawers to the nightstand when opened just fell right out. The bathroom was no better the toilet ran and was hard to flush and the tub was five shades of dungy. The air in the room made a humming noise the entire time it ran. To top it all off the next morning we were relaxing in the bed and we heard housekeeping tap on the door so my husband got up to go over to the door and she came on in and when she saw we were still there she said "oh sorry sorry" and shut the door. So check out was at noon. My husband got in the shower at 11:15. At 11:25, housekeeping again knocked on the door. I got up and answered it. There was a woman with a vacuum. I said we would be leaving shortly. She held up one finger and started hollering for somebody else to come. Another woman comes down and says housekeeping...Yeah I get that. I said we would be leaving shortly. I said check out is at noon. And she just stared at me so I shut the door. If you want people out before noon make check out time before noon!! Left very irritated to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed easter weekend 2012...don't stay here...seriously”
Reviews.Author: Ryan H
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my girlfriend Easter weekend, had to be moved three separate times. Hotel used to be a smoking hotel and some careless guests still treat it as such, 9 out of 10 hallways smells like a disgusting ashtray. Walls are paper thin and if you can't hear babies screaming, you can hear your neighbors getting busy (both happened to us). The second room we stayed in had a clogged sink with standing, smelly water and the comforter made my gf and I sick. It reeked of B.O. and urine so badly that after we were move into our third room we each had to shower to remove the smell off ourselves. They use their sleep number beds as a selling point, they are sleep number beds version 1.0 and are literally inflatable mattresses with a sheet on them, half of which don't work. The mattress in our third and final room wouldn't adjust and it was literally the equivalent to sleeping on a half inflated blow up mattress. Absolutely horrendous, I know it's hard to gauge these reviews from high maintenance guests and those who genuinely had a bad stay. Take it from me, I saw three different rooms, this hotel is garbage.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: DanielSan1980
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: Since sharing my concerns about my room with upper level management upon returning home from my trip, the folks at Radisson have been incredibly responsive and proactive in taking responsibility for these concerns and making sure that I am walking away satisfied. Management's timely and thoughtful response to my concerns has made me more likely to try a Radisson hotel again in the future. ORIGINAL REVIEW: The front desk staff and the staff at the breakfast were great and very helpful. The location was good, in the vicinity of the aquarium. That being said, the room itself was incredibly disappointing. The bathroom was dated and there was a significant amount of mildew in the corner of the tub. The wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling and mildewy as well. The bedroom felt dingy and dated. The fire sprinkler in the middle of the bedroom ceiling protruded out of a gaping hole... not very comforting! For $200 a night, I found this hotel to be a terrible value. I told the front desk staff person about the quality of the room upon checkout. He agreed that the room was unacceptable when I showed him the photo of the bedroom fire sprinkler posted here, and he refunded my $12 breakfast. While a nice sentiment, this does not in itself make the room acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not what was reserved”
Reviews.Author: YUP1
Reviews.Content: Traveling with children, we had email confirmation that rooms would be adjoining. Did not happen. Kids were down the hall. Also room reservation clearly states king room with sleep number beds. Once again no such luck. I am thinking that breakfast tomorrow morning will not have coffee

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel But In Need of Some Fixin's”
Reviews.Author: WittyLena
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a while back--ended up here again through priceline--$50/night this time. The staff is still very pleasant, helpful, attentive but a number of little issues takes away from a more pleasant experience overall. Issues this time around: what's the first thing most people do when they get into a hotel room?--throw themselves on the bed, right? Well, I did just that because I was tired after a long 2hr drive...but what happens?? 1. I almost fell off the darn thing! I called the front desk and right away they said they'd sent up an "engineer". He came up within 5 minutes. He knew right away what was wrong with the bed--it was off whatever holds it up underneath. He admitted it (when I asked) if it got that way from the maids/housekeepers making the bed and not putting it back in place. So, obviously this happens all the time. Solution--have the maids report when this happens so it can be corrected prior to a guest coming into a room!!!! 2. 1 tiny trash can in the entire room! 3. the freakin' sleep number beds suck--how many not so great reviews do they need to read to understand they need new beds??!!! I barely slept because I was so uncomfortable. 4. Got up in the middle of the night (b/c I couldn't sleep) and went to the bathroom--the light was sooo bright I had to turn it off and go in the dark! Solution? Either put a red light in the bathroom or even a simple night light! 5. The tiles caulking/tub were a bit cruddy. 6. the darn fan in the vent drove me crazy all nite as well! 7. and the vent in the bathroom didn't come on at all! Other than those things, everything else was fine!! They're using a new parking garage--the "down under" garage (under the Fallon Federal Building) for $15/24hr--don't be lazy don't do valet, it'll cost you an extra $16!!! To get into the garage you have to go around about 3-4 blocks but to walk to the hotel after you park is right across the street on Baltimore St entrance. Plenty of places in the surrounding area to get food so don't do room service. Fridge and microwave are extra. I stayed in Baltimore because I couldn't get a room in DC for $50 or under. It's a short drive to DC and I was able to enjoy DC one day then Baltimore Harbor the next. Worked out wonderfully! Would I stay here again? Yes. especially for $50 or under :-)

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: canadian040258
Reviews.Content: Hotel was conveniently located - within walking distance to the convention center. Rooms were reasonably well maintained. Daily house-keeping was excellent. Staff were very helpful.. just the telephone did not work for most part of the stay. Parking is expensive - but if you take self-parking, it is half the cost. Downtown Baltimore is a little risky - you hear police sirens all the time, day and night. So, even though I was on the 15th floor, the noise did wake me up a couple of times, each night. Nothing the hotel could do. Other hotels in the vicinity are probably comparable, but no one could beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Old Wolrd charm at the NICE price”
Reviews.Author: ConcourseMike
Reviews.Content: Amazing service; nice staff; lovely old lobby. Don't be fooled by reports that the area is full of scary people - a few pan-handlers never hurt anyone! LOL

Reviews.Title: “Tired, In Need of a Total Rehab, but Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Chicagodocjerry
Reviews.Content: I must admit paying 55.00 for this hotel through priceline, for one night following a business trip (couldn't see spending 200+ at the Hilton for one more night; way over-priced there). This hotel, the former "Lord Baltimore" is a "grand" hotel. But it is simply tired. Carpets are worn; paint shows many coats and chips and re-painting. Elevators are ancient. But I must say that from the moment I walked into the lobby, the staff could not have been friendlier and more helpful; actually outstanding. My room was OK. Bed was one of those sleep number deals; the last thing I want to think about in a hotel is what my sleep number is. The bathroom was in need of updating; bad and dirty grout in the shower/tub surround. And under the bathroom sink was one of those stainless steel mini-trashcans with the pedal to open it. Really? It was old and filthy. It would be SO MUCH BETTER if this fine staff had a building of which they could be proud. Radisson, it would be worth the money to renovate this aging edifice. Kudos to the great staff. The heart "Good morning, sir!" when I walked into the lobby in the morning was much appreciated. I would not consider paying more than 55.00 per night here.

Reviews.Title: “This place almost sent me to the hospital !!!”
Reviews.Author: Glenn T
Reviews.Content: I emailed the following review to "rhi_biha@radisson.com" on Feb. 24, 2012. I have not yet received a replay. Today is Mar. 13, 2012. hello, please let me start my comments by saying your staff was very friendly and helpful, however your aging building is suffering from deferred maintenance that is starting to affect the guest satisfaction experience. Several small incidental deficiencies unfortunately added up to make me want to take time out of my busy day to make these comments... First day, the key card generator did not work, keys were not available and the busy staff was escorting guests up to the room one by one. After running in the cold weather I spent over 15 mins. 2/21/12, 5-pm waiting for an escort while freezing in my sweaty outfit. For a full day your wireless internet 2/21-2/22 did not work and I could not access my office files thus losing productivity. After internet was restored the printer in the business center would not print, an airline boarding pass in my case impacting travel plans. The toilet in 721 was not 'plugged', but a slow drain resulted in multiple flushes for solid matter. Also, in that bathroom I observed several small roaches on the floor. Finally, I obtained a serious 'cephalic' bacterial foot infection in your shower starting on Wed 2/22 probably due to inadequate cleaning that has required doctors care and possible hospitalization if these costly prescribed antibiotics don't work. As nice as the folks were, I am afraid I could not recommend this hotel. Glenn R. Tanner, PE Principal Engineer Marketable Ventures 23440 Hawthorne Bl. Suite 205 Torrance CA 90505

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: phoenixgirl2
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay in Baltimore. It was so easy to get everywhere in the city and they provided a shuttle to get to Johns Hopkins. Our room was comfortable and clean with a lot of neat, old touches, since it is an historic hotel. The staff helped us out and made some good restaurant recommendations. We really enjoyed our stay! It is also right off the light rail from the airport, so no need to take a taxi or shuttle, which is much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby...ok room.”
Reviews.Author: LaceyJR
Reviews.Content: When you enter the lobby of this Radisson, you can't help but notice the historic beauty. The room on the other was an ok average room, but probably one of the smallest hotel rooms I've stayed in. The cleanliness was also ok, but there were some areas, such as the bathroom that could have been cleaner. I think with updating and more detailed cleaning the room would be much better. The sleep number bed was ok. It was interesting to try out the different numbers but there honestly was not a very noticeable of difference. The pillows are the only thing that I will say were horrible. Not just one pillow but all three in the room were terrible. I had to roll mine up just use it. It was so thin, as if there was not stuffing at all. Our bathroom had no blowdryer, so we did have to call down for one which was brought up very quickly. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Check in and check out was a breeze. The parking lot could have been closer but we couldn't complain considering it was free self park.

Reviews.Title: “FOR THE PRICE, ITS A GOOD DEAL. GREAT LOCATION. PET FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: Sarah29803
Reviews.Content: I REALLY REALLY recommend this place if you need to be close to the metro and you want a great deal. PARKING: Hey guys who keep complaining about parking....don't valet park anything. Just pull up at the front of the hotel and ask the lady where the UNDERGROUND PARKING GARAGE is at. There is one within about a 2 minute walk of this hotel, it's marked with a giant blue "P" and you can get a weekly pass for like $10/day. I always use that one because I stay 2 weeks at a time in Baltimore. This hotel though old, has a lot of things going for it. Some good features/things about it are: 1) Location--15 seconds walk from the Metro, 15 minute walk from the Inner Harbor (aquarium, some restaurants, boat rides, etc. Edo sushi is awesome, the tapas place too has a great view, and the marble slab ice cream is yummy, and there's also a Phillips there in Inner Harbor), 3 min. walk from bushes where your dog can go potty. 2) Johns Hopkins discounts, Military Discounts, Govt. Discounts, you name it, they probably have some sort of discount for you. So, ask!!! There are also FREE SHUTTLES TO AND FROM AIRPORT AND JOHNS HOPKINS (multiple stops at different parts of JHU including the hospital). 3) Pet friendly rooms are available. However, if your dog messes things up, there are additional costs ontop of the usual pet charge. 4) If you want microwave and fridge, YOU CAN REQUEST THEM. They cost a bit extra but are worthwhile, if you plan on staying there a couple of days, because you can put left-overs in the fridge and re-heat...but if I were you, I wouldn't rent the microwave if you're in the Plaza level. If you're at the plaza level they have a community microwave that they keep quite clean. I usually just fix a cup of coffee for myself while I wait for my food to heat up. 5) They have PLAZA rooms. Get these rooms if at all possible. They have an awesome breakfast that includes OJ, cranberry juice, milk, coffee, scrambled eggs, grits, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit (blackberries, strawberries, cantaloupe, honey dew, banana, apple, etc.), yogurt, free waters you can bring with you, cereals, pastries, etc.. Amazing breakfast, and someone is always there in case you need anything during the breakfast. They also have "Happy Hour" in the evenings, which includes finger foods, wine, crackers, cheese, misc. munchies for free. You can also ask em for decaf. This is only available on the plaza levels; there are two floors. There is also TV, nice comfy couches, it's just a great area to hang out and get what you need done, and still be comfy doing it. It saves a lot of money on breakfast and dinner too, if you just eat a big lunch and eat there for breakfast and dinner. 6) There's a FREE LAUNDRY machine at the EXERCISE room. Bring your own detergent and you've got laundry covered. Yeah I know, weird place to have laundry right? But oh well, it works just fine and you can plop your clothes in there, exercise while you guard your clothes. There's already clean towels down there too, so you don't have to wait for room service to bring stuff up, you can grab a few on your way back. 7) You can request INTERIOR rooms if the street noise bothers you. 8) Management is pretty responsive; if you have problems, call em up, they're quick to correct it. I come here at least twice a year, two weeks at a time, and I've never had problems with the management being discourteous or not caring. 9) You can order food at any time of the night or day just about. Their crab and avacado appetizer is good; I don't remember the name of it but it's realy yummy and the price is good and it's quite a bit of crab. There's also a sort of general-convenience-store near the lobby sort of part of the hotel, and a coffee shop also sort of part of the hotel. The convenience store guy is really, really friendly and kind. He can answer a lot of random questions about Asian food and also about what's fun to do and at a good price in Baltimore. I ask him all the time, and he seems to have unlimited patience though I didn't buy a single thing from his store; he's just really pleasant and helpful. 10) They have a business center area you can do work/homework at. Overall, for the price it is at, it really is a pretty good deal; you just have to remember certain little things, like the underground instead of valet parking, the plaza level, the refridgerator, the free laundry, etc. It's cheaper than anything else you will find that is this clean and with management this eager to please. Yes they are an older hotel, but they truly try hard to please you; just tell them how. If you don't tell them how, they won't always know.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be skrrd!”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynPal
Reviews.Content: I am pleased to say that the scary reviews I have read about the Radisson Plaza Lord Baltimore were rather dramatic in their complaints, based on our experience. My husband and I were actually concerned when we won this hotel off one of those bidding websites. (yes, that one.) However the price was right and the location was excellent. So we went along with hopes that the complaints were erroneous and any issues we encountered would be minor. Not only were we extremely pleased with the proximity of hotel to everything we wanted to do in our two days, but our room was very nice! We were also very pleasant to the folks who checked us in, so that might be why they gave us a corner room when they couldn't accommodate our courteous request for a king room, if possible. There was another one of those numerous weddings going on (like in so many of the other reviews). The place was nearly full up! The golden rule "treat others as you would like them to treat you" goes a long way! The only thing that I have read in the negative and where I concur is the windows were dirty. And our sleep number bed wasn't working. But we got a good night's sleep, anyway! I like duvets and lots of pillows. All good! Yes, the area around the hotel can be dodgy at night, but we walked from shopping around the inner harbor to dinner nearby the hotel without any unsettling incidents. We were back by 11:30, and surprisingly met in the lobby by a uniformed office who wished us a good night. Oh, right! There are a few more points I wanted to include: 1. the rooms do provide hairdryer. I packed mine since it wasn't mentioned in room amenities -- could have used the space for other things on the way home!! 2. they do not provide microwaves or mini-fridges - this is not a dorm! 3. ice machine did not work on 11th fl at the time, but they have signs up to show you can get ice on other floors. 4. free wifi worked fine for me and hubby - useful tip: they allow you to send up to 10 pages to the business center for printing free of charge! 5. I didn't understand how to work the remote for the TV. They sent an engineer to come up pretty quickly - 15 or 20 mins and got it sorted. Unfortunately, they tried almost too hard to make things right. They called twice to make sure someone had come to take care of our issue. It's only unfortunate because we were trying to nap before dinner. On a funny note: trying to take things into my own hands, I called guest services and asked for a 'do not disturb' to be placed on our phone and they told me that "it does not exist". Hmm! Okay! 6. not that we needed it, but they do provide valet parking for $31/night I don't consider any of this a disaster, we're from NYC and we adapt. :) Would I pay full price for this stay? Nope! But I don't pay full price for anything if I don't have to. It's pretty solid for a 3 star old-school hotel in an old city. Baltimore is a nice place to visit. We enjoyed ourselves aight! Hope this helps someone. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Bad Bed”
Reviews.Author: biandi
Reviews.Content: So I will start off by saying the location of this Hotel is great. It is very near to the inner harbor. We stayed at this hotel while on a weekend trip to see the Baltimore Os play. So it was a quick walk to the ballpark. The hotel was also very clean. The things I did not like about the hotel were first off the beds. The beds are sleep number beds and while I do not know if we had a bad one or not, I do know that I felt like I was sleeping on an air mattress all night which was not comfortable at all. Also the hotel does not have enough elevators to accomadate the facility. We had a 4 and 8 year old with us and were on a high floor so stairs were not desirable but we almost took them the morning of check out due to waiting forever for an elevator we could squeeze in to. I really wanted to love this hotel but I do not think we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm and Southern hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Sprortsmom
Reviews.Content: It isn't the newest, but if your looking for a clean, comfortable hotel near everything, then this hotel is for you. An added plus is the southern hospitality from the staff. They are professional and truly are appreciative that you chose their hotel. The beds have the Sleep Number System, their is a coffee shop offering all the Starbucks items off the lobby for the biz person, and a great hotel gym.

Reviews.Title: “Would've given it only 1 star if it weren't for -”
Reviews.Author: PandorasInk
Reviews.Content: the fact that the hotel is generally very clean and the staff very nice. Between 7 different pillows i could not find one that wasn't aweful and the bed was broken; it was one of those adjustable on each side, but that didn't work, and it was by far the most uncomfortable bed ever. Also the draft thru the window (and its inside shutters which were closed) was so bad that it moved the fabric shower curtain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and classy”
Reviews.Author: Tanya G
Reviews.Content: I remember this hotel before it was renovated. Still has a classy atmosphere about it. Offers a continental breakfast with your stay. Close to downtown and the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, classic charm, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: szuperdan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid December - two families in two rooms. Parking is expensive and self parking is far away. Check in procedure was smooth and efficient. Rooms were very comfortable and clean - beds were great. We needed a roll away and it was delivered/installed within 5 minutes of phone call. Breakfast was good - not great but no complaints - staff was wonderful. Located 2 long blocks from Inner Harbor - easy to walk. If you haven't been to Baltimore's Inner Harbor, you should add it to your list - Aquarium, ships to tour, restaurants, baseball, shopping - one of the best urban harbor experiences. And all of this for about $100/night - a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: ritzcrackers
Reviews.Content: I was able to check in early which was good. The hotel bathroom was kind of dirty. The toilet had urine stains on it. Carpet was stained and the TV was kind of old. I was only there for one night so it was fine for my needs. The lobby and staff were nice. Sleep number beds were great

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mriah21
Reviews.Content: The staff was rude. My room had many maintenance issues and reaked of cigarette smoke. I reported the issues with no resolve. The hotel manager and maintenance man even tried to barge in on me and blame me for the smoke. After writing a complaint email they refunded me $100 of my $400 total. Really disappointed overall and the $100 resolve, showed a lack in truly correcting their mistakes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for Inner Harbor, good service”
Reviews.Author: diaworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as an Inner Harbor getaway and it was an easy three block walk to the Inner Harbor, six blocks to the aquarium. With the parking package it was a good value at $99 since parking in Baltimore is very expensive. Nice rooms, a bit loud from street noise (it is near a hospital so lots of ambulances).

Reviews.Title: “The staff were full of smiles!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLolabunny
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 12th floor and had no problems with it. It took us a few minutes to get the hang of the air number bed. I still prefer my memory foam bed at home.The staff at the desk that night was Lisa & Daniel. Both were smiling and friendly. They answered our questions and gave us maps of the area. We added a night because of Lisa's friendly manor. The breakfast in the hotel was very good and the waitress,Ivori,was on top of her game. The ladies in the coffee shop were very friendly too. The only problem we had was how far the parking garage was from the hotel. Like any big city at night be aware of your surroundings. This beautiful hotel made Baltimore a great vacation city.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bstrange_11
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal for this room by bidding for a 3 star hotel near the downtown inner-harbor area. I needed to be close to the Institute for Foot & Ankle Reconstruction at Mercy Hospital. The lobby and common areas seemed clean and nice. The heater in our room(725)didn't work and an employee promptly responded and fixed it. The room was in dire need of an update, and the carpet was stained and worn out. We only stayed one night and while in the bathroom early the next morning I noticed an insect crawling on a towel on the bathroom floor. It resembled a tick in a way, but had a flat body. A quick check on my iphone confirmed my worst fear. It was a bed bug! I pulled back the covers on my bed and saw a much smaller one on the sheets that was more red in color. My friend did not find any on his bed, but while waiting for a hotel staff member, I found another one crawling on my sheets.(See photo of all 3) A staff member took our names and address's, but my request to see the hotel manager was declined. We never received an apology or any other offer of compensation. I realize any hotel is subject to bed bugs, but a dark dirty carpet(like in our room) makes it a lot easier to have an infestation.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonably priced hotel near the Harbor”
Reviews.Author: KSinope
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel, I read the reviews and they were a mix, but we were looking at price and a hotel that had a lounge and restaurant. My husband and I wanted a hotel to stay at for the night before our cruise and didn't want to pay an arm and a leg. Some hotels were almost $300 a night! Overall, we enjoyed our stay and had great service. The mattress is the sleep number, and although I found it comfortable, my husband did not. The hotel was quite busy, and there was a wedding reception. The only real complaint I have is the water was on the cool side for my shower, but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the $”
Reviews.Author: Zildjian12
Reviews.Content: First of all, I don't have a clue why there have been so many negative comments about this hotel/staff. From the moment we checked in until we left, everyone was very friendly, helpful, and just super nice people. The rooms could use some upgrading for sure; however, this property was very clean and our room was a good size. The location was just fine (it's not down along the water front, but it only took us about 5 min. or so to walk to the Harbor). So.......if you are looking for a reasonbly priced hotel and friendly and helpful staff, give the Radisson a chance.

Reviews.Title: “It's nice”
Reviews.Author: BCintron40
Reviews.Content: So behind on my reviews. I stood at this hotel with my family for a day or two back in March of 2009/2010 on business. Ironically, it was my b-day the next day and hoped to celebrate just a bit with my brother's who reside in MD. We had a room that included the continental breakfast. Dad was unable to go down the staircase and I had no idea where the elevator was (information lacking from the front desk) so I asked for room service. We had to pay full price to later learn back in NY it could have been serviced to our room since it was already paid for. The end result (and I still have the e-mails) management told me we could have a free dinner at their restaurant on our next return and refunds were not available. It was an overnight business trip. We were in the midst of buying a home near Howard County and the contract had to be settled. The hotel is very nice, but the room was beyond small for the price. I cannot say anyone was particularly nice (cordial yes to some degree). Would I personally recommend this hotel? I'll give it a 3. Did I expect much more? YES! It's the Radisson. Who would return for a free dinner at their restaurant from NY to MD? I can easily go to my favorite restaurant on Lex or the theatre district. Capital Grille. Why return to a hotel that you are unhappy with which was my argument. I overpaid for something never received. I will add I did try to receive some type of reimbursement (again) since X amount of time had passed it could no longer be addressed. Stood at the Radisson once. Never will again. Sometimes the best is not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking Service and "Worn."”
Reviews.Author: Crumz32
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure - I stayed here 5 years ago with my wife (gf, at the time) and another couple and we loved it. I just returned with 8 other guys for "Stadium Tour," where we visit a different NFL stadium each year and every one of us was disappointed in some way. (For those of you who arent too sharp, this year we went to a Ravens game.) My biggest complaint this time - The shower drained slower than molasses in January. After my buddy showered I had to wait at least 40 minutes or stand in a cesspool or dirty water. We also had a 3rd guy in our room and literally requested a cot 3x.... It was even in my original email to the hotel. (I've got an email to prove that.) We called 2 more times and we were told they no longer had a cot. We kindly said "You owe us a room, because this guy isn't sleeping on the floor." 20 minutes later they found a cot. Wow - Amazing. I wish the magician who made a cot out of nothing can do that with money. The location isn't bad as it's centrally located and about a 5-7 min walk to the inner harbor. Sure if you walk a block or two in the other direction it gets pretty sketchy but guys... it's Baltimore. For the record, I love Baltimore but many areas are not so good, even the locals will admit that. There is a bar and restaurant on site and bar features happy hour. No complaints there. Rooms were pretty basic for the most part. In the future, I would spend an extra 10-20 bucks and stay at a SPG property or something a little nicer. The carpets were worn out at heck, the elevators were slow, and the ice machine spit out one cube at a time. Was it clean. Yes. Absolutely. It just looks like Radisson corporate might want to drop in 5-10 million and renovate the place.It wasn't terrible, I just felt bad as the group leader because I booked the hotel. Parking is also expensive at 31.00 a day but that's probably any hotel in town. For you younger people - some really good nightlife and restaurants in Baltimore. Canton Sq, Federal Hill, Fells Point, they know how to do it up down there. Any questions ask! btw... Ravens fans know how to do it. Amazing tailgates!

Reviews.Title: “Past its prime but good value spot”
Reviews.Author: IsadoreG
Reviews.Content: Hotel is imposing from the outside with an impressive lobby and even more impressive ballrooms. The rooms however are no comparison. While the accoutrements are high quality..i.e. Thomasville furniture, they are very old, cracking, drawers difficult to open etc. The room was nice and large and the beds comfortable. It was surface clean but there were heavy dust adhesions higher up on the wall and heavily stained carpet etc. If you are finicky it is not for you. If you want a basically clean place with clean and comforable bedding etc. then it is. Breakfast is not included. Parking is CHEAPER than most other hotels at $15 a day for self park with in-out privileges. Internet was free but slow. Staff initially did not have the fridge we requested delivered but did accomodate us to have someone pull one in at 12:30 am. They were friendly and courteous at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a problem, fixed promptly”
Reviews.Author: Debora_R_25
Reviews.Content: Our room was very large, and had a fridge. It was clean and the beds were comfortable. There was a problem with the heating system, and they sent someone up to fix it at 9:00 at night. He was unable to fix it completely, and offered to move us to another room. We were too tired to take them up on it. They tried to fix it the next morning and were not successful, and offered again to move us, which they did promptly. The hotel wasn't up to the standard of most hotels I've stayed in, but our room was clean and quiet. The employees we encountered were all very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Tired in a tired place”
Reviews.Author: BobBoston
Reviews.Content: On check-in I was informed that concierge level no longer serves a breakfast...so other than a computer in the lounge on the 17th floor...no need to spend the money. (The bill was adjusted to a regualr room rat.) Hotel is about 3-4 blocks from the inner Harbour...ended up driving since the neighborhood had that abandon feel. If you elect to do self park (half the price of valet) be prepared for an adventure. The directions are somewhat round-about and trying to figure out the maze of exits to get back to the hotel was a challenge at night. The staff is very nice and accomodating but the hotel itself is very tired. You won't pay much to stay here and it's close to what you want to see...it's basically a value proposition for a night's sleep but no a destination hotel by any measure. They have sleep number beds...which you either like or hate. It was like sleeping on an air mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Caution:”
Reviews.Author: Skydragon86
Reviews.Content: Horrible service, strange smells, and absolutely NO assistance offered. I needed cash to buy a coke... asked the guy at the front desk, who already had an attitude. He He didn't even suggest that they have an ATM in the lobby, which I didn't notice until the next morning. Pretty disappointing. The room smelled really bad, I literally brewed coffee in the little coffee maker, just to get the smell, at 2:00 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Problem with payment”
Reviews.Author: LeticiaBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night. I prepayed my stay using hotwire but then they charged my credit card again. I realice when my credit card statement arrived and nevertheless I tried to contact them (I sent several emails explaining the situation) I had no reply. So I have to call my credit card, send the emails and ask for a refund, wich of course they did. I do not recommend just because of this; they don't even bother to reply my emails.

Reviews.Title: “Good out for people who just want a place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: melissafromva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Plaza, Lord Baltimore hotel for one night, and one night is all its worth. . The good.Location was pretty close to the stadiums and the inner harbor. Plenty of elevators and the staff was helpful. The hotel lobby is very pretty. : The bad: Hotel Room:The tv was old and didn't work well. The sleep number bed didn't change numbers. The bathroom was very dated with cracked tub/soap dish. The tub itself was dirty and filled when the shower was on. The water was lukewarm at best. The hotel is old and the walls are thin. The Hotel: Parking is a block away for $15, which is a good price considering that valet is $31. You have to park outside the hotel entrance, check in, then request a parking ticket. The Grill buffet brunch was limited. The food was cold and there were dirty dishes on a lot of the tables. The bartender makes VERY weak drinks and tried to charge me for another shot when the drink I asked for was more juice than vodka. Handicapped rooms were basically retro-fit - not true handicap accessible. The elevators were slow and creaky, almost too scary to ride on. There is a tripping hazard when getting off the hotel -horrible for a wheelchair as well. Would I recommend this hotel? Only if you need a place to crash for one night. Other than that - I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, Comfortable and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: MDYREN
Reviews.Content: I did not want to stay in the Radison but did so because of price, location and availability. Upon arrival I was greeted by a genuinely friendly staff member behind the registration desk and expeditiously checked in. The hotel lodging floor hallway had a somewhat dated and dingy feel but it was clean enough. I never got to see the assigned room because my key card would not open the door. Upon my return to the front desk the same responsive individual reassigned me to another room on the 17th floor. Imagine my surprise when I stepped off the elevator and found out that it was the concierge level. This time my key worked and I was treated to a very generously sized room and a view. My stay revealed that the breakfast, evening snacks and drinks of this lounge were towards the modest end of the typical amenities one experiences in such facilities (e.g., Hyatt and Marriott) but they were certainly welcome. The room was very comfortable, the bathrobe enjoyable and things were looking up. They stayed that way during my short two day stay. The lobby bar was attended to by a unresponsive and apparently uncaring individual with no engagement with at least me as a customer but this was the only lacking experience in this hotel. Clearly the property had been a grande dame in the past and frequently one noted reminders of this golden past. I would say that the hotel would benefit from some more freshening but I would certainly not hesitate to stay there again if I wanted to be in the inner harbor area. Other than the bar tender its people were a strong suit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful History”
Reviews.Author: ecricketg
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful front corner room on floor 19. So we had a great view. Room nice and clean. Water has to run a long time to get hot though. The staff very nice. Wish we could have talked more with Tony, who is a wealth of info on the history of the town and esp. this amazing building. I was dissappointed there wasnt any brochures or books available in lobby or giftshop with complete history on construction,architecture,who slept here etc. Even touring the whole building would be fun. Maybe Im just a history buff-but when I stay at a historical landmark, I expect to learn some really interesting history. Not even any old pictures of the place when it was new or anything. Other than lacking on history info,the only other drawback is the parking. Have to park and walk a block and pay $15. per night OR use valet parking for $31.per night. Looks like they could come up with a better plan for their guests than that. We probably wont stay again for that reason. But Im so glad to have had the chance to stay here once.

Reviews.Title: “It's just an old hotel in Baltimore.....”
Reviews.Author: Puttz
Reviews.Content: .....not that, there is anything wrong with that. While I have nothing terrible bad to say about the hotel I also have nothing good to say about it either. But I'll try to find something on either side of the spectrum and elaborate. Upon arrival on Friday my group was disappointed to learn that the adjoining rooms we requested were not available. They couldn't even accommodate two rooms on the same floor. I, personally, don't believe they hotel was even that full based on the number of people we passed in the hallways, but I have no way of really judging that so it isn't too fair of me to assume. The elevator, well the two that were working, were slow, small and seemingly always full. But I guess that is to be expected when you have 18 floors and only two of the 5 elevators working full time. The good news is that if you could call to the coffee shop downstairs and order a sandwich it MAY be ready by time you get there. The shop, while providing good coffee and decent sandwiches was even slower than the elevators. I felt bad for the poor lady that had to run the understaffed shop all weekend. But she kept her head up and a friendly attitude the entire time. Some of the good things include the nice sleep number beds, the extremely friendly staff, and the Bloody Mary's made by Nick at the hotel bar. The staff actually made the stay very enjoyable. They gave recommendations on where to go out at night, where to order a late night pizza, and where to get some wings. Their recommendations came quick and without reservation. Although we may have had very different taste than them since we were not impressed with the food we got. That is not against the hotel or it's staff though. The location is pretty good for whatever you are in town for. There is always a cab waiting and the cab rides are a fair price. Overall it wasn't a "bad" stay or a bad hotel, but if I were to go back to the town of purple birds I would probably look to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Kristina D
Reviews.Content: I do not understand the negative reviews at all! This hotel was beautiful! The lobby was stunning, out room and bathroom were a nice size and very clean, the bar in the lobby had the best cesar salad I have ever had, the cafe had amazing hot cocoa, and the staff was extremely pleasant. If you are a person that appreciates older architecture this is a great place to stay, Parking was only 15$ and right across the street. The inner harbor was only a short (and nice) walk and even tho we walked around at night we did not come across any bad areas. I loved the hotel and the area and plan on returning for another weekend soon!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Expect Much - And The Hotel Delivered What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Walsh
Reviews.Content: We had certificates for two free nights at any Radisson Hotel. We received these as a result of problems at a Radisson Hotel in London in 2009 -- problems I've long since forgotten. These certificates have been languishing on my desk. Her Ladyship and I had to go to Johns Hopkins Medical in Baltimore, so I thought this was a good opportunity to use these certificates. I read the reviews of the Lord Baltimore on Trip Advisor and had some trepidation -- but one reviewer correctly said that, in life, you generally get what you pay for. As a result, I booked a Club Level room and said that I would happily pay the difference between the certificate value and a suite. I e-mailed the hotel directly -- twice -- using the e-mail address for the actual hotel on the Radisson website. I never received a reply. When we arrived, after a long drive from Vermont, our reservation was in the system -- but the young lady at the front desk knew nothing about my e-mail messages. She took our two certificates and gave us keys to what they call a "junior suite" on the 18th floor. When we were shown to the room we first went (in retrospect) to the small living room. The fold-away bed from the couch was open, and the lights were off. You can imagine our initial horror when we entered a small room with a fold-out bed. The bellman turned on the lights, and then had to go around to the other room -- the actual bedroom -- to open the locked interconnecting door. It's as though we weren't expected. The other bedroom was fine, except for an upholstered bench that had been placed at the foot of the bed -- meaning there was about six inches to squeeze between bench and cabinet holding the TV. The room was tired -- although not frayed. I'd say more faded than frayed. It was clean. Bathrooms were unspectacular. I was unable to take a shower because each of the two small bathrooms had a shower/tub combination, and the floor of the tub was very slippery. On night 1 (of 2) the toilets kept spontaneously flushing. Fortunately Her Ladyship and I are heavy sleepers, and were tired from the road trip to Baltimore. On the evening of night 2 I called Guest Services, using the button on the phone, and asked the lady who answered the phone to please make reservations for us at the Rusty Scupper. She said that the food at this restaurant 'wasn't good," and recommended another restaurant. I listened to her sales pitch: her recommended restaurant did not have a view of the water. I explained that the Rusty Scupper might be a "tourist" restaurant, and might not have the best food, but Her Ladyship and I wanted a view of the water. I told her to please make reservations at my choice at 8:00 PM and to call me if there were any problems. I also asked her to have maintenance repair the toilet while we were out at dinner. She told me I should stop by the front desk and request this. I couldn't understand why Guest Services couldn't take ownership of this problem and get it fixed. When we got to the restaurant -- it was a pleasant walk -- there was no sign of our reservation. The restaurant was happy to accommodate us, and even gave us a free appetizer to show us the food was good. (It was -- all of it. And great service -- and view.) When we got back to the room we just shut the doors to both bathrooms. The bed is a "sleep number" bed. I like gadgets and was looking forward to playing with the settings. I could only find that two worked: rock hard and very soft. I won't be running out to buy one of these beds for our home. On the morning of our check-out we thought we'd have the complimentary continental breakfast in the lounge. Very strange stuff: no orange juice, for example. Only what appeared to be prune juice. We also found we were locked out of our room, and were given the explanation that "this happens a lot" -- as though the hotel had no control whatsoever over its own software. We spoke to an Assistant Manager and he was extremely apologetic and even helped us with our few bags. He took notes of our comments and promised to follow-up. He was very impressive -- but it's too bad the rest of the hotel fell short. I wouldn't stay here again, and wouldn't recommend it. The location was fine -- but there were lots of other hotels with (essentially) the same location. We didn't run out the door screaming, but when we return to Johns Hopkins Medical in January I think we'll try another hotel. (Oh, almost forgot. Unlike others we didn't have a view of an alleyway, but of Baltimore. I think. There was so much condensation between the panes of our two double-glazed windows we couldn't really see anything.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer service, quaint and charming...”
Reviews.Author: DebC210
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was a little concerned when I won this hotel on priceline. It turned out to be a great hotel. Great customer service. The room was clean. This hotel is for those who like character and personality (people who like B&Bs) as opposed to the sterile brand new hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, great staff - need new beds”
Reviews.Author: SGM1071
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for a business trip recently -- stayed there last year as well for the same meeting. Last year was unremarkable - I didn't love the bed, but I didn't hate it. This year, the staff stood out for their attention to my special requests - I had 3 people follow up to make sure that my pillows were replaced with non-feather ones due to allergies. Unfortunately, the sleep number bed in my room was AWFUL. I was only staying for one night, or I would have requested to be moved. The bed was possessed and I woke up in the middle of the night to find it set at 100! It was at 60 when I went to sleep. I had, and still have, a horrible neck/back ache that I am attributing to that bed. You could feel the place where it inflated/deflated through the top of the mattress. The valet service was also incredibly slow. I waited almost 20 minutes to get my car, and there was no one waiting ahead of me. Thankfully, someone made a mistake and neglected to charge me the $31 valet fee. :) If I have this meeting next year, I will be staying at another hotel -- the sleep number beds are miserable and as long as Radisson has them, I will be staying elsewhere whenever I have the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the lobby, richly detailed and restored Beaux Art style”
Reviews.Author: bauthentic
Reviews.Content: Hallways and rooms are tired and need updates. Our beds - those "Number" beds that allow you to "puff up" or deflate the bed to your specifications, were simply terrible. Either they were beyond their useable life or they were never good quality to begin with. Management would have offered to move us to a room with regular beds but we had assumed, since we were in separate rooms and each had the same bedding, that we were stuck with our rooms. So we should have made a complaint at the time and did not. Valet personnel were attentive and efficient; same for bellman. Property exudes a faded grandeur that is appealing. We did not try the bar. Stayed only one night. Value for price (paid ahead) was okay. Parking fee $31.00 a bad surprise.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, mediocre room”
Reviews.Author: ker_10
Reviews.Content: stayed several nights for a conference. The location is very convenient for getting to the conference center. Room was okay, but drab and worn. One of the mattresses had a giant dent when I arrived. It had to be re-inflated every night(!) in order to keep a decent shape. Staff at desk were generally nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: julie h
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lord Baltimore hotel for one night from Sept 30 to Oct 1. I was there with my mother along with hundreds and hundreds of other women attending a conference at the arena. As you can imagine, having so many people attempt check in at similar times could have been confusing. I had dropped my mom off to check in while I handled the parking situation. She was checked in almost immediately--despite the large crowds in the lobby. I was misinformed about what I needed to self park by one of the attendants outside and had to temporarily park and come into the hotel. I was greeted by Jay Staley who was on duty trying to make sure everyone was taken care of. I explained what was going on and he immediately took my keys and told me not to worry and he would take care of the valet parking. He conferred with Anthony who then quickly handled everything. Even the following day, we had the privilege of thanking Jay when we say him in the morning, and Anthony quickly recognized us when we called for our car and our car seemed to be immediately brought to us. We encountered a minor heating/air conditioning issue in that the heat was never switched on in our room, We called the desk and within about 10 minutes, two lovely gentlemen where in the room fixing the problem. I had also called the front desk to inquire about breakfast options, Kevin, who was the manager on duty was able to quickly look up our reservations and provide the necessary vouchers. Breakfast was lovely, We had envisioned mass chaos with so many women trying to get to the same place at the same time, but it was actually quiet and relaxing. I did not get the man's name who was in the restaurant seating folks, but he was also great. He was rapidly getting people what they needed, aiding the wait staff in order to keep the morning going, knowing all were pressed for time. The hotel lobby is very nicely decorated. The building itself is older in style, the rooms smaller sized, but very clean and with sleep number beds that were comfortable. THe valet parking is $31 or you can self park--around the corner and across the street for $15. On my next visit to Baltimore, I will definitely consider the Radisson as my first choice !

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not brand new, but DOES have some old world charm++”
Reviews.Author: Moostro
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews, but still took a chance for a group of my friends by booking at the Lord Baltimore. My guess is you get what you pay for. If you pay for the cheapest room, it might not be the best in the house! I was impressed and pleased with our choice. LOCATION. It was convenient to the Inner Harbor and its attractions. We were in a group walking around late at night and had no trouble. About 4 blocks away, though, there seemed to be the local red light district. BUILDING. I am not sure what the history of the building is, but it has some elegance, albeit from 60+ years ago. The lobby ceiling is quite stunning. Old elevator door "sills" are problematic - make sure to watch your step, and your bag going in and out of the elevator - the flloor is NOT level. ROOM. I was in a business class room, and as an Carlson Club elite member was granted club privileges, which I only used once for breakfast. Breakfast was in a small area on an upper floor (17, I think) and only had places for maybe 12 people to sit. The room was very adequate, with lots of room to work, a free bottle of water, free internet access, and great amenities in the bathroom. I love the nubby shaped bath body bar soap. I saw one of my friend's non-business class corner room, and it had lots of light. My room actually looked out into next door brick buildings and was quite dark, with ZERO view. STAFF. Front desk was VERY friendly and warming. Concierge helped get us taxis, and give directions. Breakfast attendant on Club floor was very polite, and always cleaning. Suggestion to hotel: In countries where tea is of great importance, they always have milk available for the tea. As a coffee drinker, I appreciate having milk in my coffee. There are small packets of milk which do not require refrigeration. Same as the half&half packets, but taste much better: UHT milk packets. (One brand is Parmalat)

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: JHH52723
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights here, and we were pleased with the hotel and staff. Rooms were clean and modern for such a landmark hotel. Parking was underground in a lot across the street. Bar was friendly, as were the bell staff. all in all, a good place to stay in baltimore

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Don't buy the negativity.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler733
Reviews.Content: I was nervous when I got this hotel on priceline. I saw the low ratings from some people and was thinking I had been duped. I was relieved to see that my initial concerns were totally unfounded. The hotel looks beautiful from the outside, and has a spacious lobby with gilded armchairs and vaunted ceilings. The check-in was fast and easy. Have an issue with the room? Just in case, they OKed me switching rooms if I didn't like what I got. That wasn't to be. The room had a large bed, nice desk with free wireless Internet. The bathrooms were clean and spacious, including novelty showering items. There's even a convenient and cheap breakfast place that's right in the hotel. 5 bucks for oatmeal and a toasted bagel is a steal to me! The location is close to the Inner Harbor, but I would agree to be careful when walking at night. Baltimore Street also overlaps with the strip clubs, so it's easy to turn a wrong corner and enter the sketchiness. Overall? Don't worry about this place. It's good and conveniently located. The people who hated on it so much might have their reasons, but in my perspective, I have no idea what they were talking about. And if you don't like your room - SWITCH!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some awkwardness.”
Reviews.Author: jpgpsu
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on priceline. Needed 2 rooms and at check in we were able to get connecting rooms which was great. First issue was that we couldn't easily any signs that said "check-in" or "lobby" so at first we didn't know where to pull up. After check in, they directed us to the parking garage which was about 10 minute drive across the street because of where the entrance is and the one way streets. Went up to the room and it smelled a little musty. The shower sprayed and leaked really bad past the curtain. They did have Sleep Number beds in the room. Mine was either broken or something. I have never slept on one before but it felt like an air mattress. I tried adjusting the number and the pump made noise but didn't seem to do anything. Not a good night sleep. I would probably stay there again because over all it was clean, but maybe some more attention to details would help.

Reviews.Title: “Do-over seriously needed....”
Reviews.Author: Hubwanderer
Reviews.Content: While the staff at this hotel is really pleasant, the hotel itself is at least 10 years overdue for a refit..... everything aside from the lobby is pretty shabby, hallways hadn't been properly vacuumed in weeks (trash strewn all over my floor) and my room smelled faintly of mold/must, and had a fridge unplugged in the middle of the room. Definitely will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel but in need of a face lift”
Reviews.Author: KatieLB
Reviews.Content: Probably once a grand hotel of a bygone era, but not now. Located just a few blocks from the inner harbour, a 10 minute walk. There are a number of homeless people around the hotel, which can make you feel a little uneasy walking around at night, so we avoided going out and about in the evening. The room was adequate, but the bathroom looked in need of an update, as the wallpaper was peeling and there was some mould and it could have been cleaner! The bed was very comfortable. The adjacent coffee bar in the hotel was a bit tatty. Overall, an ok hotel, but don't expect top class luxury. Really needs an overhaul, as lots of alternative smarter hotels and it will be left behind if no improvements are made soon!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: dfgdave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were guests of the sponsor of an Indy car for the Baltimore Grand Prix. Since the invite was relatively last minute I did some scrambling to find a hotel. After some on-line searching I came across this hotel. Of course I read the reviews and was a little apprenhensive. I called the hotel direct, asked about their location to the Grand Prix track and about their parking. The woman that answered the phone at the front desk was very acommodating and I had a good feeling about the place. We live in the Philadelphia area so driving to Baltimore was no big deal. We arrived and were immediately welcomed by a nice gentleman out front. I told him I wasn't sure if I was going to valet park or self par and he said no problem, go inside and check in and then let me know what you decide. When asked about leaving my car out front he said it was no problem until we decided. BTW, I did decide to self park. He opened the door and we were welcomed by a classical lobby and friendly front desk people. We got a slight upgrade on the room that I had requested on their website when I made the reservations. $15 extra a night for a corner room. It had windows on the two outside walls as well as one in the bath. It made the room feel very spacious. The first thing I did was check out the bathroom since there seemed to be a consistent complaint about the cleanliness. No problem here. The bath was very clean and tidy. The bath ammenities were of high quality and the towels plentiful. The TV was not a flat panel but I am not in a hotel to watch TV so that has no effect on my rating. The bed was a Sleep Number bed and one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel. We were greeted everytime we left and returned to the hotel. The quaint bar was friendly and had very reasonable wines by the glass. Even the little cafe had good food and the prices were not jacked up due to a large event happening in the city. I had no problems with the garage a few short blocks away and felt safe walking to and from it. Baltimore is a city and there are some homeless that one will encounter but nothing agressive or untoward. Our check-out was pleasant, no unexpected surprises, and my wife and I both commented to the staff as we were leaving that we'll be staying there next year, as long as there is another Grand Prix race in Baltimore. Keep up the good work, smiles and helpfulness people of Radisson Plaza Lord Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Fire the Maid Service”
Reviews.Author: NadineTheQueen
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel with beautiful architecture, solid walls and large rooms. The door men were wonderful, helpful and friendly. The front desk help was the same. However, the glow was over when we entered the guest room. The room was musty smelling. The bathroom floor has long black hairs and a beer bottle cap on the back of the toilet. What was that about? The headboard, walls and end tables hadn't been dusted in ages and the carpet felt so gurbby I had to wear shoes the entire time I ws there. Old hotels like this should be a jewel. This could be a jewel if only the cleaning crew had pride in their work and the owners cared more.

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: Lprice335
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the potential to be a really great grand hotel. Sadly no one seems to want to take care of this hotel. Our room was dirty, dirty carpet, dirty bathroom (hair clogging the bath tub....) The staff was fine, but the dirtyness of the hotel is just shocking...

Reviews.Title: “Watch out with Valet guys!!!”
Reviews.Author: gpas54
Reviews.Content: Here is my overall review sent back to the Radisson Hotel questionnaire that I received via email. I am writing this because I have gotten no feedback from the hotel management from the below complaint. "I parked my car at the front entrance on the side street. There I did not have a good feeling letting valet park my car. So I unpacked my luggage myself and checked in my room. As I returned back to my car I noticed a line of concrete that laid perpendicular to the street that my car was parked on. I followed the line of concrete debris to discover concrete debris on the roof of my truck (there was a walking bridge above where the concrete dropped from). I brought this to the attention of the 1-3 doorman and they said they saw nothing which further infuriated me. There was no guidance as to protocol. I later reported this to the front desk and they called security to fill out a report. Report was done with *** *** and He said he was going to get back to me that day(the day I checked in the hotel). I received no call back on my 3 day stay nor was I able to reach *** or ****** Hampton when I called to follow up. I would greatly appreciate to get some sort of call back for this. Staying on the topic and with your valet service. I was very lucky I did not ask your valet to get my car. Why you ask? Well As I was getting mt car out of the garage I notice a screaming Porsche boxter that was next to me as I was driving out of the garage parking house. This Porsche was weaving his engine and screeching his tires weaving through traffic. As I was driving back to the hotel to get my baggage to put in my car, I notice that in this Porsche Boxter was the hotel valet guy dropping off the boxter to a guest who checked out. I must say I was pretty shocked. I came close to catching up to the owner of the boxter to tell him how his car was abused by your valet guy, but I didn't and I feel guilty that I didn't say anything."

Reviews.Title: “I can forgive one or two missed hairs in the corner of the bathroom...”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Phil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a room where the bathroom floor completely covered with hair! The shower walls were had mildew stains and the carpet was awful. I don’t think the room was vacuumed between guests. In one area there was a sticky stain that my shoe stuck to. I half suggested to my husband we stay somewhere else but we were there for just two nights and we were only looking for a place to sleep since we were just finishing up our trip and we were going to be busy, so I thought we could save some money. We should have left. I booked the using Hotwire and ended up getting the room for $61 a night. Hotwire ranked it a 3 star place. We pulled in not realizing, that they don't have their own parking garage. There was an option for valet, but we were just checking in, dropping our bags and leaving. We decided to self-park. As I checked in, my husband was going to park the car in the garage. The parking garage entrance was two blocks away! I can say the price was reasonable ($15 /day), however don’t be fooled, the stairwell /escalator reeked of urine and this area wasn’t the best place to be at night. We checked in and the lobby appeared historic and probably very nice at one time very long ago. It smelled a little musty and the floor looked a little dirty. The staff was friendly but not very efficient. We dropped our luggage in the room without really inspecting it and left. We booked this hotel for the locality; we were headed to an Orioles game and opted for a hotel within walking distance, as I wrote earlier it wasn’t the best place to be at night, but we arrived at our room safely. It’s at this time we notice the bathroom floor and carpet. We called the front desk and she sent someone up to clean the floor. I can forgive one or two missed hairs in the corner, but this was ridiculous! I didn’t notice the shower walls or shower curtain until the next morning. The shower walls and curtain both had mildew. We will not stay here again the housekeeping was subpar. Pros -Close to Oriole park -Comfortable bed (we didn’t have a sleep number like most Radisson Hotels) Cons -housekeeping was terrible -old and musty -not a great neighborhood -horrible parking -small cramped elevators -outdated décor in room -old TV with crappy remote As I was getting this posted, I noticed someone else had the same experience with the hair in May 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in Baltimore - old hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: billhinge
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here prior to going to Baltimore from the UK I wasn't sure what to expect. Having stayed there while attending a business conference in the Bay Sheriton in July (17-22nd) I need not have worried.The hotel is an old art deco style hotel but the interior is clean and well serviced, my bedroom was large and well appointed. The staff were very helpful and friendly and I have no complaints in that respect. Some hotel areas could do with a slight lick of paint and brightening up but nothing too bad, if the hotel was closer to the bay then I'm sure the owners would spend the money to make it the top hotel in Baltimore as it does have a day gone by character lacking in many modern hotels When I first arrived I came via shuttle through the less glamorous part of town and wasn't sure what to expect. The Bay is just a 5 or 10 minute walk down hill in a straight line, shops are about 5 or 10 mins walk also so no worries there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel, and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LaraB8
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a conference and was worried after reading the reviews on this site but I must say I have nothing but good to say about the place. We received excellent customer services and it is in an excellent location very close to the harbour. The rooms are slightly dated but were cleaned everyday. Nothing bad to say except wish we would have got a bag from the very lovely lady on reception, big hello to you from sunny London for a change (the crazy London girls with the tattoos and thing for number 8...)

Reviews.Title: “Beware of fraudulent charges.”
Reviews.Author: Worryfree1
Reviews.Content: They have charged my credit card four times for a fee... I have called five times.. They politely refund my money and then recharge my card again... Maybe they were hoping I didn't pay attention to bank statements.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Clean”
Reviews.Author: jenevieve24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raddison in Baltimore for one night. The room and hotel were very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was good. The only downsides to the hotel are the location and parking. The free parking is off-site, surrounded by tall buildings with little lighting. The hotel is a bit of a walk to the actual inner harbor and not one of the most comforting walks, expecially when traveling with children...just did not feel 100% safe when walking.

Reviews.Title: “Did not like my stay at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotel723
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel through Expedia for a room with a double bed. Upon arrival at the hotel we were given a room with a Queen size bed. It was not what I asked paid for. The hotel changed our room for one with a King size bed, which would have been okay except the the toilet nearly overflowed and we had to call for maintenance to fix the toilet. I was disappointed that we had to pay for parking. Hotel was not three blocks from the Inner Harbor. We were located on the 6th floor, not all of the elevators stopped on six, you would have to press the 7th floor so we could get off on the 6 floor. The flyers for the attractions were not in sight they hidded in the corner of the hotel away from the reservation desk on the other side of the floor. The room was not clean the next day until 4:30 pm. We could not recline and rest before going out that evening. The staff at the front desk was very pleasant. The overall rating for my stay at the hotel in poor.

Reviews.Title: “NIce place, would go back.”
Reviews.Author: shortsnooper
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive after reading several not so nice reviews. However - we were pleasantly surprised. The front desk was very courteous and helpful, the hotel itself is in a great location, nicely decorated, close to the harbor and downtown. They were quite busy, but it was never noisy. Our room was neat, clean and comfortable, bathroom was really roomy. Our room was close to the elevators, but we were not bothered by the noise. We would stay again if back in town. I would use a parking garage vs the valet parking - we paid $8 to park overnite not the $32 they charge.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel stay i have ever had”
Reviews.Author: drmariag
Reviews.Content: i stayed there last weekend. valet didnt come to car, stood in line over 1 hour to get room key, went to room to find someone else already staying in room, waited another 3 hours for a room, bathroom wasnt clean, still had dirty soap and shampoo from previous stay, then they charged my card for valet that was supposed to be free. only good thing was nick the bartender and the bar managers that night. my coworker went to 7 occupied rooms the whole time i waited at the bar. she had more patience than i did. i would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone. only saving grace were the valets, concierge, and food managers. they at least attempted to make the stay enjoyable while the front desk made a disaster out of the accomodations. too bad because the location is prime. located so close to stadium, inner harbor, and stadium. all the ammenities but definitely lacking in service.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not impressed”
Reviews.Author: kristeep
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in order to tour Baltimore and see Washington D.C. The housekeeping staff was atrocious. A maid who could barely speak English broke something in our room. We entered the room and she stood at our door and said call front desk and then pointed at the towel rack that she broke off the wall. We asked her why she didn't call the front desk herself since she broke it and she said no...you...call front desk. The air conditioner in our room was nonexistent- it did not blow out any air at all. The bed was one of those sleep number beds except that it was so old that it wouldn't cooperate and your back would just completely sink in. Finally, our window was off the track and half hanging over the side alley of the hotel. I was convinced that it was going to fall out onto the street and that we would be charged with it. I really wasn't impressed with the neighborhood either. I did get this hotel off of priceline so at least I can say that I only paid 70 dollars a night versus what you would normally pay but I wouldn't have paid 20 dollars for that room. They need to totally revamp this hotel because it is very old and get staff that want to provide good customer service. The reason to go to a hotel is to relax and enjoy the experience and we definitely did not do this at the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - WORST EXPERIENCE WE'VE EVER HAD!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SariRabi
Reviews.Content: We originally opted for this hotel as we were excited to visit the city for the first time and see Camden Yards. We needed a place that was pet-friendly since we were traveling with my dog. It seemed to be a great value online - historical building, great location, and pet-friendly. We booked and were so excited for our weekend get away. Little did we know that it would be anything but. First of all, THE PICTURES ONLINE ARE MISLEADING. The place does have a musty smell and could use some renovations. However, I wasn't really turned off by that because I still thought that the architecture and historical feel was almost a treat. Secondly, I WOULDN'T CALL THEM "PET-FRIENDLY". We called for an early check-in a few days before and while we were on the way. They told us that they could not do anything until we got there. I explained to them that we had a dog, so we'd really appreciate having an early check-in so that we could have a place while we toured around the inner harbor. I even offerred to pay an additional amont (in addition to their over-priced pet fee). They wouldn't budge. Also, there is no place to walk your dog, except for a small strip of grass down the street. The security officer at that building yelled at us, eventhough we cleaned up after our dog. Not too pet-friendly to me. Also, see my notes on the drugs below. Third, WATCH OUT FOR THEM TRYING TO UNNECESSARILY CHARGE YOU FOR PARKING. Although parking was included with our reservation, they tried charging us again. I had to pull out my reservation confirmation (thank goodness I had it) to haggle over this as well. Their parking deck is not really convenient or safe, but at this point, I was fine with it because we were able to get early check-in afterall and barely avoided paying for parking twice. Fourth, IT IS SOOOO SKETCHY. It wasn't too bad during the day, but I didn't feel comfortable or safe being outside the hotel at night. On our walk back from the baseball game, we saw people smoking weed, guys selling weed, and many females trying to sell themselves...I could go on and on.
