I was pregnant at the time and really felt unsafe. My husband even wished he had his gun when we walked to that strip of grass to take the dog out when we returned. Fifth, CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS SO BAD THAT WE CALLED THE POLICE TWICE! We returned to our room at the end of the night exhausted and ready to get some sleep. However, there was a family reunion going on in the ballroom across the hall, which was playing music rediculously LOUD! We couldn't even sleep. There were people hanging out in the hallway. We went downstairs and requested a room change, and the manager told us there was nothing they could do. Really? Nothing? No other room? No possible room at the nearby Radisson? He wouldn't even give us our money back so that we could go elsewhere. The manager had no control over the building and the family reunion and all of their local friends had taken over the ballroom, the lobby, the hallways. I told the manager that it was so late that the noise had to be in violation of a noise ordinance and that, if he didn't do anything, I would call the police if he didn't do anything. He said we would comp the pet fee, which was not enough at that point. I called the police when we returned to our room. While we were waiting for the police to arrive... Finally, WE COULD SMELL MARIJUANA IN OUR ROOM AND IN THE HALLWAY. It was clearly being smoked in several rooms on the floor. Keep in mind I was PREGNANT and had my dog with me. Breathing in marijuana was NOT something that could be tolerated. I called the manager. The manager, knowing I was pregnant, told me there was nothing he could do, so I called the police AGAIN! The manager was clearly flustered and seemed like he knew he was in trouble. Instead of righting the wrong, he decided to throw us out of the hotel. Clearly, it was a move to save his job. So at about 2:30 am, me, my husband, my dog, and my unborn child were excorted out of the hotel while an illegal, out-of-control party was going on all around us. The manager re-charged the pet fee to us that he previously comped. We also were not credited the fee for the room. Radison corporate finally gave us a certifcate for a one-night stay, which was not close to what we should have received for such a horrific experience.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel and way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: WyHe
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny Bed was uncomfortable Carpets stained Bathroom tile and grout missing HVAC vents broken and ajar on the wall No hair dryer or shampoo and guest services was unresponsive despite three requests Emply electrical wall plates where fixtures had been romoved in the bedroom and the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Outrageously Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Algebrain
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room where there were stains all over the bathroom & walls. I normally would have immediately requested a new room, but the bed seemed fine and we checked in after an exhausting day, so we stuck it out. While the location is great, they take advantage of you by making you pay a ludicrous amount for parking. The valet drivers do not know the price of their own service (one thought the price was "per trip" not "per day"), so make sure you find out for sure before you decide whether you'd like to do it. You might find yourself waiting a while for an elevator, even when there are no crowds. Breakfast buffet is small, but reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: mikeam
Reviews.Content: Just finished my 2nd stay at the Radisson Plaza Lord thru priceline. I was very happy woth both visits. Hotel is old but clean. Staff was fantastic. Location is good for visiting harbor, Camden yards and downtown sites. I walked back to the hotel late both nights and felt completely safe. No problems at all. On my next visit I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Only Expect An Okay Stay At Best”
Reviews.Author: 2010WorldTravel2010
Reviews.Content: I was here for two nights and that was more than enough. I was not expecting anything luxurious as I had stayed in Radissons prior to this trip and realize they are a small step above a budget hotel. Bottom line: This hotel is in great need of renovations and all the amenities are mediocre. PROS - walking distance from the marina - near bus stops and the train CONS - lobby is horrible and had a musty smell. I don't think air circulates well on the first floor. - uncomfortable beds - old rooms (including old bathrooms) ... really, there is not much that is aesthetically pleasing. - poor concierge service. I don't think they are familiar with any place beyond the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: MtngPlnnrsKnwBst
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the National Registry of historic hotels so I thought it would be a good option when I scheduled my trip to Baltimore for a conference. Boy was I wrong. Not a good choice. It's old, in bad need of renovation (dirty walls and frayed carpeting were only the beginning) and, well, here you go . . . Let's start from the beginning . . . the front desk clerk didn't give me adequate instructions on the elevators (there were 5 of them—all numbered 1-18). She failed to tell me that only elevators #1, #2 and #4 went to my floor (17). So, I got on unknowingly got on elevator #3. I rode it up and then back down. I got off, went to the front desk where another desk clerk told me what I should have been told to begin with. So I got on elevator #2 and it did nothing. I got off a third time and was handed over to a bellman who finally got me to my room. I get to my room and . . . it's hot. The air conditioning was set on 85 degrees. So . . . I stood in the hallway for a bit while it warmed up. I was supposed to have a city view. If I stretched my head around to the side of the window that didn't open I could make out the corner of a building and some sky . . . other than that I was about ten feet away from a brick wall of windows. The fun didn't stop there . . . the toilet didn't flush and it was next to impossible to find enough plugs to plug in all my business gadgets (three of them to be exact). I actually picked up the internet wirelessly, but from the hotel next door because it was actually faster. Thank goodness I am a Kimpton (the Hotel Monaco is next door) member and got it for free! I was also not impressed with the hotel's CSR program (or lack thereof). There was no opportunity either in the lobby or in my room to recycle anything, they used bottled water in the rooms, and standard lightbulbs rather than CFL bulbs. In this day in age, not the way to impress a business traveler in the meeting and event planning industry. The biggest positive of the stay? The bed was wonderfully comfortable. Sleep number--which I had never slept on before but may purchase because of the night sleep I had here. Day 2, however, was more of the same. I went for a run in the morning and came back to a 10 minute wait at the elevator because only elevator #3 was working properly. Elevators #1, #2, and #4 (remember from earlier--those are the ones that go to floor 17) didn't seem to be moving at all, so I went to the front desk and they again had a bellman help. He took me in elevator #3 to floor 18 and I walked down (no idea why elevator #3 can go to floors 1-16 and 18 but not to 17). Anyway, needless to say things did not improve on the second day. Another positive . . . the paper did arrive very early this morning . . . just the way I like it.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at a Radisson again”
Reviews.Author: pthomas32999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible. My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a week and it was by far the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel. There happened to be a heat wave when we were in Baltimore and the air conditioning in the lobby of the hotel was non-existent. It was literally about 100 degrees in the lobby. We had the air conditioning in our room on high for the entire week and it was barely cool in our room. Customer service was also horrible. We called to find out where we could get ice because we checked five floors in the hotel and there was no ice and the front desk personnel yelled at us and hung up. When we called back and talked to a manager he was apologetic but we had other similar experiences of horrible customer service throughout our stay. The only experience I had with food at this hotel was the food at the wedding reception which my food had a bug in it, so wouldn't recommend eating there either. The hotel is run down and in dire need of updating but since I wrote a letter to corporate about the horrible experience and didn't get a response I don't think corporate Radisson really cares what goes on at this property. I would recommend you stay any place else in the city besides this property.

Reviews.Title: “One Day stay ok”
Reviews.Author: setonmj
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel..we stayed at this location due to its proximity to the 1st Mariner Arena for a concert. The front staff was friendly and checkin was quick and efficient. Our expectations were low because of our previous stay last year and that we were just sleeping over for the night. The room was clean albeit a little chilly with the AC on full blast before our arrival. The thermostat looked a little loose from the wall like the previous stay so they may be some need of updating in that vain. This time the sleep number bed did work. We saved the cost of parking by taking the train from DC and utitlizing a cheaper cab ride back to Penn Station

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: bvnathan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for a conference in October. I was sharing the room with a colleague. Had requested 2 beds upon booking but was given a single upon arrival. Fortunately this didn't take too long to rectify. The hotel has an elegant charm but surely the aesthetic can be maintained without compromising functionality. The elevators were old and slow and the fitness facility was barely functional. The "sleep number" adjustment to the beds didn't work either, but the beds were decent enough so we didn't bother trying to get them to do anything about it. The hotel location is great. Some maintenance and updating would go a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and comfortable conference stay”
Reviews.Author: KKinCali
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several nights to attend a conference at the Baltimore Convention Center. While the hotel is a few (about 4 total) blocks away from the Convention center, for us, the short walk was a nice break in our day to get away from the conference madness. The hotel itself has a large sweeping lobby, and 'old fashioned' elevators - there is a bank of four or five, we never had issues with the elevators like some other reviewers mentioned. The front desk staff and bellmen were all very helpful and friendly, we had no issues at all that they were not willing to help us with. The room was spacious, plenty of room for two people with luggage. The wireless internet (which is free) was fast, although the bathroom in our room was a little bit small. We had a room with a small window, although it overlooked the inner walls of the hotel - this is an old building, so the rooms don't have large windows at the far end of the room like most 'modern' hotels do. I did order room service one evening when I came back from all day at my conference and the very nice kitchen staff let me order off of the breakfast menu, even though it was 10 pm. The french toast and hasbrowns were very good - just what I wanted! The parking is $15/day for self parking, although they do have their own ramp/garage. Our parking tickets (that let you in and out of the parking facility) did de-magnetize one day, which the front desk did not warn us about. It was a mistake that took a while to fix, and what keeps us from giving the hotel a better rating. Overall, if I needed to stay downtown in Baltimore, I would look at this hotel again, but I won't be running back here to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....Would stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: rozziej
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson Plaza Lord Baltimore the weekend of June 3rd (Capital Jazz Festival). The location was great. It was within walking distance to the Inner Harbor and about a 20 minute car ride to Columbia, MD where the Capital Jazz Festival was held. The rooms were nice, neat and clean. Great view of Baltimore's skyline from our room window (18th floor). Nice breakfast along with evening cocktails/light refreshments. Pros: Location, Friendly Staff, Nice lobby (old world charm) and nice rooms. Cons: Parking across the street (no big deal to me) if you do not utilize valet. Overall, My husband and I were quite satisfied with the experience and would stay again and recommend to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Would definately Return!”
Reviews.Author: madison122
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on hotwire and for the price ($70/night) I wasn't disappointed. The location was great! It is within walking distance to Camden Yards, Inner Harbor and the Convention Center. The location provided lots of choices for dinner or drinks. If you would rather not walk, there is a metro stop right out front and a cab stand with several cabs ready and waiting. Pros: Location, Friendly and helpful Staff, Gorgeous lobby and nice rooms, free wifi was easy to access and fast. Cons: Parking is Across the Street (but no big deal because of the hotel's central location), the toilet had to be flushed a few times (perhaps because of the hotel's age?), the elevators got crowded on check-out day Overall I satisfied with the experience and would stay there again. The location cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Inner Harbor and Attractions”
Reviews.Author: Sadiecruiser
Reviews.Content: We were a family of four visiting Baltimore for the first time and were pleased with our stay at the Radisson Plaza Lord Baltimore. The two rooms we had were small but had everything we needed. The location was perfect for us, it was an easy walk to the Inner Harbor and all of the attractions. The sleep number bed was fine for two nights but I wouldn't want one.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad......If the Price is Right”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Huxtable
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay at this hotel this past Memorial Day weekend. Booked the hotel through Hotwire for only $71 for the night. A great steal. I wasn't expecting a Ritz Carlton or the Wynn from the Radisson Lord Baltimore. My expectations were quite correct. Overall, not a bad place for the value. Positives: Great location, only 3 blocks away from the Inner Harbor, access to the Baltimore Subway as well as bus stops for most of the crosstown bus routes are less than 30 feet from the hotel entrance, First Mariner Arena is a block away, a very courteous & accommodating front desk staff (despite having full occupancy due to the Death Metal concert & Lacrosse Tournament that was occurring on the same day. How ironic!). As for the room itself, it wasn't half bad. We had a nice view of the Baltimore Skyline. The hotel also has free Wi-Fi, albeit slow as molasses. Im sure in 1928 this hotel was a showpiece that rivaled any hotel south of NYC. Negatives: The hotel is old. Plain and simple. The A/C unit controls in our room as well as the bathroom decor was a throwback to when Jimmy Carter was president. The Sleep Number beds were OK but loud when you attempted to turn them on. The wallpaper was literally coming apart from the wall. The modern decor & accoutrements of most newer hotels are not available at the Radisson Lord Baltimore. The room could also use a nice cleaning from the carpet to the sticky guest book that had gunk all over its pages. The hotel valet staff is severely undermanned & somewhat clueless. Also, what hotel in a major American city has a taxi stand that literally shuts down after 9 pm?? Finally, Beware the elevators anytime close to check out time. We attempted to beat the rush around 11 AM and still had to wait 12 minutes for an elevator to the lobby. . Overall, I'd recommend the hotel only if you get it at the Hotwire price. Any higher than that, I'd say skip it and stay at the Hotel Monaco or the Hilton. **Like most major cities, Baltimore has some sketchy parts that those from more rural parts of the country (ie.Flyover Country) may find somewhat "scary." This hotel is located in a particular location that brings out the best & worst of the local gentry. No cause for alarm. However, wandering the streets surrounding the hotel at 3 AM with a Tiffany necklace on & a pocketbook full of priceless gems is not advised**

Reviews.Title: “Consider the Sleep Number Bed...”
Reviews.Author: littlemascara3
Reviews.Content: Spacious enough room for 2, bathroom was fine and clean (except the shower temp controls were extremely particular!). There was a closet, desk space, parking for $15/day (self park) at a lot across the street (or valet for $30something/day?). When making the hotel reservation, the fact that the room had a "Sleep Number" bed was specified more than once. I said "yeah, sure I'll take it", since I'd never tried one before. I don't know how other people feel about it, but the bed felt more like an air mattress than anything else. I may as well have either BYOB (bring your own bed, that is) or been camping, because I had the worst night sleep. My partner and I switched sides the second night which I may have helped? Or maybe it was all mental... Just something to be aware of!

Reviews.Title: “Really a great hotel, and a pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: EW188
Reviews.Content: Contrary to a lot of reviews, I had a great stay at this Radisson. I had an event at First Mariner Arena, so I chose this hotel because of the location (a block away) and the good price on Hotwire. The desk staff was very friendly. The self parking at $15 in the garage across the street is a fair value, considering I was able to leave the car there for the day and during the event (you get 24 hours in and out privilege). Yes, this is an old hotel, but it definitely has charm and is different. Take a look at the lobby ceiling, it's beautiful. The quiet lobby had some places to sit, but I did not get a chance to sample the restaurants because we were only there one night. Sure, some aspects of the room are aging, but I found it to be neat and well kept. The TV is a 19" tube and while having only 20-something channels, had all of the channels I cared for. The room has old fashioned furniture that gives it character. The bathroom was sufficient, and I must comment that water pressure was great and hot water was scorching (but adjustable). The rooms are a little small, but remember, this is a hotel that was built in 1928. Used the internet access briefly and found that it was fast and reliable, and free. My last comment is that in an old building such as this, sleep is bliss. Our room didn't have much of a view, and faced nothing but a wall, but the serenity was great. Totally quiet all night! Overall, a great stay, a good value through Hotwire, and a wonderful choice for my event at the arena. No, it's not quite on the harbor, but if it's near a convention or event you are attending, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here if you need Internet access”
Reviews.Author: jay5723
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Wednesday, around 3pm, for a five-night stay. In the first room (on the 8th floor) WiFi was only available right next to the door (tested on iPhone, iPad, Windows PC), so we asked to move rooms. The new room was on the third floor. Here, there was WiFi all over the room, but no access to the Internet. We reported it to the front desk, who said they would get the network reset. So we went to work in the lobby, around 5pm. The net access there was very intermittent, until around 7pm, when it finally stabilized. I must admit I would have checked out at this point, but it was an inclusive deal that could not be cancelled - always something to beware of, I suppose. The net was o.k. on Thursday and Friday, but on Sunday it was again impossible to get to the web for around two hours, from noon onwards. We reported it to the front desk three times, who said they would get an engineer to investigate, but with no result. As the Radisson trades heavily on its high-speed internet access in its advertising, and this was the deciding factor in choosing this hotel over others in Baltimore, I am very disappointed - both with the poor quality service, and the slow response time when problems were reported.

Reviews.Title: “Confused on how I feel...”
Reviews.Author: travelerRN83
Reviews.Content: Came to Baltimore for the NAON Nursing conference. I wanted to stay somewhere different than what was recommended by the organization. Somewhere with an old charm. This hotel (I'm still booked in as we speak, sitting with my iPad at the lounge, having an amazing Long Island Iced Tea drink, a delicious turkey burger, and an amazing warm chocolate cake, about to book out tomorrow 5/18) offers that old American charm of the 20's and 30's. This is a 3 star hotel in a building that could make it a 5 star hotel. The service is more than acceptable. The staff is polite and attentive. The minute you step in, you are welcomed by music from the 20's and 30's... Adding to that charm of history (and as per rumor, and which i love, the place is haunted by ghosts. And what is strange is, the 3 nights I have been here, I keep dreaming of a screaming child in a white gown... And I just read online that this place is supposedly haunted by such a child). The room is fairly big, comfortable, and I'm in love with the Number Bed. But, as much as I loved the place at first site (I just turned 28, but I do love these old places), certain things have me confused. Confused on whether I love this hotel or not. Besides the fact that the food is good, incredibly affordable, and the place is close to places of interest, there are quite a few cons... First, the gym. It's convenient to have a gym and it's one of the reasons why I booked this place, but the weights equipment need replacement. As my partner say, "We better don't use this bench press or we'll end up in The Final Destination 5 Movie". I was a bit disappointed not to be offered a room upgrade. I booked this place for $150/night... By the time I checked rates before booking, they were offering for $99. So, I thought they would upgrade me, but they never offered even though I'm an American Express card holder. Also, where is the fridge... No fridge?!! And the fact that they are a 3 star hotel should be no excuse. Another thing that has surprised me, especially about Baltimore, is the amount of people asking you for coins on the streets! Around this location this is nonstop! But, the fact that they allow this people in here to use the bathrooms disturbs me... I understand that when hotels are recognized as historical places, their lobbies become kind of public, at least that's how it is in NYC so I assume here is the same, but, The Plaza Hotel would never allow the type of people I'm watching come in here to use the bathroom in the lobby.... What is up with that? When we checked in, someone quite scary got off the elevator and it just gave me the worst inpretion. But now, I understand why... Now, my question is (hopefully management is reading this) how do you allow these folks in? What if they go upstairs to the rooms and hallways???? After tonight, sitting here enjoying my amazing long island ice tea (oh yeah, the bartender should let people know what is not part of the happy hour "premium" drinks, but still, he's a good guy. Everyone forget things at times.) and eating my great burger, and chocolate cake, I'm kind of glad I'm leaving tomorrow... This area doesn't feel safe.... This hotel doesn't feel safe with the kind of people they let in this place... Would I stay here again...? Yes, as long as they learn to recognize worthy customers, and their security improves... Oh, a tip for you guys: the air refreshener you use in your hallways (smells amazing), should be used in the elevators too. They are old (which adds to that antique charm), but when you allow those people who are asking for money outside to come in and use them, the smell is just too much... I could not recommend this place until security improves...

Reviews.Title: “not what I expected.. in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: justagirl019
Reviews.Content: so after reading reviews, I was expecting the absolute worst. nope! it was clean, comfortable, spacious. everything you need. I'm not sure what others expect when they go to a hotel, but i loved it. i got a great price on getaroom. they had all the little soaps, shampoo, conditioners and towels etc. the housekeeping was great! front desk staff was very nice. when we walked in there was an extra cot which they quickly removed after we called. the tv wasn't a flat-screen but thats not necessary. parking was a b too but it wont kill you. i would def stay there again. it was close to the inner harbor and theres a local metro station right across the street. all day pass for 3.50 totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely people”
Reviews.Author: ItalyLover72
Reviews.Content: this is a beautiful hotel with stunning architecture from the 1930's, the rooms are charming, mine had a window in the bathroom as well as the room itself!! The service is great, the people friendly & helpful, the restaurant was excellent - Well above the usual captive audience quality of hotel food. it's a bit farther from the harbor than most tourist hotels but still very walkable Definitely a thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “What a shame”
Reviews.Author: travelteachOntario
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, which gives it a bit of character. As others have said, it definitely shows its age and the beds are a nightmare. We had to have an engineer in to make ours work! But that is not the shame. The shame is that the service is so bad throughout the hotel. Don't get me wrong, the staff are friendly. Just horribly, horribly slow...everywhere, and a little tacky in their constant quest for tips. I waited 45 minutes to check in even though there were only 2 people ahead of me...and, no I'm not exaggerating. The coffee shop, same thing. Wow, I have never had such slow service, including the server chatting on the phone while several of us waited...Indeed, it was so slow that I avoided checking out because there were 3 people in line and I knew what that likely meant. Now for the tacky part. Is a few dollar tip so important to you that you can't allow a 77 year old woman (my mother who was travelling with me) to take a luggage cart? They wouldn't allow her to take it and said she had to go back to the room and call them after which they would bring it up (of course, with their hands out). I'm quite a healthy tipper, when it is deserved but it made me embarrassed for the staff that they were so desperate for tips that they wouldn't allow an elderly woman to take a cart. Wow. Tacky. I definitely won't stay again...even if I get a special rate for a conference again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid THE SLEEP NUMBER BED”
Reviews.Author: KingRalph_64
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old, but that is not necessarily bad. In this case, it is old and bad. Not updated, sleep number horrible beds. Wallpaper and towel racks falling off of the walls in places. TV is 'ancient' (not flat screen) and small. I took a gamble on it due to a very low price through Travelzoo. Less than half other hotels. I hated my visit, however the PEOPLE were quite nice and it's not a bad location if you wish to walk to the Inner Harbor, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Its just okay”
Reviews.Author: handofgod7
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights.The hotel actually looks better from outside than inside. The best thing about staying in the hotel was the sleep number bed.....it was one of the most comfy bed I slept in.Other than that its pretty ordinary and considering its an old national heritage hotel..its very much understood and it seriously needs some renovation. The bistro in the hotel was closed for some reasons which is supposed to be situated downstairs but they were running in the main lobby.We were dead tired the first day we checked in and we were not willing to go out for dinner but I was not impressed with the food or the menu or anything that would make me eat there.SO we went out to get something near the harbor. The carpet needs to be changed, it stinks a little.The AC in the room also need to be fixed...it takes a long time to cool or heat the room. Parking is awfully expensive with 35$ per day, I would suggest not getting a car.The people around the hotel are scary sitting near the Charles st and we tried to get to the hotel before 9 PM .Staff were friendly, and I wouldn't mind staying and sleep in the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Visit Again”
Reviews.Author: Towson_Tiger
Reviews.Content: Before I write this, I just wanted to say I am not one of those people that have high expectations. I stayed at this hotel the day before my cruise was to depart. I was not aware of the $15 parking fee until I got the bill. If I known I there was going to be a parking fee, I would have never invited my friend down the the hotel. I went to the bar and never got waited on, so I walked down the street and got some Chinese food. My sleep number bed didn't work. Very disappointing. The desk chair was broke. The vanity lights were on a very bad slant. The tub had black scuffs in it. The hallway reeked of marijuana. The hallway of my floor, the walls were badly scuffed. The place just needs some major remodeling or something.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed but fine.”
Reviews.Author: saxophonegirl78
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly and gracious. All in all, I don't really need that much in a conference hotel, and it served the purpose just fine. A few things I didn't love: toilet seat in bathroom is peeling. It's made of plastic and the top layer is clearly worn down. My window leaked air like crazy, so I had to run the heater, despite the 50 degree temp outside. Squicked out by the visible insect glue trap under my bed. Saw no bugs, though. Yay! In room coffee- yes! I guess they ran out of stirrers because I had a pen wrapped in a napkin next to the coffee pot for the purpose. Linens are old and pilled- especially the pillow shams. My remote control was filthy, numbers worn off, and only flipped through three channels. While none of these things are really a big deal in the grand scheme of life, they added up to be disappointing. The most unforgivable part of the stay was that the coffee shop downstairs in the lobby ran out of coffee lids and put a soup lid on my $4 cafe mocha. You are a convention center hotel, and you should not be running out of coffee lids while your hotel is full of convention attendees. At 8 am, I'm trying to eat and run, and now I have to worry about dumping a latte on my business attire? C'mon!!! Overall, it's fine, and people were so nice. But the rooms are dated and I do think that management needs to bring it up a notch for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, takes you back in time, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mt35
Reviews.Content: My first reaction when walking into the room was 'can't wait to fire my assistant for choosing this hotel.' We stayed for 5 nights, and he charm of this historic hotel grew on me more each night. The lobby, and the room take you back in time. The good parts: Tony - the concierge, always there with prompt great recommendations; breakfast was nice, i liked the fact that breakfast was served on my floor, 17th floor, very cozy; the afternoon drinks and finger food are a no-miss-thing: very generous, and the staff is very attentative to replenish drinks. Bad sides: bathroom was small, worn out, hence not the best cleaning, wallpaper seemed a tad dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and I get dated but needs a little help...”
Reviews.Author: EBZ01
Reviews.Content: So me and a friend last minute decided to do the tourist thing around Baltimore a few days near the end of February. And I was happy with all of my room but the bathroom. It was PRETTY GROSS, kinda tattered, moldy, dirty shower that the housekeeping lady halfway cleaned and I felt icky everytime I tried to get cleaned. They need to re-do that whole bathroom. I can't remember my room number or floor now but I want to say it was the 18th. Check-in and check-out was great and fast. Staff at the front desk was always nice day or night. Happy hour was ALWAYS AMAZING it happened around like 4:30 to 7:30pm or something like that. Overall i'd actually say 7.5 but can't do half "circles" or w/e so yeah I dunno they need to something about the showers because the one in my friend's room on the 17th looked the same way. Time for some renovations. I'd rather dealt with a slight bedbug problem than a bathroom that creeped me out. I'd also had a bit more unhappy if i'd gotten the room for more than I paid, luckily from another site I was able to get my room for 3 days with tax for like 198. So again 7.5 overall is pretty fair.

Reviews.Title: “Very Kind People - Great Plaza Club Level Stay”
Reviews.Author: coveredbridges
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Lord Baltimore was a short and safe walk away from the convention center. I stayed one week for a business trip combined with a couple of days of leisure. I was very impressed with the value of this hotel for the price. I stayed on the plaza level so that I wouldn't have to worry about breakfast. The breakfast was great and their evening appetizers and wine were filling and generous. I loved the downstairs bar food too. Everyone was so kind and helpful. The doormen and receptionist were great with providing directions to local flair as well as arranging transportation to the train station and airport. The building is old and rooms small but well kept. By the 2nd night I had found my right sleep number on their beds and rested well. It was easy to make the hotel home for the week.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: i_thornton
Reviews.Content: Got a deal with a travel site and paid $77 a night for this, and ill tell you what, it was worth every penny. The front desk staff was incredibly helpful in suggesting restraunts and getting us to different sightseeing locations. The rooms were clean, service was good. Only complaint was my windows didnt seal that well in the room, to the point where the curtains were blowing at one point, but you can control the heat in your room and it was decent white-noise to sleep with (and i mean that). That really didnt bother me though. It is an older hotel, but still very functional, and a great value if you can get it for $75 to $100 a night. Plus, the location is excellent, we were walking distance to the inner harbor. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen0803
Reviews.Content: We had to stop over Christmas weekend for 2 nights due to the blizzard in New Jersey. I remembered the Lord Baltimore from a 1 night stay 6 or 7 years ago, so we decided to wait out the storm there. We also had our dog with us. The room was huge and very clean. The service was outstanding, everone was incredibly nice to us AND to our dog! I loved the atmosphere of the place, the lounge in the lobby was a lot of fun and also pet friendly. The food was very good and room service was very fast. The area wasn't great, but we had our car so we were able to drive around and see some of the sights. I will definitely go back the next time we're in the area!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel as seen better days.”
Reviews.Author: legaltravelor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is over the hill. The furniture, bed, vanity, etc all looked old. Seemed clean but well worn. The desk had water damage and was very uneven, The book about the hotel had coffee spilled all in it. The sleep number bed is terrible. A glorofied air mattress.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PRICE, CLOSE TO INNER HARBOR”
Reviews.Author: macnpaigemommy
Reviews.Content: Took a short trip with my husband and 3 small children to visit the inner harbor. This hotel was perfect for that. Seemed like a nice part of the city. The Hotel was very nice and clean and the service was GREAT. We got our breakfast included and the waitress was so sweet and kind to our children. Will keep this hotel in mind if we choose to visit Baltimore again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel with old world charm and a great staff”
Reviews.Author: BigCityZoneTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Plaza Lord Baltimore enables the traveler to experience a hotel with history and wonderful architecture. The staff was very professional and courteous. The hotel does need a re-fresh, however I would consider the condition to be reasonable and in line with the room rates. The location is very convenient, with the subway entrance just across the street. Walking tours of downtown, historic neighborhoods and the harbor are all available. I stayed in a corner room with windows on two sides. Everything was in working order. Definitely not your cookie cutter new hotel with no character.

Reviews.Title: “old, dingy hotel; didn't feel like a vacation”
Reviews.Author: emgoodman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of a MAJOR renovation. Top to bottom, this place is the pits. I was pretty shocked because it's part of the Radisson chain, which is typically trustworthy. My room was not clean, hairs found EVERYWHERE (I asked for a fresh set of sheets and towels and had the same problem second time around). I didn't feel like staying here was at all relaxing. There is a very nice and reasonable hotel across the street, please do yourself a favor and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful about your room”
Reviews.Author: yogibe
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at the LB Radisson and the room was a train wreck.... old dingy and sadly in need of repair. My colleague had a corner room wth lots of windows in very nice shape. If you get a bad room ask to be moved.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a renovation!”
Reviews.Author: agoodteech
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs a complete renovation. The rooms are shabby and and not as clean as I would like. Carpet is soiled throughout and restaurant is depressingly dark and worn. The area is dicey at night. Pay a bit extra and stay closer to the Harbor. On a positive note, the staff was unfailingly polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviewers made it sound”
Reviews.Author: jandl2004
Reviews.Content: First, this is a nice hotel. The building is old but they have maintained it well. The lobby is beautiful. Second, I did not see any "working girls"during my stay. The bell hop, tony, was wonderful and the front staff was very pleasant. The rooms are small but all rooms in cities tend to be. It' a short walk to the inner harbor. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “It no longer deserves the Radisson franchise name - grotesque really”
Reviews.Author: LieboGrandHaven_MI
Reviews.Content: Prostitutes working the area where you disembark from your cars! Prostitutes in the lobby with their "Johns"! SleepNumber bed was broken and falling onto the floor. The security lock on the door was hanging by one partially threaded screw. Blinds were broken and filthy. When we walked into room all of the drawers were open and all furniture were pushed away from the walls. I would have left immediately but it was 11pm and after traveling all day, we stayed. I got up and checked out first thing the next morning though. We prepaid for 3 nights and only stayed 10 hours and that was 10 hours too long. They charged us for parking for all three days and haven't credit our card back. Russell Connally, the assistant front desk manager also advised Priceline not to return our unused nights. This was the worst hotel experience of my life. We checked out and went to the Homewood Suites located on the east side of Inner Harbor, I would highly recommend that hotel. Do yourself and the rest of your party a favor, stay away, far away. In fact when visiting Baltimore there is no reason to go anywhere near this hotel or neighborhood. Stay at the Inner Harbor and stay away from here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs work”
Reviews.Author: setonmj
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel for two days and received a great deal via hotwire for $67 per night and although we didnt expect the penthouse suite but we were surprised by the small size of the room but that wasnt the biggest suprise we found. The surprises were the following: 1. Sleep number bed didnt work 2. One of the light fixture bulb did not work 3. Found a roach in the bathroom 4. Themostat was hanging off the wall 5. Coffemaker was missing the first night 6. Peeling wall paper replaced by masking tape This was a shame since this hotel is conveinent to th Inner Harbor and there was a restaurant shuttle to our favorite restaurant Moes Pasta. Also it is more cost efficient to use the public parking garage which is $18 per day as opposed to the $31 valet parking fee

Reviews.Title: “Cab drivers run up the meters”
Reviews.Author: MedSkool
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of its close proximity to where I needed to take a national licensing to start my rotations in medical school. I arrived a day early because it is a very important 9 hour exam and I didn’t want to be late. The morning of the exam I went to the front desk and asked if they could call me a cab. They told me that they had cabs associated with the hotel waiting right out side. What they neglected to tell me was that I was about to be taken on a 40 minute tour of Baltimore to run up the meter. I could have walked the 3 miles faster. After becoming very upset the cab driver took me to my location... LATE!!! I almost wasn’t allowed to take the exam (which would have flushed 2 years of medical school and thousands of dollars down the toilet). After I told them where I was staying they decided to let me take the exam because it is not an uncommon occurrence. Just for reference: I took a cab back in afternoon rush hour traffic and the tab was less than half including tip!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE! WE HAD BLOODY SHEETS!”
Reviews.Author: tjandv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take the kids to the Baltimore Aquarium on a whim so I plugged some numbers into priceline.com and was pleased when my offer of $110 was accepted at the Radisson Plaza Lord Baltimore as my experiences with Radisson hotels have always been quite pleasant. Check in went very smoothly though we were given a king room though I'd requested two double beds (and had to pay an extra $10 for the double room). The room was well appointed though it was a bit out-dated. Our three year old discovered dirty q-tip swabs while playing on the side of the bed and I picked several stray hairs off the comforter. Upon entering the bathroom I noticed that the tub was filthy (and also had stray hairs). I performed my customary Lysol disinfectant ritual and my husband called guest services to have someone come do another cleaning while we went to dinner. When we returned the room seemed much cleaner though the bath tub seemed to be permanently dirty. The advertised sleep number beds did not work but the bed was fairly comfortable anyway so my sleep was pleasant enough until I awoke to my 4 year old screaming bloody murder - almost literally. There were SEVERAL spots of blood on his bed sheets and he was not bleeding. I contacted guest services again and was placed on hold for about 3 minutes. When the representative finally took me off of hold she gave me instant attitude. I immediately asked for the manager, who of course was not there. I proceeded to remove the sheets and quickly prepared to depart the hotel even though we'd decided to stay another night in Baltimore. When we checked out I brought the dirty sheets down to the front desk with me so the staff could see that I was not exaggerating. The manager refused to acknowledge that it was blood and said that he and the director of housekeeping would have to investigate the stains. Really?? After waiting another 10 minutes for housekeeping to respond we decided to follow our agenda and return to the hotel after lunch. When we got back we again had to wait for the manager who informed us that the stain was not a blood stain but he was prepared to compensate us with a $40 reimbursement. By this point we were way behind our schedule for the day and neither my husband or I felt like arguing with someone who obviously refused to admit how disgusting the establishment is. I realize that the building is cosmetically older but that should not be an excuse for uncleanliness and overall unsanitary conditions. Oh, and I forgot to mention the loud street noises, which included a woman screaming like she was being attacked! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and I will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUG HOT ZONE”
Reviews.Author: PittsfordNY14534
Reviews.Content: Got into this hotel at 11pm, and room was pretty disgusting, but I was too tired to think of much other than getting a few hours of sleep. When I got into bed, up near the ceiling climbing all over the wall paper, were tiny bed bugs. I found out that another colleague of mine had stayed at this hotel in July, and had to go to MD when she returned, only to be diagnosed w/ bed bug bites. There's too many other places in Baltimore to stay to even consider this hotel an option - even without bed bugs, the rooms are dirty, run down, and the beds are horrendous.

Reviews.Title: “I Should Have Paid Better Attention To The Reviews.”
Reviews.Author: debi1rn
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at a Radisson. I travel frequently and stay in Hilton or Marriot Brands. I am not going to rewrite what others have written, but will verify that this is a disgustingly dirty property, with an unhappy, and rude staff. We stayed here this past week. Aside from the fact that the place needs a complete remodel and the staff needs to learn about customer service, we encountered some real safety issues. The higher priority issue is the fact that the battery holder from the fire alarm was wide open and empty. (Rm 528) I notified the front desk and they sent a short, squat, older lady to change it after I had already changed for the evening. She told me she would have to step on my bed, and truthfully even then I don't think she could have reached. (I am 5'4 and could not have reached, and am taller than her. Also, this would disprove a defense of me removing the battery.) I would not let her step on my bed because that is unsanitary, and the fire alarm had no battery for the entire stay. The second item is sanitation. I could write a book about the gross, potential health hazards we observed, but the biggest is the fact that the two long bed pillows in both rooms look like they have not been changed this year. The front was clean, however the part that touched the clean linen and the back was full of several other people's hair, and disgusting stains. We notified the desk, and they offered to give us new cases, but really the entire sheet set was contaminated. The rest of the room was filthy too. We did tell the desk, and offered to talk to management. The response was, "...and they don't believe me when I tell them that we get housekeeping complaints." Again we offered to support the case, but the gentleman acted as if it is useless, but would take care of it himself. Note to self- Never stay in a Radisson again.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE Part of The Hood( Baltimore)”
Reviews.Author: wildfuntravel
Reviews.Content: This was the scum part of town! Broken windows , homeless people, broken glass. Manager was called ahead and said it was a nice area and they had no wool carpeting! None of this was true, I sent clients there this was embarrassing and should not be a hotel on any site.The clients said it could not even be called a one star. They also refuse to give a cancellation number, they kept saying there systems were down!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Recommended - Park America Valet Parking NOT!”
Reviews.Author: thornetm
Reviews.Content: Just a friendly warning to all who might consider staying at the Radisson Plaza Lord Baltimore. I stayed the weekend of Aug 13. The hotel offered valet parking at $31 per day which I paid since it is really difficult parking in downtown Baltimore. The valet took my car Friday night at check-in and returned it to me at check-out Sunday. SIGNIFICANT POINT – just to be safe, I removed my personal info (insurance/registration, etc) from my car and placed all of my music CDs OUT OF PLAIN SIGHT and UNDER the driver seat. I did not move or access my car all weekend. At Sunday’s checkout it never dawned on me to check and see whether any CDs were missing. I simply moved them from under the driver’s seat where I had placed them and went on my way. It wasn’t until Wednesday – yes, 3 days later – when I was looking for a particular CD that I noticed it was missing. After doing a full inventory, I realized 6 CDs were missing! And anyone who buys CDs know they are not cheap; on an average of $15 each. I immediately called the hotel Wednesday morning who referred me to Park America. I left a voicemail for the Park America manager who never returned my call. I finally spoke with him when I called him back Wednesday afternoon. Of course there was nothing he could do because “it was 3 days later and how do I know for sure someone else didn’t take the CDs”. I then called the hotel to alert the management that the parking facilities they refer their guests to might steal from their guests’ cars. I spoke with two managers over the course of two weeks and they were attentive and assuring. I certainly appreciate their customer service skills. I also spoke with someone from the Park America offices in PA – who I felt basically blew me off reasoning since I didn’t know my CD’s were missing until 3 days later, anyone could have taken them. Of course I understand the “we are not responsible” disclaimer presented by Park Amercia and the Radisson and realize any expectation of compensation is moot. I just never imagined I would have to apply that principle to the very ones I entrusted with my car in the first place. And to know that my car was delibertly searched - remember, my CDs were out of sight UNDER the driver seat and the only ones with access (I left all doors locked) were the Park America, Inc attendents who had my car key. My overall experience at the hotel was great, the service was nice and if not for this incident, I would certainly go back again. I can respect the hotel’s position that mine is only the second complaint in over a year and this is not the norm. The fact is my CDs are missing (no, not misplaced or just overlooked in my van – they are gone). And they were taken by a facility that I trusted because they were trusted by the Radisson. So no hard feelings, just exercising my right to write a review and share my experience and offer some friendly suggestions if your hotel parking is managed by Park America, Inc or any other valet parking facility for that matter - definitely completely remove all “don’t want these stolen” items. Apparently hiding them under the driver's seat is not a deterrent LOL. Be sure to inspect your car and contents of your car thoroughly before you leave the hotel. And if you find like me that you actually don’t discover your property is missing until a few days later, don’t take it personal if it is implied you stole it yourself :) Oh, and the irony of this whole thing – they were Christian CD’s LOL! Oh well, maybe they really needed them more than I did at the time… :-) Be safe!

Reviews.Title: “Cramped, Ugly, Dirty, Bloody”
Reviews.Author: mjp1542
Reviews.Content: Three-star hotel? You've got to be kidding me. Let's start with check-in. Went smoothly, though I was informed there were no rooms available with two beds. We were told to call later and they could send up a cot. THE ROOM: The room seemed nice at first glace. King-size Sleep Number bed. I guess that's a nice touch, but not nearly enough for a three-star rating. Upon closer look, the wallpaper was disgusting and peeling, with some tears. There was no updates to that in more than a decade. The room had air conditioning, provided by a window unit that wasn't very powerful. In addition, the unit was too small for the window, so a piece of plywood was duct-taped next to the unit to keep outside air from getting in. You could see several openings on the edges. THE COT: Later, we called about the cot and were told it would be an extra $10/night. Was not told that at check-in and find that ridiculous when they have no rooms with two beds remaining. THE BLOOD: While it wasn't apparent until the second day, one of my friends noticed red dots splattered on the wall near the vanity. This was not paint. It could only be blood. Not sure at all how it got there. We decided to stick with the room since it was the second day, but this was eerie. There were similar splatters on the wall outside the room. THE ELEVATORS: There are five elevators at the Lord Balt. At least, that's what it looks like. We only ever were on two of them, and the waits were tremendous. In a high-rise hotel, this is unacceptable. THE CLUB: Apparently, there's a "health club." We visited it (only one elevator goes to it), and found they have taken out the hot tub and only have a few weight machines and treadmills. Horrible amenity. THE GOOD POINTS: Free Internet was nice. The location is OK. It's close enough to the Inner Harbor to walk during the day (be careful after dark). However, with a lot of construction in the area, it took 15 minutes to drive from the hotel to the self-park garage ($15/night vs. $31/night for valet). Also, the lobby is very beautiful and makes you feel like you're staying in a stately hotel. Well, you'll soon realize you absolutely are not. I would never recommend someone staying here unless they're looking to save a lot of money or are desperate. There are PLENTY of nice hotels in Baltimore. This is not one of them. Please, dock them a star rating. If this is what a three-star hotel is, something is wrong with our rating system.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lousy service, staff with an attitude”
Reviews.Author: Where2nextMD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location for a large gathering recently. I have to say that we chose the hotel because of its proximity to downtown Baltimore and it was good for that purpose. It pretty much ends there. Although we were treated well when we were signing a contract to use the facility, it was all downhill after that. Our original rep quit, we were not assigned a new one right away, when we did get one she was NOT attentive. The hotel dropped the ball on many fronts and failed to take responsibility for their poor service which included: 1) a lack of signage for our events, 2) food staff who were rude and not available (which resulted in non-guests picking in our food) 3) sales staff who were inaccessible 4) a very hot and humid lobby area 5) rooms that had mildew in the bathrooms 6) rooms with overflowing toilets WITH human waste that DID NOT belong to the guests in the room... To say that that the stay was disappointing is an understatement. The manager of the hotel was unapologetic for the most part and saw no need to give a discount for the poor service we received because he had already provided discounts upfront. That would have been good had we recieved acceptable service; however in this instance, we definitely got what we paid for: discounted service at a discounted price. Lesson learned. This place is definitely NOT recommended if you are planning a large event. Good luck those who stay there ... my advice: bring your lysol and a positive attitude. You'll need both.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: cafegirl57
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Plaza Lord Baltimore for 5 days. we received exceptional service and hotel was nice and clean. The price was fair and I would definitely stay here again. To get to downtown Baltimore or harbor catch the CHARM hybrid bus 2 blocks from hotel. (its free)

Reviews.Title: “Okay - For The Right Price”
Reviews.Author: travelinlife4me
Reviews.Content: First, let me say I grew up in Baltimore in the 1970's...before th Inner Harbor and the glitzy attractions you see today. During that period the Loard Baltimore was THE hotel in town and I did not come from a family that frequented such places. So I was interested in staying there and seeing it for the first time at $50 a night on Priceline. I kind of got what I expected, a faded gem that retained some if it's charm and was a decent price for the accomodations. The looby area does take you back to a different time, when people actually sat around the lobby. The room was small, as they were in hotels of this era, and reasonabbly appointed. The AC struggled a bit with the July Baltimore heat, but the room was comfortable. It would not please you if you like it really cold. My view was of another wall, but there's not much to see in this part of downtown. The staff was front desk staff I encountered were just average...not friendly, but not unfriendly either. Typical East Coast service, not a lot of please and thank you. The location if walking distance to all the attractions and Camden Yards. It's also a couple of blocks to the Famous Block...where, no matter your age, you can watch someone your daugther's age and your grandmother's age take their clothes off. ( If your into that sort of thing). The area might be considered a little seedy by some people, but it's mostly just working people making their way home. Don't expect the Ritz and don't expect to be a few steps from the harbor and you'll not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: mks4
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a week night and was quite disappointed that 2 beds cost and extra $20. I've really never heard of something silly like this, especially when a hotel is not nearly full. The lobby is attractive, but has a rather generic looking bar. The room was small, somewhat dingy, and pretty basic. It was clean, though. The location was ok and within walking distance to Camden Yards and the Inner Harbor. It's a little seedy near the hotel, but I suppose that's Baltimore unless you're near the water. It's a place to sleep and not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Sparky1954
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Lord Baltimore was built in 1923, during the Gilded Age, when that area of Baltimore was home to the rich and famous. If you appreciate history and architecture (especially from that era), the Lord Baltimore is a treat. The lobby in particular is a gem of 1920s design. And if you can sneak into the Calvert Ballroom (if the doors are unlocked), you'll see gorgeous period chandeliers and paintings along the walls. In its day, the Lord Baltimore was clearly the place to be. Today, in terms of a place to stay, the Lord Baltimore is just average. We found the facility to be clean and the staff friendly. Food was mediocre. Parking is a pain since you're relegated to a musty underground garage across the street. Overall, the hotel lacks the buzz of activity that you might find in a more popular facility, so you get a somewhat tired impression of the place. The big tourist attraction in Baltimore is the Inner Harbor area and, unfortunately, the Lord Baltimore is quite a few blocks away. On the other hand, it is much less expensive than Inner Harbor hotels. Someone mentioned that the Lord Baltimore was two blocks away from "ghetto areas." I guess it depends on how you define "ghetto." If you mean run-down row houses, this is not the case. Parts of the area surrounding the hotel, however, has a gritty character. I'd probably recommend against strolling around after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned hotel, ok location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: I got an exceptional rate on the hotel which is why I recommend it.The staff was very friendly and helpful at the hotel. The hotel is very old schooled and some of the hotel I believe needs some remodeling to give it some life. Parking was $15 a night if you self park or $31 if you do valet. I recommend self parking as its only a short walk. They offer complimentary internet which is always an added plus. The rooms were again old school, pretty much a standard bathroom. It was quiet at night and a easy place to sleep. The beds were comfortable. The location is ok because I was there for the Mets/Orioles series at camden yards and it was only a 5-10 minute walk to camden and the surrounding bars and restaurants. If you want to get to the center of the innerharbor its about about 10-15 minute walk, which is where the aquarium is. Fells point is an awesome historic place to visit while in baltimore with bars and restuarants and that is about a 25-30 minute walk. I stayed at the Marriott Waterfront a couple years ago and I like the located much better. At night there were a bunch of people hanging around the streets by the hotel which is a short walk where the nightlife is so it was a little bit scary for my gf. Overall, If you got the rate I got which was $70 a night I would recommend the hotel. Though there are other hotels that can offer a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag.”
Reviews.Author: Upp
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on both ends of ratings, I stayed at this hotel expecting the worst. It wasn't that bad or good. While my rating is subjective, I will try to be objective in pointing out the good and bad here. Good: Roomy; Historic with an elegant lobby; Reasonably courteous staff; Free WiFi; Nice bed (may depend on your luck- my room had two beds, one wasn't getting set to my desired sleep number, the other did). Location - about 4 blocks from inner harbor and 2 blocks from the light rail (to the airport). Bad: Things that bothered me and affected my review: Room smelt very old - mildewey; stains on the carpet in room (the red colored ones); poor morning breakfast service - breakfast was delivered 1 hour past time requested without even an acknowledgement due to the inconvenience. Things that didn't bother me but may bother others: Very slow WiFi -- its fine for leisure use but forget about using it for any corporate VPN connection; Carpet was very faded in patches; tub was old and scratched; really dirty windows on the external side - as dirty as those in My Cousin Vinny; Noisy/dubious location - I could not bring myself to walk here after dark; Lot of noise through the night, as I am used to this I could sleep soundly; Old gym equpment - they had one of each: cross trainer; treadmill; stepper; weight machines and free weights. The equipment was old, creaky and requires good oiling! Inebraited youngsters in the evenings in the hallwaysw and the elevators. While these issues make your stay less than desirable, what riled me up was how the manager initially responded by literally laughing when I complained about my breakfast getting very delayed despite repeated reminder calls (2 calls in total). However, when I went and spoke to him face to face and detailed the issues I with the stay, he did make a note of my complaint and apologized for the less than average stay. The general manger later called me as a follow up - a welcome touch. I may however stay at a better place near BWI and take the convinient light rail.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned Excellence”
Reviews.Author: JLibby59
Reviews.Content: I've read other reviews that have slighted this hotel. This hotel was awesome and I will definitely stay there again. It is a 1920's hotel with all of the charm of the era. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Check in was a breeze and very quick considering there was a baseball game in town and the hotel was extremely busy. The room was clean and comfortable. Let me tell you, the air conditioning felt great after a very humid, hot Baltimore day. The bed was a sleep number bed and very comfortable. Even the shower was fantastic. The hotel bar is convenient and the bartenders were very friendly and helpful. I didn't eat at the hotel. The business center allows free access to the internet and is available 24 hours. The parking is right across the street in an underground garage. It's $15 per day but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JulieP33
Reviews.Content: We booked a room via Priceline at $75/night for a trip last weekend to see the Sox play the Orioles. The hotel was easily accessible, a $45 cab ride from the airport, and easy to walk to Camden Yards & the Inner Harbor. We felt mostly safe walking, even at night, although we did go the wrong way once and found ourselves in a not so great neighborhood. We arrived early and were able to store our luggage for the day, and when we returned later that afternoon, our room was ready and check in was speedy. Our room was on the 14th floor, nice and clean, stayed cool through the night, and the sleep number beds were comfortable. My one complaint was that housekeeping took our dirty bath towels and did not replace them, something I did not notice until after my shower. It took 3 calls to get clean towels, which was frustrating. We had some trouble with the TV remote as well, it only seemed to work once in a while. We had iced coffee every morning from the cafe downstairs, and one breakfast in the restaurant which was very good and reasonably priced. The free wi-fi worked well, and the complimentary business center to print out boarding passes was a nice addition. We sat in the lounge area one night, drinks were good, and we ordered a pizza as well. Overall, this is a decent hotel with some nice perks. Nothing fancy, but certainly a good, comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dnrest
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there on 6/52010 for one night. The Hotel is in a noisy section with sirens going on all the time . The Hotel itself could here people in the hallway at 3;00 in the morning. The carpet in the hall way looked like it needed to be replaced. The bathtub was dirty , found short curly hairs on the floor. Could not set the wake up with the radio , so I called for a wake up call and they never called . The parking situation isn't very good. Better places to stay near the harbor and less noisy

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional Staff, Stale Hotel, Horrendous Room Service”
Reviews.Author: latentpower
Reviews.Content: It was just bad. I was double charged for my room and they needed to take a few days to conduct an "investigation". The room had a stale smell to it and looked nothing like the pictures. Someone puked in on of the elevators and it was still very visible the next day. You are just 2 blocks from some of the ghettos of Baltimore. If I could go back I would definitely have stayed closer to the water.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs help.”
Reviews.Author: Barb0719
Reviews.Content: I requested a 3 to 4-star hotel through Priceline.com for an overnight trip to Baltimore's inner harbor for my husband and I. The Radisson Plaza Lord Baltimore came up in the 3-star category. This hotel should be a 1 1/2 or 2 stars at best. It is dirty, out-dated, and in disrepair everywhere you look. Our room was extremely small, the bathroom outdated with cracked tiles everywhere. There was a 2-inch or so spot of dried blood on the shower curtain. The very small (supposedly queen size) bed felt like sleeping on a wood platform. The restaurant that serves breakfast is a very basic, dark, windowless room in the lower level (i.e. basement). The buffet had a basic selection of breakfast food but was mediocre, as was the service. This hotel is at least 5 blocks from the Inner Harbor. We were told when we checked in that there was a shuttle we could use to get to Fells Point for dinner, which we opted not to use at that time. However, when we asked to use the shuttle in the a.m. the Sunday morning front desk clerk said they did not have a shuttle. Although each and every staff member we came in contact with were extremely polite and pleasant, collectively they do not have their "act" together at all. We are very flexible travelers and not complainers, but the fact that this hotel was represented to us as a 3-star facility was misleading and we were very disappointed. I would like to prevent someone else from having this happen to them.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: seal08
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in downtown Baltimore. The service was great and the staff was professional. The airbeds I did not like but all in all this was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in area accessible to tourist districts.”
Reviews.Author: meredithand
Reviews.Content: I purchased this hotel through Hotwire and got a rate that I thought was decent for a downtown hotel in the Inner Harbor area. The hotel is a four block walk to either the Inner Harbor or the baseball stadium. It is across the street from the metro station. I chose the self-park option because we would be walking everywhere during the weekend. Self-parking was VERY convenient. You do have to go to the Front Desk before you go to the garage, they will give you a voucher for your stay. (The fee is charged by the hotel, not the garage.) Because of the one-way streets, it take a while to get to the garage entrance but the escalators bring you out across the street. We were greeted by a friendly Front Desk and actually able to check in early. There was no view from the window but the room was quite comfortable. Our king-size room was spacious and clean. The heating/AC worked fine. We used room service once and it arrived promptly within 20 minutes. They did forget the salad dressing but brought it as soon as we called. The street scene is sparse but I felt safe walking from the local attractions at night. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone else looking for a hotel in the Inner Harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cheertraveler97
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radission , while attending my daughter annual cheerleading competition this weekend . I switched from the Holiday Inn ,because the rate was more then half the price off at the Radission ( 89.00 a night ) and I checked the Travel Advisor comments, and over all they were good. I was not disappointed in my switch and can say that it was even a better stay then last years Holiday Inn. I loved the spacious lobby and coffee shop.The musicians on arrival was pleasant surprise. I made use of the Hotel restaurant the first night with a group of 13. They were not expecting a large party and only had 2 servers on. They warned us of the long wait for food ,but could seat us immediately if we didn't mind the wait, not a problem for us. They ended up sending us tons of their warm rolls, and called in reinforcements from the front desk to start taking orders. the Menu has a wide selection, and at a great price for a Hotel. I found staff in the hotel very polite and accommodating .I also found the Housekeeper on the 15th floor absolutely charming. Is this hotel dated , yes.. but she is what I would call an old Dame of Hotels, and has carried the time of changes, with elagance and grace that reflects her history, I wouldn't change a thing. If your looking for a contemporary style new hotel with all the latest bells and whistles ,and untouched look, then no this Hotel would not suit you, but if your searching for a relaxing ,and comfortable stay in the Inner Harbor area, and with a staff that is highly trained to the patrons needs , then this would defectively fit your needs. and PEOPLE! I am so tired of hearing about the Hotel area! Really? it`s Baltimore ! a city with high crime. You have to be careful no matter what hotel you stay at. Take a shuttle or call a cab to and from the Hotel. if you want to walk the area , do so at a safe and reasonable time ,and with other people. safety in number! enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtruitt
Reviews.Content: Room was roomy, staff was friendly, lobby decor is beautiful..Bathroom was great with a window in it!!! Close to inner harbour. ... those are the positives...negatives: hotel felt dated, linens had stains and sleep number bed lost 'air' during the night. I was hanging on.....

Reviews.Title: “Service was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Proseco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I appreciated the historic charm of the hotel...our teenage daughter thought it was a bit spooky w/gargoyles. We didn't realize there was a nightly reception when we arrived....it was a pleasant surprise and the selection of wine, beer, fruit, cheese, etc. was very nice at club level. Enjoyed the breakfast the next morning as well--more than ordinary continental type w/fresh fruit, cereal, eggs, oatmeal, yogurt. Staff was very helpful/attentive. I would eliminate the sleep no. beds as without dual controls wasn't that comfortable. One thing that threw us was the fact that the shuttle to Hopkins ran at least every hour even every two, so we had to pay for a cab instead of going complimentary. Good to have comp internet!

Reviews.Title: “elegant - but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a night in preparation for marathon in 2009. hotel is a bit removed from inner harbour, close enough to walk. front desk would not change my room to one with 2 beds without charging more, kind of unexpected and a hassle. single bed room was also very small, tucked into a corner.

Reviews.Title: “a resounding "eh"”
Reviews.Author: aaaaa
Reviews.Content: This is an old-style hotel in a historic building approximately five blocks from the Inner Harbor. Although reasonably well kept, the hotel will disappoint guests who prefer modern styling. On the whole, the public spaces are a bit dark and grim, and furnishings in the public areas were outdated and overused. The room itself was fine: the bed was excellent (sleep number) and the bathroom was clean, but the room was small, the heat was weak, and the windows leaked in frigid air. Soundproofing was good. The front desk staff were agreeable and helpful. A business center has two terminals with complimentary internet service, and rooms have free WiFi. The neighborhood is an unappealing and commercial area that, to some, may appear to possess an uneasy air of danger.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot understand negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: dcolfel
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and stay at many brands of hotels and would consider myself very picky. I have stayed at this hotel 3 times now and have had a wonderful experience every time. The rooms are big and clean, staff helpful and the food (room service included) is relatively cheap and of great quality. The hotel is only about 3 blocks from the harbor, not a mile as some other travelers have stated. The parking is one block from the hotel and does cost $15 per day. This is the same as any other city hotel I have ever stayed in, I could understand if the hotel was located in a rural area, but a hotel in the heart of the city usually does not provide free on-site parking. I think this is a clean beautiful historic city center hotel. And as for the people who say the hotel is in a unsafe location, I cannot think of any city where I would want to mill around at 3 am, the neighborhood is just the same as any large city.

Reviews.Title: “Quite lovely historic hotel within walking distance of the harbor.”
Reviews.Author: davtraveler911
Reviews.Content: I dont understand any of the negative reviews here. My room was perfect. Clean, well appointed and welcoming. The bathroom was squeaky clean with a nice variety of complimentary toiletries. The sleep number bed was incredibly comfortable and the controller worked perfectly. The hotel is an historical landmark with so many interesting details ...the lobby ceiling is breathtaking. I think it's beautiful history and detail are better enjoyed by babyboomers and above - the kids just dont seem to get it. As for the neighborhood, just use some common sense and you'll be fine. Women probably should walk alone, but the bell man at the hotel will happily get you a cab and wait with you until it comes. Last time I checked Baltimore didnt make the worlds safest city list.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel has potential, but it needs investement”
Reviews.Author: Valueskr
Reviews.Content: The gym is really good, the restaurant is just ok, the service staff go the extra mile butonly with limited resources...and the rooms are awkward to say the least. It seems they used to be big and some furniture was removed....then the distribution is odd. The mini bar blocks the connecting door, the couch blocks the entry....it just needs some quality and customer oriented director or something. Granted the price was good and most ofthe things were ok, it's not a terrible stay but lagging behing close competitors like spring hill suites and sheraton who are really close by.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel, inconvenient parking”
Reviews.Author: timson1
Reviews.Content: Good: - Free internet is great, could even stream videos - Staff is very friendly and supportive - Room is big, nice and clean - Sleep number bed is a nice toy, but it's not very comfy Bad: - When i just came to the hotel - I could not find a place to leave the car and go to the reception - there is a tiny spot that is always taken by some other clients. - To get to the parking - you need to make a big circle (a guy at the front door said "Baltimore is a one-way city"). - Parking is $15 and across the street - not very convenient, valet parking is $30 - Saw a big rat right at the parking garage - When I came to my room - it was freesing - heating was broken. They fixed it in 10 minutes after I talked to the guy on reception though - Phone buttons were not working - TV in the room is very old and not working well - Do not go on the streets in the night time - it's kinds scary out there

Reviews.Title: “Charm!”
Reviews.Author: BethBoutchyard
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews we were kinda nervous... But to our suprise, we loved it! We come to Baltimore every year for the Tow Show. The staff was very helpful and nice. We really liked Jay Stanley (front office manager) Dwayne Davis and Jason Parker (Valet) and Nick (The bar guy) We had a wonderful stay and would come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Economical; Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: DarbyC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older which to me gives it charm. We have stayed here twice now and the staff is always very accomodating. We arrived late in the evening and the staff ushered us in and speedily checked us into our room. We were hungry but the only thing open was the short order bar; ofcourse it was very busy with people returning from the Orioles game. The bartender was extremely pleasant and helpful. The location is good, very close to inner harbor, about a blcok or two. There is a parking grarge close by but it does charge an arm and a leg. The hotel offers a tasty and affordable buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Escape!”
Reviews.Author: WittyLena
Reviews.Content: I booked my room through priceline.com...got it for $45/night! I was pleasantly surprised when I approached the front desk and said my name...the staff person there...he right away told his colleague that he'd take care of me since he and I had previously spoken on the phone (when I called to request a room on a higher floor).
