He was so pleasant and helpful. I had just driven there straight from work (after working over time) on a Friday night...It was about 830pm...I let him know I was running away from home...He was so kind...he put me on the plaza level (18th fl--keycard access only), didn't charge me for the fridge and microwave I asked for....(I realized once I checked out)...and the plaza level included free breakfast buffet and evening cocktails...plus it was so nice and quiet up there!!! Just what I needed! Room was nice and comfy (except the sleepnumber bed). I stayed in that room for an entire 24 hours without a problem. It was close to the inner harbour and all the sites were within short driving distance. Self park was $15/night about a block and a half away--nice parking lot...Valet is $31/night

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and friendly”
Reviews.Author: CelestePhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: Felt totally ripped off from taxi drivers. Charged $9 to get to hotel. Charged $10 to go back to Amtrak. My stay was quiet and peaceful. The harbor was beautiful. The Gallery had a huge sale on my fav Aerosoles shoes and boots. The staff was extremely friendly. Room service staff was terrific. The turkey burger was dry. I felt comfortable. Would return today if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Relieved!!!”
Reviews.Author: kellyfleak
Reviews.Content: I was so relieved when we got to this hotel. After reading many negative reviews, I even called Pricline and questioned why they would offer such a nasty hotel and they informed me that if I was still disappointed upon arrival, to call them back. The hotel is very old and could use some updating, especially in the bathrooms, but overall it's in good shape. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was clean, and I did not see any rats, ants, or anything else. The location was great for us...a nice, pleasant walk to the Inner Harbor. The parking garage they put you in was just across the street, and well lit. We parked our car on Thursday and didn't have to move it until leaving on Sunday. I did see several people waiting long periods of time for valet parking so I wouldn't recommend that, but really there is no need to. We did not see any homeless people or beggars anywhere. I am a VERY PICKY traveler and I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: md51Va
Reviews.Content: While staying at this hotel itself, was a good experience, my car was vandalized in their contracted parking garage. I had booked a package that included Valet Parking and during our stay my car was vandalized while in their "Valet Parking". The parking garage people were somewhat sympathetic, they said they'd have the charges written off but that never happened. They refused to pay the claim I submitted for what had been stolen from my car. There was another car vandalized as well, but I'm unsure of how that situation was taken care of. The hotel did nothing to help me other then refer me to the parking garage agent. I feel since they contracted with the garage fro this package that I should have been afforded some restitution for my losses. I would be very wary of staying at this hotel and parking my car with their contracted parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: sandibeach
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on business and plan on going back next week. Not more then a mile from inner harbor, little italy, fells point and canton. The room was clean, I liked the working sleep number bed! There was free internet which is a plus to me. The 2 staff members that I spoke to at the front desk where more then pleasant. With my great internet rate, I will be coming back again. The hotel is charming with a little touch of a bygone era. OK, one bigggg complaint: whats with the parking....$31.00 a day, you have to be nuts but if you need in and out privledges, I don't see what else you can do..

Reviews.Title: “Good times at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: iwannatravel
Reviews.Content: We asked if we could check in early afternoon, as we were headed to an Orioles game at 4 p.m. Expected them to say no, but they said yes and were very courteous. It's about 5 blocks to the Orioles stadium. Then later, we walked to the Inner Harbor which was maybe about 4 blocks in a different direction. The room was nice, clean, had a refrigerator, and suited our family fine for a one night stay. True, parking is two blocks away, which is not real convenient. But this is a big city. It's different than your average motel. Also, be aware that the NOISE level in your room may be louder than you expect. We were on the 11th floor, and we were awakened by sirens, horns and all kinds of loud noises. People who live in big cities are probably used to this, but we weren't!! Take your ear plugs or a white noise machine if this might bother you. Overall, would I stay here again and/or recommend it? Probably, if there was the kind of deal we did this time (99.00 special w/ 20.00 credit for food!!) And I would just be aware of the other things I mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kpetro
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, room service was great, close to convention center and great dining areas.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: TravelAceVirginia
Reviews.Content: The bed was made but the sheets had not been changed from the previous guests. It was disgusting! When we notified the front desk we were told houskeeping was gone for the day and it would be several hours before someone would be able to offer us assistance. It was after midnight when we checked in and it was around 3:00 AM before we got to bed. We asked to be moved. We were told there were no other rooms available. The staff was not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hated This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night after a boatride from the Inner Harbor. The hotel is nice...clean, well kept, etc but older. But there is no refridgerator or microwave. When I asked the front desk if there was a microwave in the hotel they said "No...but we can put one in your room for $10". The room was small...bed right by the door. Valet parking is $31 per night...self parking is $15 per day and 2 blocks away. This hotel is for the rich...who can afford valet parking, room service, etc. It's probably like this is all innercity hotels, but its not for me!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: lizzytish2002
Reviews.Content: The beds were all broken. They had those stupid sleep number beds but the basic rooms have the cheap model where one remote controls the entire bed instead of a remote for each side. Well our first room both bed remotes were broken. One bed completely deflated the other harder than a rock. Not to mention dirty and disgusting. Got our rooms changed and again the beds not working right. Finally got the remote to work if you held the cord at a certain angle. Still once the remote was working it was pure agony to sleep in the beds. We asked for a nonsleep number and were told they were all taken. Check in was a nightmare. Valet was a nightmare and they robbed you for the price they want you to pay. Check out again was a nightmare. Asked them to hold our luggage once we checked out and they lost things! First thing we did when we got home was contact the corporate office and voice our complaints. Would NEVER stay here again even if they paid us (which all we got was a so sorry your stay wasn't pleasurable come visit us again soon message).

Reviews.Title: “staff unresponsive to valet parking theft at this DIRTY, DUSTY hotel”
Reviews.Author: hookemsus
Reviews.Content: The lobby furniture was so dirty that I didn't feel comfortable sitting on it. The hallways were dusty and smelled like dirty feet. The sheets are cheap and itchy, and too small for the sleep number mattresses and came off throughout the night, and I did NOT find the sleep number bed comfortable at all. I found it to be glorified air mattress. But at least the room was small and cramped. If you'd like to hear the saga of our iPhone being stolen, please read on: We made the mistake of having the car valeted at the hotel (despite the $31/night fee) because they offered "free" come-and-go service overnight and we had several destinations over the course of the evening. After parking our car for the final time, we realized within five minutes that my boyfriend had left his iPhone in the middle console of our car. We went straight back down to the valet and made the mistake of telling him that we'd left the phone in the car and asked if they could just bring the phone up. Well, they brought the whole car up, but without the phone! The valet who brought our car up appeared high and reaked of smoke, and with his eyes half open it was easy to tell what he does in his spare time. He half-heartedly "helped" us look for the phone. When we went to call it we noticed him reach into his pocket and fiddle with a rectangular object, the outline of which was suspiciously like our phone. The phone (having been turned off in the interim) of course went straight to voicemail. My boyfriend went inside to speak with a manager and I stayed outside with the car. While I was waiting, the valets (four of them now standing in a group) were making audible comments that we were assuming the phone had been stolen because of the race of the valet. I found this extremely offensive, especially given the facts that I am not racist, and that I could STILL see the outline of a heavy rectangular object the size of an iPhone in the valet's pocket!! I don't care what color your are, if you are shifty-eyed, high, and have an object in your pocket the same shape as my phone, i'm going to assume you've stolen my phone! We have yet to recover the phone. The Radisson staff was minimally responsive because the valet company is not affiliated with them! Of course the valet company has no intention of either refunding our money for the parking or of recovering our phone. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Despite it's proximity to the ballpark and the Inner Harbor, and despite my being able to get a low price on priceline, I will NEVER go back to this hotel and would strongly discourage others from staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near ballparks and Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: AlpineR99
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here on a summer weekend for some sightseeing in and around Inner Harbor. The hotel was perfectly adequate for our needs: nonsmoking room, king sized bed, clean, reasonably spacious for an old city, no noise from within the hotel. The hotel doesn't have free parking, so we used an underground lot half a block north on Fayette Street. The hotel is located on the edge of the touristy parts of downtown Baltimore. We walked some iffy streets to get to Edgar Allen Poe's burial site a few blocks west. Then we continued several blocks further to Poe's house in a scary part of town -- a visit that I do not recommend. But for walking down to Inner Harbor and taking water taxis around town, this hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE..SHORT WALK TO INNER HARBOR!!!!”
Reviews.Author: teddyballgame24
Reviews.Content: Less than 10 minute walk to Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. We stayed here the last weekend in August when my beloved Red Sox took on the Orioles. This place was clean. The rooms were decent sized and they had free wifi in the rooms. The hotel is older but nice. The staff was great. There is no pool. The hotel breakfast buffet was decent and reasonable($10-$11). Some rooms have a fridge, some don't. The Hotel location is not as bad as some of the posts I've read. As long as you walk in the direction of the Inner Harbor you're OK. If you walk in the other direction away from I.H it can get a little sketchy! Be wary of the elevator traffic at check in and check out time. They have 4 elevators but it is ridiculously slow during those rush hours I mentioned. Overall I would reccomend this to anyone. Great value for the price I paid. hotels closer to I.H were much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in the area.”
Reviews.Author: poohie
Reviews.Content: This place is a great value for the money since, to be blunt, the hotels in the Inner Harbor are a total rip off. We went for a night about a month ago. I read the reviews so I knew some people were concerned about the neighborhood but I was still nervous when we pulled up, the area is a little sketch. There is also a busy bus stop nearby. The staff out front was very friendly and helpful and told us how to get to the public underground garage that serves the hotels in the area. The underground garage is straight out of a zombie movie but somewhat affordable and my car was still there the next day (and zombie free). The hotel is pretty nice considering the price. It is older and has a traditional looking, bustling lobby which is nicely appointed. There were a lot of guests there when we went and at least one wedding or conference was going on as well. The man who checked us in at the front desk answered our questions honestly and got us finished quickly. The rooms were a nice surprise. They are pretty spacious despite the hotel's age and were clean. The bathroom looked recently renovated. It is also quiet despite being in the city. The location is mostly good. As two 20 something women, we walked safely around 7pm in heels from the hotel to dinner in the Inner Harbor. Baltimore is just basically a dirty city with a lot of questionable people on the street so you have to be aware of this and act accordingly. I did not feel afraid while I was there but we did take a cab back from Powerhouse at 2 in the morning. If you are considering staying here but are worried about the neighborhood, you shouldn't let that make your decision in this case. I will stay there again if I return to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and good price”
Reviews.Author: Kimokini
Reviews.Content: Positives: Easy to get to 4 blocks from Inner Harbor and sooo worth a visit. Not too far from Camden Yards Clean Attractive looking Stay two nights and get 2nd night free. We paid $140 all for a weekend stay through Hotels.com. Free internet Negatives: Close to a bad area just Esat of the hotel. We witnessed a mugging in broad daylight on the hotel road. Also witnessed a couple of cops arresting some guys in Little Italy in broad daylight. The Sleep number beds aren't the greatest. When your partner moves it bumps you around. They advertise as having parking for their guests but you have to pay alot for their valet or park in a local garage. Gargae is next door and much cheaper than the valet.

Reviews.Title: “good value and location”
Reviews.Author: scoutingfrom
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous historical building and friendly helpful staff. When hotel crowded, it'd be better if all the elevators worked as it was difficult to get down from 16th floor when hundreds of other people were checking out. Small but very comfortable rooms. Free Wifi a definite plus.I enjoyed the location. I was ablet o easily walk everywhere I wanted to go from Fells Point to Camden Yards. Taxi's easy to obtain if you're not a walker. Enjoyed a point of beer in the bar which was pleasant after a long day. Good place for good price. Walls are thin, bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Puzzled by negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: diehardphilliesfan
Reviews.Content: Maybe everyone's experience is different but I loved this hotel. The staff was amazing and professional, the hotel immaculate and my room very attractive. I was surprised to find a small microwave and refrigerator in the room, so that was nice. The bathroom (my test for any hotel) was so clean it squeaked. The amenities were wonderful. Nice hairdryer, coffeemaker and coffee supplies replenished every morning along with fresh bottles of water (complimentary not $3 per bottle as at the Sheraton). Loved the sleep number bed (a king size as ordered). Wonderful clean bedding, lots of pillows. I read some really awful reviews on here and cannot understand why. One reviewer stated something about the curtains (white lace) letting the sun in because the drapes did not close. Should have looked further - behind the lace curtains were 'blackout ' style curtains to darken the room, which I did at night so the sun did not shine in the room first thing in the morning. I also don't understand people complaining about the location; it is around 3 blocks from the Inner Harbor, not miles away and it is not at all isolated - it is located in a very busy area. Hotels sitting right on the Inner Harbor are around 200-300 more per night. Kudos to the staff, they were so welcoming and did there jobs to perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Stay in Baltimore, MD.”
Reviews.Author: mickey2minnie1
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews had me concerned about our upcoming trip...it was great! Positives - Rich history within the building. First hotel in Baltimore. Beautiful architecture. Original Waterford chandeliers. Original brass in lobby. Lobby ceiling exquisite and original. Very clean. Staff went above and beyond expectations on many different occasions. Food was good. Room nicely done. Beautiful rooms to have a reception, wow! Negatives - 1/2 mile walk to Inner Harbor. Would not walk around hotel at night. No direct parking onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again....”
Reviews.Author: mriemens
Reviews.Content: Got a room at this hotel due to the fact it was within walking distance of M&T bank stadium where we had tickets to the soccer game. The room was tiny and cramped and if that was'nt bad enough, when we first entered the room, there was a roll away bed right in the middle of the room, we hardly had a place to set down our bags when we first got there. Had to call the front desk to have the bed removed and no, we NEVER asked for an extra bed, half the elevators did'nt even go all the way to the 17th floor where we were staying, one of the elevators had no lights, a pitch black ride in an elevator was not fun. Location is HORRIBLE! people constantly coming in on the one lane side road that is severely congested, people honking at you as you try to unload your vehicle, we chose valet parking, as they have no parking anywhere near the hotel, had to wait for one valet, who told us to park up the road behind another car and wait, he never came back, got out and got another valet and it took him another 20 or so minutes to actually move our car. upon check out there was no answer downstairs when we wanted to have the car already pulled around. Went out to get our car, gave the valet our little ticket and waited almost 30 minutes for our car to be brought around and was honked at while we loaded our vehicle to leave. It was a miserable stay to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, wish it was closer to Inner Harbor area”
Reviews.Author: BetsyOPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews, I can understand why some would be concerned with the area this hotel is located in. It does seem pretty isolated and had my husband not been with me, I would not have been comfortable walking alone at night. It's too bad because it is a nice historic hotel, and our room on the Club Plaza level was large and spacious with nice furnishings. However, some updating could be done as far as wallpaper peeling in the bathroom. But there were two sinks, which is nice because we each had our own space. The Club Plaza rooms also include a free movie, evening drinks and snacks, and a continental breakfast in the morning, so we took full advantage of these. We valet parked which was $31/night, but not outrageous for a major city, plus we only had to park once and easily walked everywhere. We got a travelzoo deal on this room, othewise I would not pay full price for it. There are many other hotels right in the Inner Harbor area that I would stay at next time, as we were in town mainly for an Orioles game and to see the sights in the Inner Harbor. Plus there are always more people in that area so it doesn't feel so quiet, dark and isolated. Bottom line is if you get a good price, there really aren't any major problems with this hotel and I would say go ahead and stay there. But with so many other options, next time I would shop around and even pay more for a better hotel closer to Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy 4th of July”
Reviews.Author: woodbinemd
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious enough that, even with a cot brought in, it never felt crowded. The neighborhood seems a little dreary due to the empty theatre and shops across the street. Everyone on staff was gracious and helpful. A good buy for our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Laptop stolen from room BY EMPLOYEE; Radisson customer service never responded.”
Reviews.Author: tencake
Reviews.Content: Oh. My. God. I'll share with you my email to Radisson's Customer Service, and their (lack of) responses: ON Wednesday, June 10, I sent this email to Radisson's Customer Service... "DEAR SIR / MADAM: I am appalled at this hotel. Unfortunately, I have no choice but to stay here, because I am here with my company. I do also have a reservation for a Radisson Hotel in July in Orlando, and this will be cancelled today. To say that I am disappointed in the service, or the attitudes of some of the employees here is trivial. To have a request for refilled water pitchers in one of the ballrooms that we were rented responded to by someone bringing a dirty 4-wheeled wagon full of icewater and suggesting that I begin filling pitchers was distasteful. HOWEVER, TO FIND OUT THAT TWO OF MY COLLEAGUES' ROOMS WERE ROBBED WAS MOST UPSETTING; ONE WOULD ASSUME THAT YOU'D BE SAFE IN A RADISSON HOTEL. TO FIND OUT FROM EMPLOYEES AND POLICE THAT THESE THEFTS WERE DONE BY AN EMPLOYEE OF THE HOTEL IS FRIGHTENING. HOW DO I KNOW THAT MY ARTICLES ARE NOT GOING TO BE STOLEN AS WELL? HOW CAN I FEEL SAFE WHILE SLEEPING AFTER LEARNING THAT THE THEFTS WERE COMMITTED BY PEOPLE WITH UNFETTERED ACCESS TO MY ROOM? "USE THE BOLT LOCK," THE FRONT DESK SAID. "DO EMPLOYEES HAVE KEYS TO THE BOLT LOCKS?" I ASKED. "WELL, YES." WAS THE REPLY. I ask again: How can I feel safe? I am sure that my cancellation is of little consequence to a company as large as yours, and my $500 means nothing to you, But I will do so, if I hear nothing back from the Company, and I will tell family and friends, and I will find websites and blogs to post my experiences on, to protect others from our experiences here... They never responded. I resent my email on June 18th, I am STILL waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: beechykeenDestin
Reviews.Content: I was robbed in my hotel room while I was asleep. According to several sources, including the Baltimore police, this has been happening at this hotel and several others. The hotel is taking no responsibility for this happening. They do not have security cameras in the hallways. Management of the hotel will not even talk with me. The offered no assistance in helping me when I had no cash, credit cards, id's, etc. It is in a terrible part of town. The customer service is terrible and put-offish. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly happy with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: jimmy0999
Reviews.Content: After securing this hotel for one night via Priceline, I was a little concerned about the mixed reviews. Most said that it was an older hotel which it was. However, it was, to my surprise, very classic, very well maintained. The only problem I had was after I booked the night, I called the hotel to find out what types of beds we were assigned. Up learning that it was one queen size bed, I asked if they could change it to two double sized beds. Their response was 'Since you booked through Priceline, you will get what is left that day.' Upon our arrival, I was able to change to two double beds.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel near Inner Harbour”
Reviews.Author: legend2x
Reviews.Content: We paid $170+/night for our Plaza Level Room for 3 nights. With the price paid, it can only be considered average, since others surrounding offer similar prices. Location, without a doubt, is great. It is walking distance to many attractions by the harbour. You do need to be cautious if you walk at night. The good thing is that there is police guarding at many street corners, even right by Radisson. The service from staff was mixed. Most of them are friendly and helpful, especially Tony from the Bell. The breakfast was definitely below average, except the coffee. Evening hot and cold hors d'oeuvres are decent with beers and wines. The restaurant and bar on the ground floor are reasonably priced with good service. The room has sleep number beds and we could not sleep well the first night because we could not find our numbers. The size of the room is a typical standard 2 bed room. Although the hotel is old, but everything in well maintained and updated. The wireless internet is free and has strong signals. The hotel parking per day is $31 or you can find public parking for $20 one block away. Although I would recommend this to others, but I might try Sheraton or Hilton on my next trip there if paying similar amount.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Watch the Neighborhood at Night”
Reviews.Author: Ron-from-NY
Reviews.Content: I paid about 75.00 a night for this hotel for a 2 night stay. Everything was within walking distance Oriole Park at Camden Yards, The National Aquarium, Inner Harbor. Plenty of good places to eat around the Inner Harbor which was a 3 block walk. The bad news is downtown Baltimore can get be very dangerous especially at night. If you walk a block or two in the wrong direction you will find yourself in a bad place. Even the walk to the Inner Harbor can at times be unsafe. Even in the day you might encounter street poeple in the downtown area. But these issues are more to do with the city then the hotel itself. The hotel was great value for the money I paid. The public areas of the hotel were very nice. This is a well maintained historic hotel. The lobby area looks fantastic. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable. The only downside was the bathroom had seen its better days. It can use a renovation. Not terrible though. THis hotel was great for the price, and would be good even at 150.00 at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: jen_travels_144
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just got back from the Radisson yesterday. We stayed 2 nights it was great. Got a really good deal through Priceline just a quick stroll to inner harbour. The room was huge and very clean. I can't say enough about how nice the saff was to the front desk to the valet guys. It is noisey --it is downtown-- I live in the country so I am not used to sirens and car alarms at all hours, my friend who lives in the city did not mind the noise. We did not hear anyone around us and we were right by the elevator. All in all this was a great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: roundabout2
Reviews.Content: stayed for two nights with husband very nice hotel conferences going on at same time of our stay was put in nice room away from noise, view of brick buliding next door but room was clean and staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “It is okay if you can get a deal”
Reviews.Author: wingatecat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was completely okay and only okay. Now that being said we were very glad we went through priceline and only paid $50 a night for our room because that is all it was worth. There are much better places around to stay if you are paying the full price of 100+ dollars a night. I would equate it more along the lines of a basic moderate hotel rather than the upscale rating most places give it. The hotel is definitely old and shows it in places. The bathroom in our room was clean enough but definitely could have been cleaner. The duvet cover also had stains on it. The view out of our window was straight into another room due to the hotels u-shape cut out. You literally could look straight into their room onto their bed....probably not most people's desire. Parking is on the expensive side for $31 a night for valet. You can park your car yourself in a nearby garage however you have to pay $18 every time you leave the garage. So if you plan on using your car you might as well settle on the valet price because at least it does include in and out service. The sleep number beds also seemed to be a big deal to the hotel. However they are nothing more than a glorified air mattress inside a mattress covering. It was only several blocks from the inner harbor and an easy walk so that was nice. However if you are going to pay full price there are better options available in the Baltimore Inner Harbor/Downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and Locale for a Night or Two (no more...)”
Reviews.Author: dctraveler83
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Lord Baltimore this past weekend for a one night getaway from DC and to attend a friend's 40th birthday. We found the hotel to be charming, the staff friendly, and the location close enough to nightlife and activities (not to mention safe). Do not expect the Ritz-Carlton, but for the price you get your money's worth. The hotel is older, but they have done a great job of updating it. Our room was clean and well appointed, but small. To be honest we thought the "sleep number" bed was really just a glorified air mattress, but otherwise the room fit our purposes perfectly. The staff did not go out of their way to help, but when needed were friendly and knowledgeable. We spent the day at the inner harbor yesterday, which was a blast and only a short walk from the hotel (8-10 min). Definitely go for the "parking included" package, otherwise you'll be paying $31 for valet. Outrageous! At around $110 per night we would definitely stay again, but probably not for more than a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “A little lacking”
Reviews.Author: narcisse07
Reviews.Content: I believe I would classify this hotel as a 2 to 2.5 star, which I do not think is consistent with the brand. The location isn't great, but it it okay. It iw within walking distance to Camden Yards and Inner Harbor, but I would prefer to be slightly closer. The nighttime activity around this hotel is excessive. I heard police activity, sirens, shouting, loud music, and what sounded like drag racing for hours into the wee hours of the morning. The staff mean well but fall a bit short. The bed was comfortable, but the room quite small. The decor was very outdated and the remote was filthy...I cleaned the dry ketchup off with sanatizer....eeew. This hotel lacks the finer points for service. If you self park, you will have to pay each time you come in. We chose instead to park at a lot down the street. It was worth the walk. Further, reviews for the valet, are not great. Walking distance to th MARC and the subway. No charge for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic & romantic, hope to return quickly”
Reviews.Author: RightHereFuggy
Reviews.Content: We loved the Radisson Lord Baltimore!! Beautiful lobby, lots of luxurious touches. The room was lovely, with a very comfy bed. The bathroom was clean and the water was hot--that's enough for me. The bed was a Sleep Number bed so we could adjust the firmness-nice! I read reviews that said the neighborhood wasn't safe, but we had no fears strolling in the evening. We walked to the activities in the Inner Harbor easily. There's a lot of financial offices around, not much in the way of casual shopping, but I didn't mind saving my money. There's a restaurant in the hotel, but we didn't use it. There's also a Starbucks inside which we did patronize, but there's also a Caribou Coffee very close by. I used Priceline and got 2 nights for $59/night, and we were thrilled with what we got. I can't wait for our anniversary, I plan to use Priceline again and I hope I get this hotel again! The only bad things about it, was that parking was inconvenient, and our daughter was disappointed that there was no pool. I didn't mind the lack of a pool, but parking was definitely a downer.

Reviews.Title: “very happy with hotel, and the staff! Don't believe those bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: mimi1971
Reviews.Content: I went there very nervous since after reading all the reviews from here because I priceline negotiated a great price for my one night stay for my friends wedding, When we walked in I was very happy to see the hotel was beautiful the staff was great and we arrived at 4:30am! They were vrey helpful valet was nice, they gave a us a big corner room and the sleep number bed was a nice bonus, we across the way to the days inn where some friends were staying and our room was so much nicer and they paid triple what we paid, than we went to the hilton and I have to say our hotel was the best and we walked to lunch and the area is just bustling on the week days but very quiet on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: emills
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night while visiting our daughter at the Peabody Institute at JHU. It was very busy as there were two events going on. Location was very convenient and did not experience any problems that other reviewers have had. For the price ($80) it was great. We parker at a city garage a few blocks away and really saved.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst stay I've ever had ...”
Reviews.Author: FroggLeggs
Reviews.Content: and I'm a frequent consumer of hotel services. This hotel is very poorly run, unclean and over priced. The front desk staff is unhelpful and rude. I would never recommend this hotel and would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, at a solid hotel full of art deco Character”
Reviews.Author: LovestheBear
Reviews.Content: I booked my weekend stay at the Radisson Plaza Lord Baltimore based upon the deal I got from a discount travel website. When I went back and looked through the reviews I became nervous that something would go wrong. I pulled up to the hotel expecting the worst and was completely surprised to find that the hotel was FINE and the staff was exceptional. This is a beautiful hotel, housed in an old building even so, they've managed to add some modern amenities (i.e. wireless internet, sleep number beds). The location is probably the best part of the hotel, it's well within walking distance to the Inner Harbor. I noticed in the previous reviews that some people were uncomfortable with the neighborhood. I walked around at night and I was completely comfortable, of course I wasn't alone but I wouldn't be comfortable walking around late at night in ANY large city. I suspect that those who were uncomfortable might have seen too many episodes of The Wire or just are not comfortable in urban areas. The one caveat I have is that the walls are THIN! We were kept up by our neighbors, and had to call the front desk twice. They offered to switch our room without any hesitation, which we decided against because it was so late.

Reviews.Title: “Old and in poor shape”
Reviews.Author: milesdd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for business, and was astonished at how different the rooms look from the photos on the website. My door had to be slammed closed b/c it wasn't set right, and in addition the hinge to the extra lock was falling off. The carpets were stained, walls scuffed, shower dripped and it was nearly impossible to get a comfortable temperature. the cards/menus/info books were stained and bent. shutters on the window in the bathroom were broken. i will never stay here again. the staff were fine, but this hasn't seen an update in YEARS.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: KR66
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I have never asked to change rooms at a hotel. I can usually make the best of any situation. I changed rooms three times until I finally found a room that I felt safe sleeping in. The hotel manager was not helpful at all. I had no hot water, the hair dryer did not work and the sleep number beds are terrible. One of the worst hotels I've stayed in. Other members of our group felt the same. Sorry but I can't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: hedmed2000
Reviews.Content: I was planning on attending a convention in the Inner Harbor and could not pay the $160 and up rates of the convention hotel, so I found a 3.5 star for $63 a night. It turned out to be this hotel. It is 3 blocks form the CC. While I would not rate it 3.5 stars, it is a decent hotel. The building is old and I am sure that it takes a lot of maintenance. The building does show its age a little, but not nearly as bad as some have complained. I have been here for 5 nights and have yet to see a rat or mouse or cockroach or any other creature. The rooms are good. I have a king room and it meets my needs. While the bathroom is a little small, it is OK. I still don't understand why any hotels puts the shower head at 5.5 feet.... While you would expect new TV's etc from a 3.5 stars, they have not been updated. I stayed on the 6th floor and have not had any problems with the free wireless - it has working fine to check my email. The location is good. It is right across the street from a subway stop and there are some tough areas just a few blocks away, but I have never felt unsafe. The restaurant was a pleasant surprise. I ate the salmon one night and it was pretty good and the price was not bad. I also had breakfast one morning and it was very good and very large. Two eggs looked like four and it came with 4 strips of bacon. Again, the price was reasonable I haven't had any problems with the staff or service. The walls are paper thin. I heard my neighbors arguing at 4 am.... My judgement way be clouded because of the price I paid, but I would recommend this hotel, particularly at this price.

Reviews.Title: “A nice clean well maintained hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johndred
Reviews.Content: Despite some of the things you see here, the Lord Baltimore is actually pretty nice. I was prepared for a nightmare of a hotel after reading some of the reviews here but was pleasantly surprised. My initial room on the third floor was simple, yet nice and clean. When the heat would not work the staff promptly moved me with zero hassle to another room on the sixth floor. This one was even more spacious and again, very clean and well-maintained. I can't vouch for the hotel food or the niehgborhood as I was in town for the inauguration and only saw the outside in the dark but the inside was more than acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some updating and improvements”
Reviews.Author: eastpetersburg
Reviews.Content: Overall, the condition of the hotel was ok in public areas, but the rooms are very dated, and need some modernizing. They have old TV's, old furniture, and just need an overall revamp. Also the 2 rooms we had, were completely different, with mixed and matched furniture. Our TV hutch would not stay open to be able to watch tv, but we couldn't get ahold of anyone to fix it, I'll get to that later. Parking wasn't conveniant, but it wasn't horrible either... it was down the street and some walking definately, I didn't want to pay $30 for valey. The staff was friendly when checking in, but did not have rooms with double beds available. She told me she upgraded us to a plaza level, and I was excited, but once I got to the room, I wondered what the standard rooms were like! The room itself was in working order, it just wasn't what I expected from a raddisson. The bathroom was very cheaply done. If they spent the money on granite vanities, they should have done the same in the shower and floor. It was cheap plastic tile everywhere, and wasn't the cleanest in the world. The HVAC worked well, however was very hard to regulate. It felt like you were either drowning in hot air, or it got very cold, there was no inbetween. I think there is simply too much air volume being moved for the rooms small size and it feels like you are inside the hvac unit itself... The front desk or anyone else was very hard to get ahold of. Dialing 0 resulted in waiting for 10-20 minutes, giving up, callig again later, same problem....finally called from cell phone into main # , and got someone to answer. Very annoying...

Reviews.Title: “Creepy, run down, dark dump”
Reviews.Author: wilsonphilips
Reviews.Content: This is a horrible hotel. It is old, run down, and by a loud street. The porter out front was aggressive -nearly threatening- when I parked for a few moments out front to check in. Inside, the rooms were dank and dark. Many face an interior courtyard that is just black and horrible, offering no light at all. The hotel was so bad that we left after one night. It was just a depressing place. And not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: themag44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in mid Oct. '08. I found the place to be very nice. Especially for the low price I paid. The rooms were very big. Nice beds. Chair and ottoman. Desk with chair. Mini-fridge. Coffee maker. The lobby and common areas are fairly elegant for what you pay. Check-in was quick and easy. I had no problem with the area it was located. It was very close to the harbor shops, Federal Hill, aquarium, Powerplant Live, ESPNZone, Hard Rock. All are within easy walking distance. I recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great to see history alive”
Reviews.Author: ladydeath1313
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and had a great stay at the hotel. I enjoyed the history of the hotel and it was nice to see that they stayed w/the motif of the era. It was very close to the downtown area, which can be undesirable if you're not ready for it. But it was also close to the harbor, which had plenty of places for shopping and tours on the water. Overall, I had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “not so impressed”
Reviews.Author: blahblah89
Reviews.Content: Location was scary. Only a few blocks from Inner Harbor but did not feel safe walking. Did like valet service to park truck. Desk persons very nice and professional. Room 920: dirty. Wallpaper had two burn marks on it. Floor and walls had some wine stains on them. Sleep number bed did not work when I arrived. They did fix it. Mattress cover had large stain on it, could see it through sheets. Bathroom was dirty, splashed brownish something on toilet and wall next to toilet. Dirty handmarks on bathroom door and plenty of dirt on bathroom floor. Toilet was leaking all over bathroom floor. View out our windows was another building smack up against the hotel, which that building did not have curtains and they were remodling, so we could see only falling wallpaper and ladders and a deteriorating old building as our view. Nice things: bed was comfortable and the pillows and sheets were crisp and very nice. Complementary coffee and bottled water. Throughout the night there was the roar of police car chases and police helicopters with the spotlight searching for someone. I would never ever stay at this hotel again. Raddison can do a lot to improve this historical hotel. The pictures are very misleading on their site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AllHailQueenMum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 1718, on the Plaza level, 17th floor, on Saturday, Sept 13, 2008. We booked a Standard King, non-smoking room on their website for $179 a night. I entered our Goldpoints member number on the reservation. Radisson allows online check-in, which I did 4 days before our arrival. The online check-in allows you to request a higher or lower floor, approximity to elevator, newspaper preference, and wake-up call information. I asked for a higher floor, away from the elevator. I also asked for a room on the other side of the fire station. Upon check-in, they gave us a plaza level room without charging us anything extra! I think it was the fact that I am a Goldpoints member. People in Plaza level rooms (17th and 18th floor) can partake of the happy hour appetizers in the evening and a very good breakfast in the morning (pancakes, waffles, fruit, toast, pastries, yogurt, oatmeal, juice, coffee). So... become a Goldpoints member before you reserve your room. You might get an upgrade for free. Now, onto the hotel. Very nice lobby, typical of a Radisson. Room 1718 has a kingsize bed. Sleep number bed was new to us. We slept okay. Dressing area has granite counter top with sink & mirror. Bathroom, also with granite countertop and sink, is spacious. Huge closet in room had a bath robe for us to use. It was a very quiet room. I never heard any sirens from the fire station. The room was neat and clean. Loved the bed linens. Everything seemed recently updated (walls, carpeting, furniture). Parking: we had a rental car with us. My husband was told to park it in a ramp nearby. The ramp was not affiliated with the hotel. We avoided the valet parking due to its negative reviews posted by others. Location: we were within walking distance of the Inner Harbor. Also, we walked to Oriole's Park at Camden Yards for a double header (yes, the Twins won both games... Go Twins!) All in all, we had a nice stay without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Radisson Plaza Lord baltimore”
Reviews.Author: SearayBahrain
Reviews.Content: My wife, son (age 3), and I stayed at the Radisson for 3 days while conducting business at the USCIS office in Baltimore. Although the hotel was certainly dated, the overall experience was a positive one. Te room was quite large and gave my 3 year old plenty of room to roam. We checked in on a Wednesday evening and the front-desk staff did seem a bit overwhelmed - we waited about 45 minutes for our luggage to come up at which time I just went back down and picked it up myself. This was typical of the service from the front desk. All of the other services however, were fantastic. The food in the restaraunt was very good- the crab quesadillas were wonderful! The internet connection was also very fast and was provided without charge. The only real complaint that I woud submit is the price of parking. SInce the hotel is located in the middle of downtown, there is little to no local parking and the hotel will charge you $31 a night to park. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this property and will stay there again the next time we pass through Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional and refuse to reimburse double-billing”
Reviews.Author: csoulellis
Reviews.Content: I was in Baltimore for a 1-day conference in May. I booked the flight and hotel through Expedia and paid the entire amount up front. I stayed at the Baltimore Radisson Plaza for the night and found them to be a little confused and unprofessional, but generally I don't make a big deal out of these things so the stay was fine. Three months later, I get a bill for 352 dollar US on my credit card for that one night stay, which was already paid through Expedia. Despite 20 long distance phone calls, where I was bounced around from person to person and never spoke to the manager, I never got anywhere with them. Expedia had to launch an investigation and, with my credit card company, FORCE them to reimburse me for the charge. In the end, they reimbursed most but not all of it, and refused to discuss the $50 in long distance charges I had to incur calling them. Apparently, according to Expedia, this hotel is famous for charging people months after their stay. If you feel like getting ripped off and then spending dozens of hours getting your money back, enjoy your stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK...”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveled20yo
Reviews.Content: Staff is terrible- unwilling to help, For some reason we could not check in before 3pm. All the desk clerks I ran into had lots of bad attitude. Rooms were old and falling apart. The wallpaper was falling off the walls and the paint was chipping. The size of the room as decent for downtown hotel. The beds were very comfortable. Room service food leaves a bit to be desired- but the grapefruit juice was very delcious and fresh. It's not in the best of areas there are a lot of prostitutes outside the hotel late at night. During the day though it is a safe area to walk around. I loved the inner harbor. Overall it's overpriced- needs a major renovation of the rooms and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth a dime”
Reviews.Author: tulip2323
Reviews.Content: Three co-workers and I stayed at this hotel for one night in July of 2008. Thank goodness it wasn't for more. We definitely would have changed hotels if we had to stay another night. Some of the issues we had were: - Dirty, unlaundered sheets! - Terribly kept hallways - the carpet was extremely dirty and stained. Even the walls were visibly dirty. - Garbage in the garbage cans upon check-in - No light bulb in bedside lamp - Burnt out light bulb in bedside lamp - Remote control being held together by bandage tape - One co-worker had a room on the Plaza floor which you need a key card to access. We couldn't figure out how to get it to work. When we asked we were told that 2 of the elevaotrs were "on the fritz" and that she should try a different elevator. - Staff that was less than helpful Even at a low price I would not consider this hotel a value.

Reviews.Title: “Older but Charming”
Reviews.Author: ShawneeK1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lord Baltimore July 13-18 for a class I was taking held in the hotel. The location of the hotel is right downtown and the area is pretty sketchy. It kind of reminded me of DC. Check-in was quick and I was pleased that I was put on the Executive Level (On floors 17+ there is continental breakfast in the morning and happy hour in the evening). If you have one, make sure you use your Radisson number when booking for the upgrade. My room was nice and big. The only problem was the fire station was right down the road and they seem to get a lot of calls @ 2AM and when they blare their sirens it echos off all the building and will wake you up. Ask for something not face the direction of the fire station. The first morning of our stay I came off the elevator to find they were shooting a Renee Zellweger movie. That was pretty neat to watch and the hotel staff was very accommodating-even with all the chaos. There are many food options around. I ate luch everyday @ FoodTopia which has a lot of food options and was really good though the atmosphere is a little dingy and cafeteria-like. If you go near the Inner Harbor the restaurant prices are close to NYC prices. I found that Market Place was good for happy hour. We went to a place that had $2 domestics, 2 for $5 Margarita's and 1/2 price appetizers from 4-8PM (Babalu Grill) and the atmosphere was nice. If you can catch an Orioles game, I'd recommend it. The stadium is really close to the hotel and it's pretty cool. Anyway- hope this helps:)

Reviews.Title: “Rodent Alert”
Reviews.Author: Lottery123
Reviews.Content: While at this hotel I observed a mouse run across the floor. When I reported it to the front desk the clerk verified that they were aware of their rodent problem. Also this was a old hotel in need of a major uplift. Would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful room - and bad area at night.”
Reviews.Author: Earl9371
Reviews.Content: This place is in HORRIBLE condition. My room had loose wall outlets, an a/c unit that was coming out of the wall, a bare thermostat, a register vent someone had rigged with a piece of cardboard to keep from rattling, wallpaper stained with God knows what, closet doors that were off the rollers, a desk that had chunks knocked out of it, loose windows that allowed me to hear street fights 11 floors up, very poorly smelling pillows...and the list could go on. I was there as a part of a conference and these types of complaints were almost universal. A colleague of mine asked a question at the front desk about her bed and the clerk was very upfront about asking her of she wanted another room, but why would you put someone in the room like I had in the first place? No one came to clean my room until 4-5 o'clock in th evening, and my favorite was seeing two maids in uniform around 2:00 sitting in a room watching TV. I've traveled a lot and this is the worst condition I've seen a property in for a long time. Between the room and the $7 beers at the cash bar, I've had enough. Then you've got the area there. When we were walking back from the Inner Harbor in the middle of the week in the evening and I noticed the police presence you could sense not all was good. A block past the Harbor and you were in a ROUGH neighborhood once the sun went down. The block around this property was tough - so much so that in my 11th floor room I could hear the fights and arguments and police sirens coming from the street at all hours of the night. If you have to go to Baltimore there are places nearer the Inner Harbor that looked MUCH better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - avoid the valet parking”
Reviews.Author: robert_lamb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rdisson on a short business trip for 3 nights. Room was very clean and had the sleep-number beds, im not the bigeest fan of these as the choice seems to be hard to extra hard. Internet connection was good although a little slow and in room facilliries were ok. Breakfast buffet was very good. Reading some the other reviews I also had the experience of asking the conceige about a good place to eat. He obviously plugged the hotel restaurant but when I said about going downtown to the harbour he said the place to go was Mo's, he had a friend that worked their and he could arrange for them to pick me up. I declined and walked down and although MOs looked ok i found a restaurant called M&S where the food was good and the service excellant. One other gripe with the hotel is the parking. Parking is very limited so the hotel offers a valet parking service, this is $30 a night. The idea is that you call down 15 minutes befor eyou need your car and it is brought round to the front. On all three mornings I rang and then went for my breakfast, 30 minutes later the car was still not there, they wait until you appear at the entrance and then go and get your car, an extra 15 minutes, then expect a tip! Overall the Hotel is nice, the bar is nice, the room was clean and bright, it is in easy walking distance of the harbour but the valet parking leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Was i t the new computer system?”
Reviews.Author: RealFlyingDutchman
Reviews.Content: After a transatlantic flight of 8.5 hours, 1 hour in cue for immigration and 2 hours driving from Dulles to Baltimore during rush hour I was longing for a shower. When I arrived at the front desk of the hotel nobody seemed very interested to help me. They were all busy doing????? At last a silent person not welcoming me at all "helped" me by going through a pile of paper trying to find my reservation. It took at least 5 minutes to find it and than he handed over the key. When opening the door of the room I noticed that the room was not ready for a new guest. Bed was not made and the towels were still on the bathroom floor. I went down and asked for a new room mentioning the reason why. No excuse, no appologies nothing. Another 5 minutes later I got a new key and and last a clean room. The room itself was OK although the connection of the free internet was very bad. After a good night od sleep and a shower in the clean bathroom I went out and did not return to my room until midnight. When opening the door I looked again in a room that was not visited by housekeeping. As I wanted to sleep I decided to complain about this the next morning. When I went to the front desk, again nobody felt like paying any attention. You do not overlook me as I am 6 ft 4. When I did my story the girl immediately wanted to call housekeeping to tell them to clean my room. I told here that it was too late as I was checking out. Again no excuses, apollogies not even the slightest discount. I hope that this behaviour was due to the fact that the hotel switched to a new computersystem. Next time I will not book this hotel again. Other hotels (Hyatt, Marriott in the Baltimore are much better)

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for concierge”
Reviews.Author: 2muchstuff
Reviews.Content: First, I should say that my room is just fine. Corner room, lots of light (although the windows are filthy) and comfortable beds. My beef is with the evening concierge, Tony. We asked the nice young front desk clerk who checked us in earlier in the day for a restaurant recommendation and he directed us to Tony at the bellstand. Tony immediately told us that all the places we saw at the Inner Harbor were going to be terrible, full of high school workers who would be sweeping around our feet trying to rush us out the door while we were eating, because we were dining after 8:30. He said we absolutely HAD to go to Mo's Crab and Pasta, a TRUE locals place and that he would even get their van to pick us up. That should have been a tip off. How many locals places need a van to pick up their customers? We stupidly took his suggestion, waiting endlessly for the van and then were escorted up the stairs at Mo's, even though there were plenty of tables in the lively downstairs dining room. Then it struck--we were being sent to tourist hell. I couldn't say if they have a special menu with special prices in tourist hell, but we were the only people on the entire floor except for one other table of tourists. Service was awful, food just slightly above awful, and the crabcakes were $33. I'm not reviewing the restaurant, though. I'm shocked that a hotel like the Radisson still employs people who are engaging in questionable practices like what Tony did to us. So stay at the hotel, but definitely do your own restaurant research and don't let Tony direct you to his "favorite" restaurant. I think I have an idea as to why it's his "favorite."

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: jenwarner
Reviews.Content: Upon pulling the car up to the Radisson, I was greeted by a few employees to handle the valet parking. VERY nice staff. When entering the hotel, a gentleman asked how we were and if there was anything he could do to make our stay better, and to let him know. The hotel smelled so fresh and clean. Knowing it was an older hotel, I wasn't sure what to expect. Then when we went into our room, same thing. Clean and fresh smelling. Only about a 3 block walk from the Harbor and great location. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars”
Reviews.Author: Kimi_in_MD
Reviews.Content: I had to see a specialist at Johns Hopkins, and booked a room through priceline. They gave us the Radisson. The room was very well maintained. The beds were select comfort, the linens were new & the room was nicely decorated. The bathroom was clean & spacious & the furniture in our room was in excellent condition. I would highly reccomend this hotel to any one and plan on staying there again in the near future. Our room also had a mini frige & microwave, which would have come in handy, had we been staying longer. Check out time is noon, and I didn't get finished with my appointment until 12:30. I called the staff to let them know that I was going to be late & they were very nice & understanding. Once I arrived back at the hotel, I informaed them I was there, and they told me to take my time packing up. Again very, understanding & kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: PATravelGal
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline for $75 for Sunday, April 27. Arrived around 1:30 p.m. with a 3 p.m. check in. We were graciously told we could check in anyway and got a great corner room on the 12th floor. Nothing was lacking; free internet in all rooms now. We used the valet parking because the nearby public garage was closed for renovations. We were allowed to keep our car at the garage after we checked out at no additional charge, so the $29 rate turned out to be a bargain. My husband had a late-night burger in the lobby bar which he said was excellent; and breakfast in the a.m. also was good. I had read the reviews here and expected far less than what we got. We were very pleased with both the accommodations and with the treatment we received from the staff. We definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: TravelinWahoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here April 12, 2008 for a wedding. I was pleasantly surprised. I was expecting a Holiday Inn, and wow, it was definitely a lot more than that. Gorgeous lobby with high ceilings and an atrium sort of thing in the middle. Flat screen tvs, adjustable beds. It was just so much prettier than I was expecting. Very nice. The only bad thing was that the valet service ($30/day) lost my sister-in-law's car keys. They lost a whole day looking for them. So skip the valet service if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you get a priceline rate”
Reviews.Author: notparishilton
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline for $70 on a Friday night. I didn't expected high quality for the price I paid so I wasn't disappointed. Check in was quick and easy. Elevators are plentiful and fast. Hallways are a little dingy. Door to room was falling off its hinge. Had to give it a push with my shoulder to open and close it. Room was clean but well worn. Looks like they upgraded at some point but the upgrade was done on the cheap. Some mildew in the shower. Wallpaper peeling in places. Sleep number beds are not the best for me. Felt more like a camping air mattress. We parked on the street and fed the meter for a few hours Friday afternoon and Saturday morning (spent $8 doing that). We didn't eat/drink at the hotel. I would go back if I could get a good priceline rate. good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice stay”
Reviews.Author: snifflesmcg
Reviews.Content: If you want an honest review, here it is. My boyfriend and I were staying here for a weekend getaway. We arrived around 2ish and it was off to a rocky start. First, there was no parking in front of the hotel (city streets) and only cab parking on the left of the side street. The right of the side street was full of cars and the street itself was packed with cars, both unloading people and luggage. It took several minutes just to drive through the street. Also, this hotell has no free parking. They offer a valet for $30!! I think not! We parked a block away in a parking garage (which was $12) and had to carry out luggage to the hotel. We entered the front door and saw a line along with a beautiful lobby. There was two weddings going on (I think it was 2 weddings, one for sure, the other looked like some sort of indian event, probably a wedding). There was only 2 people behind the front desk and it took almost a half hour just to get to the desk. With events happening on such a busy Saturday, they should have staffed morep people. However, the staff was nice. We checked in a went to our room. The room was very nice and cheerful with yellow striped wallpaper. It was smaller than I expected but very nice and clean. Only thing I noticed was a few chips in the tub. They have sleep number beds which I loved but my boyfriend hated it. I guess you can't make everyone happy. We had received a complimentary breakfast buffet with our hotel package. The next morning we headed down to the restaurant and had a great breakfast. We got fresh OJ and coffee and the buffet offered eggs, bacon, sausage, french toast, hot oatmeal, cereal, breakfast potatoes, scones, muffins, danish and fresh fruit (grapes, pineapple, melon and grapefruit). It was excellent! In all we had a great stay and it's only a few blocks away from Inner Harbor. I'd stay here again but still belive something has to be done with the parking issue.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, average room”
Reviews.Author: julie65c
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while in Baltimore to see George Strait (concert was postponed due to George have laryngitis). However, parking valet was wonderfully friendly and helpful. Front desk staff was professional and friendly. Hotel has impressive lobby, our room was smaller than expected but still very nice. It was clean and had a comfortable bed. Read the instructions for the Sleep Number Bed and get it adjusted before getting in and you'll sleep like a baby. Linens were clean and comfortable. Location was good, near Mariner Arena and a few blocks from Inner Harbor. We enjoyed our stay and would consider returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Baltimore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spenser78
Reviews.Content: This is a classy old hotel in a convenient location in Baltimore. The rooms are roomy and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We love the lobby bar and the restaurant is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Ok Room”
Reviews.Author: Quenormis23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night for a baseball game and it was ok. Now I know this isn't important to everyone, but I HATE dark hotel rooms. It was just a drab experience. But we didn't spend that much time in the room so I didn't let it get to me too much. The furniture is outdated, but for the price and location (in walking distance to the Harbor and Camden Yards) it did it's job. I do have to say though if you do the online check in it's a great experience. There is a separate much quicker and shorter line. And the check in lines were PACKED because it was a Yankee game. So if you choose to stay here do that for sure. Everyone was jealous, LOL.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but had some problems”
Reviews.Author: koonsce
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for one night to have a romantic getaway. Check in was easy...the valet took our car, and the front desk told us we could check in immediately (at 11:30 A.M.) as long as we didn't mind being near a service elevator. We said that was okay, and we were sent on our way. The king size bed we "requested" (even though I thought this meant it was reserved) was not in this room; instead we had a queen size Sleep Number bed. The Sleep number bed is terrible! Ours kept changing...we'd set it on the same number, and an hour later one side would be rock hard and the other would be sinking down. This was nothing but a glorified air mattress, and I'd never sleep on one again. The hotel was an easy walk from Inner Harbor, 5-10 minutes. We did notice that at night, there are some street people around, but they never bothered us, and we didn't feel unsafe at any point in our walk. The shower, as another review said, was very strange with water temp. You'd be showering, and suddenly the water would get very hot, then it would go back to normal, then very hot again. The bathroom, though, was clean, as was the rest of the room. One thing that seemed odd is that the alarm clock was unplugged when we got into the room, and I wasn't wearing a watch, so it was a bit annoying to track down the time so we could set the clock. We were on a hall basically by ourselves, but you could tell when walking through the halls to the elevator that the walls were pretty thin. There is noise from the outside, but since you're in a city, that's to be expected. It wasn't anything that kept us up at night. Also, there was a strange odor in the lobby, but luckily it didn't permeate the room. Check-out was easy as well, and we had about a 15 minute wait outside until the valet brought our car. Overall, it was a clean room, and we weren't in it that much. However, we were both pretty sore the next morning from the terrible mattress, and I didn't venture into the shower for a second time since the water was scalding.

Reviews.Title: “nothing went right”
Reviews.Author: iluvthebeach32
Reviews.Content: ok, to start things off our reservation was prepaid about a month in advance. when we arrive at the hotel we were informed that the king size bed that we "requested" (i noticed the careful use of the word requested and not reserved) was not available. they also said that the queen beds werent available either. this was a big problem for us since the reason for this 1 day getaway was for a romantic trip for my girlfriend and myself. anyway, the hotel itself was attractive and the room was nice enough as well. no complaints there. the air beds that come standard in each room are nice but again, we were forced to take 2 double beds and my girlfriend and i actually had to sleep in seperate beds to rest comfortably. late night room service was available and we took advantage of it but, we were disappointed here as well. our order was incorrect and the cobb salad that we received was according to my girlfriend "the worst ive ever had" room service was somewhat pricey as well so getting a bad salad is unacceptable in my opinion. another one of the selling points for this hotel to me was the free high speed internet available for the rooms. do not be fooled by this! yes there was free internet but it was anything but high speed. we like to bring out our laptop and watch movies via our netflix account online and this was impossible due to the horrible internet connection provided which was just barely faster than dial up. the next morning we get the breakfast that we had ordered (which did show up on timeat least) the breakfast itself wasnt very good and again for the price we were disappointed. denny's would have been a better choice for a meal. now we come to the absolute worst part of our stay, the shower. every minute or 2 the water would go from normal to scalding. youre forced to turn cold water on compensate for the temperature change and then the water goes back to normal for another minute. then it suddenly becomes freezing cold. to compensate for this you must turn the cold water off. this process was repeated several times by my girlfriend and myself just to get a normal shower. everything else at the hotel was fine. i liked the decor, the staff was friendly and the valet parking went well. there was another customer who had been waiting outside for his car for 50 mins when we got ours back but we didnt have any problems ourselves. all in all i would avoid this hotel and for future trips and choose different accomodations. i hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal.”
Reviews.Author: pebbledog123
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be the best bargain for the Inner Harbour location in Baltimore. Although it is an old hotel, it has been refurbished and boasts amenities as good as those with more illustrious names.When we arrived, the valet parking was full, but there was good underground parking across the street charging only $7.75 overnight. The check-in was efficient and we were given a large room with 2 king-size beds with sleep number mattresses that we found to be novel and interesting. The bathroom was much larger than average. There was a coffee maker present as well as a small refrigerator. The receptionist arranged for a complementary shuttle to take us to Mo's Crab and Pasta factory in Little Italy, where the portions were so large that we had to take food back to the hotel and were grateful for the refrigerator. The only drawback about the hotel is that it is 4-5 blocks from the Inner Harbour itself and we were nervous about walking to and from there when it was dark. Nevertheless it is in good company, as there is a Sheraton Hotel right next door. We would definitely use this hotel again and use the money saved on cab-fare to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay at a reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: sac_jhu
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Radisson Lord Baltimore was very nice, overall. The desk staff at check-in were friendly and helpful. To my surprise, they let me check in at 9:00AM. The elevators were efficient, unlike those at some nearby downtown Baltimore hotels. The room was spacious and clean when I arrived. For the star rating, the decor and furnishings are in dire need of renovation. There were large chunks of tile missing from the shower and tub and noticeable cracks in the tub surface. The furniture was old and the phone next to the bed was not functioning. Overall, this is a nice historic hotel in a good location in downtown Baltimore. It clearly needs some renovation and maintenance, but this hotel is a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, impressive hotel”
Reviews.Author: CeleryIsGross
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Baltimore, so I wanted to stay Downtown near the Inner Harbor for convenience. Everything we wanted to see was within walking distance to the hotel. The rooms were really big and the bathrooms were recently updated. Bed was comfortable even though I'm not a huge fan of SelectComfort air matresses. Staff was really helpful and we recieved all of our requests quickly, including extra bottled waters. The concierge let us check our luggage on the day of our flight home so that we didn't have to walk around the city with tons of bags. Overall, a great stay and a deal at priceline for only $45 a night.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good!”
Reviews.Author: natasha1980
Reviews.Content: Although some of the other reviews are fairly negative, I actually had a pretty decent stay at this hotel. Although the hotel itself is a little dated and worn and has terrible carpeting, it is clean and well kept. I got a corner room and it was very nice and spacious. The sleep number beds that they have are not very comfortable but they still have nice sheets and pillows. I did not pay for valet parking - it is very expensive at $28! I parked for free on Fayette street next to the hotel since I arrived at 6pm and left by 8am. Between 8 and 6 you will have to feed the meter. I had no problem finding a spot and I even went out for dinner and returned with no problem locating a parking spot. Even if you didnt find a spot, there seems to be an underground parking lot right next door to the hotel. As far as the area being sketchy, it is not. I guess if you are not used to living or travelling in cities you may think so, but there is nothing out of the ordinary for a downtown area in a city.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and the Smelly”
Reviews.Author: WezLee
Reviews.Content: The GOOD: 1. Beautiful old hotel. 2. My room (1512) was large, quiet and clean. 3. Excellent dinner at the restaurant downstairs. 4. Severs for both dinner and breakfast were efficient and friendly. The BAD: 1. Valet damaged my rental car while parking it and did not notify me until the next morning at checkout. Extended session of claims paperwork then ensued. Why couldn't this have been done when it happened instead of when I am trying to check out and go to my meeting? "I don't know." was the reply. 2. Not the hotel's fault, but honestly - S0-o-o-o many 'street' people! I've been in many downtowns, but when there are more street people on the sidewalk of your hotel than business folks (at 2pm on a weekday mind you) it does not make you want to take a stroll to the inner harbor at night. As for the reviewer (obviously not from the States) who thinks that not wanting to be hustled or intimidated by street people makes you some sort of country rube, all I can say is that I hope your good luck in this department continues to hold out while travelling in the US. The SMELLY: What IS that smell that permeates the lobby? Thankfully though, it was not in my room!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: alngeoffro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on 12/29 and 12/30. Definitely an older building; but we found the lobby to be very nice; the staff was friendly and the room was adequate. Very nice king size bed with individually controlled firmness. Very nice touch. Bathroom was old, but again quite adequate. Only negative comment would be that the grout in the tub was dirty; but on the other hand, I had no qualms anout using the shower. Hotel is located 3 blocks from the Inner Harbor...very walkable. One night we did take a cab from Ruth's Chris (Water St.) and the meter was $5.60 (you add the tip) We were in town for a Ravens game and Camden Yards was easily walkable as well. Didn't spend a lot of time in the room; but the hotel certainly met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “The Lord Welcomes You”
Reviews.Author: NeedPivo
Reviews.Content: Built in 1929, the historic Lord Baltimore Hotel bears the name of Cecilius Calvert the 2nd Baron of Baltimore, and stately boasts a prime location in the beating heart of Charm City. Lord B sits right off North Charles Street (Baltimore’s Main Street) and is a short walk to the city’s convenient light rail system – there is one line that just shuttles passengers between Penn Station (Amtrak/MARC commuter trains) and Camden Yards, which is adjacent to the baseball stadium and another MARC station. Additionaly, the hotel is four blocks away from the Inner Harbor (Turn right onto Charles and then left onto Pratt Street – an alternate right turn on Pratt will take you to a wonderful brewpub-cum-British pub called The Wharf Rat. (See my review.) The lobby is very grand and rather ornate, itself a symbol of a time gone by when travelers required more than free coffee and HBO. Off to the side is a comfortable lounge area where thirsty guests can quaff a local Baltimore beer. There is also a Starbucks on premises – but then where is there NOT a Starbucks these days? My room was very spacious (I am a frequent stayer so that might explain it) with your average amenities and features. Radisson has incorporated a unique feature called “Sleep Number” that allows guests to adjust their mattress – or just their side of the bed! The room was well-maintained though showing a tad of wear and tear. There was a window in my bathroom, something I’ve never come across in the States. This being Baltimore, the breakfast menu offers crab cakes and English muffins. (I did not order them, but …. mmmmm, anyway.) Previous postings have made note that the neighborhood is “dangerous” or “seedy.” I found none of this; there is no danger here. It is a well-lit and heavily trafficked section of downtown that might be better described as uninteresting – being nothing more than a office blocks and parking garages. Perhaps these reviewers were referring to the nearby bus stop. People were hanging out - perhaps waiting for a bus home? Honestly, those people who live sheltered lives should neither travel nor advise others – and should never attempt an objective review. Lord Baltimore is a wonderful hotel in a charming town.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews I read”
Reviews.Author: Shudbegolfing
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pre-booked for us and we were quite apprehensize after reading the trip advisor reviews. however, it was very acceptable and conveniently located. Room was fine, lobby was OK although everything is a bit dated. Had a very nice dinner in the restaurant. We didn't understand previous reviewers concern about the side entry as it all pretty standard to me. Good value at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service”
Reviews.Author: bilo61
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a two night stay at the Lord Baltimore and I found it to be clean and comfortable. I didn't take note of the neighborhood because I mostly took taxis from the front door and I was with a large group. It is a little longer hike to inner harbor than advertised, but 4 of us women managed it just fine late one evening with no incidents. Room service was prompt and the food was very good. I loved the Select Comfort beds and I don't recall ever sleeping on such crisp, clean smelling linens in a hotel before!
