The concierge recommended that we eat at Mo's...they sent a free shuttle to pick us up and drop us back. I was skeptical, but it turned out to be a great meal and very reasonably priced. We had the crab trio for $30, and one platter would have served two people very nicely. All in all, I'd stay at this hotel again. I found it pleasant and the staff extremely helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: firelady16
Reviews.Content: We checked in around 6pm on a busy Saturday within minutes. We bypassed the valet and just asked him where the parking garage was. At the front desk the lady working asked if we would rather take a queen bed on a different floor instead of the floor where the King size beds were because there was a wedding party staying on the floor above and she was concerned that we would be kept awake by the noise. The sleepnumber bed was fun to play around with since I've never used one before and other than the hallway carpet looking like it needs to be updated, we did not see anything wrong with the hotel. Good deal for the price, and sure beats paying hundreds for a room right on the harbor, especially if you are already from the area. Also, we were about 20 minutes late on check-out, but that was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Better off sleeping on floor”
Reviews.Author: 2kool4school
Reviews.Content: The only good thing is location and that is just decent if you plan to walk 5 or more blocks to the inner harbor. Parking is ridiculous when checking in a 5:00 on Saturday it took 30 minutes on line. After all the mess the valet decided to turn me away and send me several blocks away to self park. All said and done $29 later my vehicle was parked by the valet. Beds are awful. If you like cheap air mattresses then their bed will work for you. FYI, a Sleep Number is a gimmicky air mattress and should never be in a hotel. Don't know what they were thinking with that choice. Anyone that likes a Sleep Number seriously must have a old worn out cheap bed at home, better off on floor. Room was old and not very clean. Extreme noise for hours outside my room when people returned late night, slamming doors and people yelling. Not recommended unless you don't plan to sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Bad Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel via Hotwire when paying for an Inner Harbor location. The quick and dirty is that the hotel is fine if you get a good rate and don't mind a walk through some seedy area's to get to the inner harbor. The hotel itself is a historic landmark and the lobby and public area's still are a throwback to old times and are quite beautiful. My kind sized room was larger than many hotel rooms I have stayed at. I did not have any of the cleanliness problems of other reviewers. The bed was great, bathroom was small, but I've been in smaller. Staff was very friendly. My biggest complaint is the location. I work in downtown Los Angeles and have no problem walking the streets after-dark. So I figured I'd be fine on the 5 block walk to the inner-harbor, not so, I was looking over my shoulder constantly. I took a taxi back for a mere 4 blocks rather than walk. In LA, the homeless leave you alone. Here, they were hotting and hollering at me. Didn't seem like the harmless type I am used to. I hope not to have to return to Baltimore again, but if I do, I will be staying right on the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Service fine, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: rpost06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during a recent Red Sox v. O's series. We did not experience any problems with checking in or service. We stayed on the 6th floor and the hallway carpet definitely needed to be replaced. It was very faded in spots (and ugly). Our room was a large king on the corner. The room was fine -- all the linens were clean. However, the bathroom needs an update. For starters, the grout around the tub and shower really needs to be replaced. I thought the area around the hotel was safe, although it depends on perspective -- I live in Washington, DC. We left my beat up Honda Civic parked on the street outside (no meters on weekends) and had no problems. Also, we walked to Camden Yards and Mt. Vernon with no problems. Overall, I'd stay at this hotel if you get a deal on Priceline... Otherwise, I'd make a reservation at one of the Marriotts.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: EGigs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson because of the great location but unfortunately the room was not clean. When we moved the ottoman to get easier access to the window we found a used condom on the floor. After alerting not one but two of the employees at the front desk they seemed to be disinterested and offered no apologies but simply told us they would let housekeeping know. The comforters and pillows appeared fine but the bathroom and carpeting was filthy…I can only imagine what else was not cleaned in the room!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, spacious”
Reviews.Author: Justanothermember
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Service at checkin was fast and professional; later I got perfect directions and help with late-night dining options. The room was larger than average and very quiet. The blackout curtains were great and kept the room very dark at night. The water pressure was quite strong. The location was convenient, just a few blocks to the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards and right across the street from the Metro. The beds had down pillows and comforters (the only possible hitch is that they have Sleep Number mattresses, which may take a little getting used to for some people). I would happily stay here again. Keep in mind: Valet parking is on a crowded side street; at times it is hard to find a place to pull over. Parking costs $20 a night (check your bill; ours accidentally had an extra night of parking). The rooms have cable TV, but not every channel known to mankind (no Comedy Central, for example.)

Reviews.Title: “Needs some updating on amenities and service.”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvlr8374
Reviews.Content: I got to experience the Radisson Plaza Lord Baltimore hotel in two ways - as a guest in their hotel and as a guest when they were the venue for a wedding reception. From the start, the hotel allowed on-line check in and I was given the opportunity to request an early check in and a higher floor. We arrived at 10:30 am and our floor on the 14th floor was ready for us! We were so pleased that we could check in and get some much needed rest. The room looked standard, although the BF was a bit disappointed with the price we were paying for the room for what we got. It was a bit darker than some of the other rooms we visited. (Our room had one King size bed, while the rooms with two doubles appeared larger and were more lighted.) We also had no view since it faced the other buildings. The highlight was the Sleep Number bed, of course. (I did notice some dark stains along the white comforter though, which is not so pleasant.) And the closet door/mirrors were broken. They were sliding doors and we were missing one altogether! Also, it looked like they never vacuumed the closet ever because of the carpet discoloration. When we met up with the wedding couple later on that day, they were disappointed to learn that their personal welcome bags were not given out to their guests yet. They had to speak to the staff to remind them about the bags, which was frustrating on their part. The next day, we were disappointed to see that all of our toiletries were not replenished. It was quite apparent we needed more soap and shampoo, except that we didn't get anymore. When I called down for housekeeping (the various buttons on the phones didn't work, I ended up hitting "O" for the operator), they said they would take care of what I needed. After waiting almost half an hour, I heard a staff member in the housekeeping closet down the hallway and went to catch up with him myself. He apologized for taking so long, but in the end, I had to send the BF off to the wedding rehearsal without me since it had taken so long. On the very last day of our visit, we heard someone fumbling with the door and by the time we crawled out of bed to check, no one was there. When we did leave our room to catch up for the post wedding brunch, our "Do Not Disturb" sign was missing, but we got another one and put it on our door after making sure it was closed. (I can only assume it was housekeeping trying to get in, but because we had both the door locked and the dead bolt on, the key didn't work.) Returning back to the room after brunch, I noticed our door wasn't closed completely. Looking around, nothing appeared to be missing but it certainly upset me that someone had attempted to come into our room. (I'm assuming housekeeping came in, saw that we were still checked in, and left.) We had requested the late check out, which is 1 pm, which was pretty easy to do. When we asked the bell hop about airport shuttle services, he was pretty friendly with helping us out. However, when we returned in the evening to request such a service, a different bell hop said it was too late for an airport shuttle. (Airport shuttle from the hotel is $15/pp.) And when we requested a taxi, he half-heartedly went outside to wave one down. He came back to tell us that he had called for two taxis and that was it. We ended up walking up a couple of blocks and waving our own taxi down. ($27 flat rate to the airport from downtown Baltimore) The light rail is also about three blocks away and that will take you to the airport too. Overall, our stay at the hotel was just okay. There was nothing particularly special about our visit and service was alright. There were some really nice employees while there were those that were just average. The cocktail hour and wedding reception was a different experience though. The waiters and bar staff during the reception were professional, friendly, and had a smile on our face. One of the bartenders that worked the reception definitely added to the great time we had. The waiters serving the food and clearing the tables did a fine job from where I saw. Even the staff assisting with the post-wedding brunch were friendly too. The hotel is walking distance from Oriole Park at Camden Yards, 1st Mariner Arena, and the Inner Harbor. However, walk a few blocks in the other direction and you're in an area that appears to be not as safe. Nonetheless, it is centrally located with a Starbucks downstairs. Overnight parking is $28/night.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience”
Reviews.Author: AdventuristGirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to go on a mini-vacation, so we went to Baltimore for the weekend. We booked this hotel the day before we left through Hotwire. For the price and hotel's location, I would say that I had a positive experience at the Radisson. We both live in Washington, DC, so we did not feel particularly unsafe walking in the neighborhood surrounding the hotel; however, I wouldn't recommend walking around there alone after dark. Yes, the hotel is dated (you can tell by the lobby's appearance), but it is centrally located; within walking distance to Inner Harbor, Camden Yards, the market, and nightlife. Our room was standard size, with a king sized sleep number bed. The room and bathroom were both clean and updated, though nothing remarkable. Aside from sleeping, we did not spend much time in the room because we spent the whole day walking around the city. We did not eat at the hotel either, because there are so many other better dining options in Baltimore. I thought it was great that there is a Starbucks in the hotel -- the baristas were also very friendly. I wouldn't recommend parking at the hotel because the fee was ridiculously expensive. We found street parking just a block away, and parking was free because it was a weekend. The Radisson is not a lavish hotel; but it is clean, basic, updated, and provided all the necessities. I didn't see any peeling wallpaper or stains on my floor or in my room. Our interaction with the front desk was minimal and efficient. We are planning to go back to Baltimore again as a weekend trip and for the same price, I would stay at the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Radisson I've Ever Stayed in”
Reviews.Author: JeffDAkron_OH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson in July for three nights while working a trade show at the Convention Center. Well, either the organization putting on the trade show got a sweet deal or the Convention Center gets kick-backs on naming "Convention Hotels", as this Radisson was a real disappointment. For a remodeled "historic" hotel, one is prone to forgive smaller rooms and slower elevators, but this place was pathetic. Stayed on the 5th floor and was first greeted by dull lighting, hugely stained hallway carpet and peeling wallpaper. The room was a little better, but nothing special. Being told at the front desk I was being "upgraded" from a queen to king because of lack of availability, I was expecting a fairly spacious room. Not a chance, just looked like they crammed a king bed in a regular room. Decor was moderately upscale, but undone by stains everywhere (lamp, ceiling, etc.). Coffee maker was tiny and almost impossible to operate without spilling water. TV was small for an allegedly "upscale" hotel. The service was another black spot. While I went to the front desk to ask about a new hair dryer (i.e. one that worked), a loud fight broke out between a manager and a housecleaner--very unprofessional. Another telling sign of the bad mangagement was a women next to me checking out complained that her tv was turning on and off all night keeping her awake all night! You might imagine that the desk manager would immediately apologize and try and offer the woman some kind of remediation for this. Oh no, the desk clerk looked blankly (and indifferently) at her and announced "What room waz you in?" With a lot of other, nicer and more modern hotels surrounding the convention center (a fact I didn't discover till I got here), there is NO WAY I would ever, purposely go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience from start to finish...”
Reviews.Author: ferriswitt
Reviews.Content: This is quite possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. As a weekly business traveler, I presumed that I could believe the Expedia 3-star rating the Radisson had. Below is an outline of the problems we encountered: - No working toilet in the room for 2 days - After the toilet finally was repaired, parts of it were left on the bathroom sink - Broken alarm clock; and when a new one was requested, it just put on the desk without being plugged in, set, or even removing the previous one - Pile of body hair on the bathroom floor that was there all week - The blue quilt on the foot of the bed appeared to have male body fluid on it - A throw pillow had a very disturbing stain as well - Plates and glasses were not cleared out of the room, but we had to put them outside the door where they would typically remain for 36 hours or more - When I called the front desk for a wake-up call, I was told that it was an "emergency number" only and then they hung up on me. - The security lock on the door was barely secure because it had been screwed into putty on the door - Garbage cans would be left in the middle of the room and not returned to their original spot - Garbage that would have fallen on the floor was just left there - Neighborhood is not exactly the safest at night (I do not recommend walking alone or with kids at night back to the hotel - take a taxi!) The hotel was disgusting in every way. And whenever I would try to speak to someone about a problem, the response was that it was through Expedia, a third party, and they locally they could do nothing. My stay eventually ended with the front desk person telling me that they could not do anything for me. I thanked them and just walked out deciding that I would just deal with it later since no one in the hotel would even try to do their job.

Reviews.Title: “Old School Charm with major attitude at Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: BluzTraveler
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel because I like the 30's - 40's charm and decor. The Room was small, price was reasonable. bathroom very small. Adjustable comfort bed was OK with me but my wife could not sleep on it . You have to eat in/ very close to the lobby, so we ate out each on the three nights we were there. You really have to watch out for your safety walking back from the inner harbor to the Hotel late. My only problem came at check out. I noticed my bill increased Sat Nite over Friday's by over $45. I pointed it out to the front desk and she said with major attitude : "did you walk in or have a reservation?" (she had been the same clerk who checked me in...so much for customer courtesy) I said " I made a reservation via AAA". She replied "well sometimes rates go up !" . I replied, "Is this one of those "Sometimes" as it was not explained to me when I checked in Friday", She replied "Well Obviously it is ! " , A more senior clerk intervened, checked my account and stated "this increase should not have happened" in a courteous and professional manner. She adjusted my bill. This type of front desk "attitude" will negatively impact my decision to stay there again and my recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with wedding weekend.”
Reviews.Author: LouiseBoston
Reviews.Content: I was in charge of arranging a hotel room block for my daughter's wedding in Baltimore. We were very nervous about how things would go when we learned that the wedding was the same weekend as The Preakness. Our party took up 37 rooms in the hotel and as far as I have heard, everyone had a good experience. I was aware of only one problem. One guest was on the 3rd floor and it was very noisy one night because a prom was going on in the ballroom on the same floor. The 800 reservation phone number worked very well. I had to change reservations for several people and the reservation staff was always very helpful. The wedding did not take place at the hotel, but we had a buffet breakfast in the Versailles Room for all the wedding guests who were staying at the hotel. It was lovely and delicious. They even put big bunches of white roses on each table that had been left from another wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Debi_and_Bill
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel the first thing you notice is the luxurious decor and inviting lobby. Just beyond the lobby is a rather small but very quaint bar area, perfect for a nightcap or a quiet game of cards. When we got to our room we were very impressed with the linens and the overall upkeep of the room. It was gorgeous to say the least, with a nice view of the courtyard across the street. An added bonus was the Sleep Number bed that was in our room, although my husband loved it, I couldn't seem to find "my number". The hotel is a short walk to Inner Harbor and there is a very convienient walkway (Charles St. Skywalk) that leads there if you choose not to dodge traffic. The restaurant at the hotel is also spectacular, the Short Ribs are out of this world! The only downside to staying in this hotel is the parking (they charge twenty-five dollars for valet) luckily we were able to find parking for six dollars a day just a few blocks away. Overall this hotel is definitely a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Caution”
Reviews.Author: Tireddoc
Reviews.Content: Utilitarian room with a queen size bed, not the requested king. View of the HVAC system on the building across the alley. Bigger problem is parking. Valet parking is apparently quite limited and was full when we arrived. Directed to garage across the street. We left that garage for our evening engagement and when we returned, it was full and we had to drive around for about an hour in gridlock traffic leaving the Orioles game before we could get back into that garage. If you are driving and the Orioles or Ravens have a home game, think twice about staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Taffeta
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Lord Baltimore during a professional conference -- I like these older hotels that are charming, and that are kept in good condition. My experience was unlike some others -- I had a nice room that was in very good condition. It looked like they had renovated it about 10 years ago, so it wasn't brand new, but definitely not falling apart, either! And, very nice botanical art was hanging on the walls. Everything worked in the room, and the front desk staff were fairly cordial. I didn't have to contact them for any major problems, but I did call them and ask questions once or twice. They answered my questions in a professional manner. They did not seem to have a concierge on staff, but the bell staff were able to give some advice and directions. I had a room with one queen sized bed. It was a good size room over all, not cramped or small. I didn't try to adjust the Sleep Number bed. It was slightly uncomfortable, but I probably could have fixed that. The housekeeping staff generally did a good job, too. My only complaint at all was that the hot water in the shower was not reliable in the morning. I would turn it on, it seemed warm enough, but then right after getting in it would go ice cold and had to be adjusted for a while until it stayed at a good temperature. Overall, this was no worse than any hotel I've stayed in. It didn't have many exceptional qualities, except for the nice lobby and ambiance there -- for those who like that. Still, it's not a bad place.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Lord Baltimore Club Level Experience”
Reviews.Author: Polarbear14
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute room on the club level for the weekend and found it to meet our needs for a hotel in the Baltimore downtown/Inner Harbor area. Check in was quick and friendly, took advantage of the free drinks (beer, wine, soft drinks) and snacks (potstickers, potato fritters, veggies, cheese and crackers) available at the club level happy hour. Also ate the continental breakfast, which was fine- but nothing special (bagel, fresh fruit, juice/coffee/tea and one warm iten-small wafles our morning) Room was average size, comfortable sleep number bed and clean bathroom. Toiletries were of nice quality and room had two sinks, one in the bathroom/one just outside the bathroom door. Overall thought this was a good hotel for a fair price (especially considering the club level benefits of the happy hour and the comfortable bed). We paid $200 on a weekend night when most of the rooms in the city were booked.

Reviews.Title: “Change the Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: ctomfly
Reviews.Content: Older hotel, that shows it's age yet charming- The front desk crew were terrible. This left a lasting impression.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: EasternShoreNative
Reviews.Content: Hotel is showing it's age, check in staff weren't the friendliest. Room was okay in size, remote for the tv didn't work and a light was out in the bathroom. Sleep number bed was twin size at best. Even though our room was on the eigth floor the local trash truck awakened us twice at 2:00 and 2:30 AM. On the bright side the restaurant downstairs had exceptional food. Checkout staff was more than helpful and actually eager to help. Valet parking although expensive to our standards, had energetic and eager staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: BobAdams111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lord Baltimore while on business in the Baltimore area. The experience was generally ok but I probably would stay elsewhere on a future trip. Here are some of my thoughts: 1. The lobby and building are historic and very impressive. 2. The room was big, clean, and generally comfortable. The hallways and bathroom in the room were not as well kept. The bathroom seemed dirty and old. One of my towels had yellow stains on it, which was obviously a big turnoff. My toilet didn't work properly. However, the shower did have alot of pressure which is unusual for a hotel. 3. I stayed in Room 620. This room had a view of the office building next door. When I say next door, the office building was literally 15 feet away from my window. I could look into someone's office and see what they were working on. I'm sure that this was also the case for them. The windows were covered by a thin, white linen curtain that I am sure did not block their view into my room. This made me feel very uncomfortable. While I felt comfortable, I wouldn't stay here again if possible.

Reviews.Title: “good quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: lorie07
Reviews.Content: stayed in october 2996 for six nights. paid 149 dollars during tradefair season, which was a very good deal. hotel is a classic, very old building, charming rooms, especially the dining/event rooms give a nice atmosphere. everything is a little bit run down, including the rooms, windows have not been cleaned for a long time, also my window was facint against a small sidestreet with the opposive building a few meters away. anyway, very friendly service as usual in baltimore, and i was happy. location is nice, but not perfect. i would not venture out at night. i am usually rather brave but i turned around at once when i went for a stroll at 10 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: clues
Reviews.Content: In town for quick business meeting; chose this hotel because it was across the street from the meeting. Arrived at 11:30 at night. Very nice reception at door and front desk. Lobby was full of smoke from lobby bar. Went to room, noticed carpet was coming up in the hallway. Room was small but adequate. Bed was very comfortable, which saved this rating from a terrible. Shower tub was a small plastic job that kind of thumps when you walk on it. Half of it was moldy. Ordered breakfast on a door hanger, never arrived the next morning, called and asked and they said they never got it. Hanger was gone from the door. Too late to reorder, so I just said don't worry about it. Checkout experience was very friendly, promptly faxed my bill to the office. My disappointment with no breakfast was resolved by finding a Starbucks next to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Soriah
Reviews.Content: Overall, I really enjoyed this location. Here are my thoughts: PROS: The staff was incredible. Everytime I called downstairs for assistance, my needs were immediately addressed. The room service food was really yummy, too. The room was clean and comfortable. Some rooms have Sleep Number beds...mine did not but it had plush feather pillows and blankets. Since I am allergic to feathers, I asked them to "de-feather" my bed and they did so within 15 minutes. CONS: The weather turned cold, and my heater wasn't working. I called them near the end of my trip and they send someone up to turn on the pilot light, so that worked out in the end. I did get one outfit washed through the hotel's laundry service, and it came back with a really strong smell. The main annoyance I had during my stay wasn't the hotel's fault...but since this is in the downtown area, we heard lots of police and firetruck sirens throughout the night. Pack some earplugs! Overall, this is a location I would frequent again. It's close to the harbor and the service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place but Stuffy Attitude”
Reviews.Author: Meursault
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after getting a deal because of the off season. Lovely remodled interior, great size of rooms & tasty breakfast down below (which came w/ stay). I wandered around the hotel & it was empty, there were some nice rooms for business folks at the top. I felt uncomfortable because this is mainly a "snob" hotel but it is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: GrammaZ
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough positive things about the Lord Baltimore. My husband and I stayed there for four nights towards the end of September. I was able to get a great rate of $121 a night through Hotwire. Did not get the sleep number bed but the king we had was very comfortable. When you book through Hotwire you are not given a choice of bed configuration so when we checked into our room there were two doubles. Went back down and asked if it would be possible to get a king and they obliged without a problem. This is an older, historic hotel in a prime location. Walked to everything. Took in an Orioles game, only about a ten minute walk to Camden Field. Spent an amazing morning at the aquarium, one of the best, and then took the water taxi over to Fells Point for a feast of mussels at Bertha's. Some of the best we have had. We did pay the $25 a day for valet parking but as stated in a previous post there is a $10 a day lot just a couple of blocks down on Baltimore Street that we discovered on the last day. We really should have looked closer for it when we arrived. If you want a truly good seafood experience would recommend Blue Sea Grill on Water Street. Great meal. Little Italy is full of very recommended restaurants. We tried Amicci's and were very happy with our choice. Definitely would stay at the Lord Baltimore again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: raveman2001
Reviews.Content: I checked in late, around 8pm on a dark, rainy night. Valet was right there and check it was a breeze. Someone else escorted us up to our room with our bags and offered us anything we needed or wanted, including to even go to the 7/11 for us if we needed anything! Super friendly staff. Room was very nice, got the new sleepnumber bed. Ordered room service that night as it was late and the crab cakes were among the best I've had (even in Maryland) and was prompt, nice staff again. Location was perfect just by St. Charles Ave walkable to everything in town. If you're too close to the harbour you're away from a lot. This hotel is in the middle of downtown (3 blocks, 5 minute walk from the harbor) and therefore close to everything. The buffet breakfast was delicious too. Just a note, the aquarium is great to spend a couple of hours. I've been to many Radissons and this has to be among or is the best. The staff and the hotel and it's location made my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Search for soda”
Reviews.Author: NJKim
Reviews.Content: Well, let me start by saying that the Valet guys were great. Very friendly and prompt when we needed them. I wish the rest of the stay was as good. We had to hunt from floor to floor to find a working ice machine, a working soda machine, or sometimes a soda machine at all. At least they tried to help by putting signs on the soda machines to try a particular floor, with the only problem being when we got to that floor, all we found was another note suggesting yet a another floor to try. It shouldn't be this hard. When we inquired about the problem, the front desk was pleasant, but unable or unwilling to offer anything but the words I'm sorry. It was a comfortable walking distance from the Inner Harbor which is why we chose it, but for the price I guesss we expected better. The beds were a little uncomfortable unless you upgrade to the top level rooms which was not family vacation affordable. They should not lead people on about the sleep number beds at there hotel as they are only in the most expensive rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: michmurp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night as a little escape to Inner Harbor. Location was wonderful as you can walk anywhere. We spent time at the attractions in Inner Harbor and at Camden Yards and didn't have to walk too far. Hotel was nice. Keep in mind that it is in a city and so the rooms are usually a little smaller than normal, but the room wasn't tiny. We had a queen bed, 2 night stands, chair, desk and TV armoire in the room and it wasn't crowded at all. Bathroom was not huge, but as long as only one person was in it, it was fine. There was an area outside of the bathroom with a mirror (but no sink). All in all, a perfectly fine room. We had originally booked the Wyndham across the street, but after all of the bad reviews I read, I was able to book the Radisson for $4.00 more than the rate for the Wyndham. You can definitely park for cheaper at some of the area lots than at the hotel. Hotel parking was $25/night, we parked a block away in a garage for $10.00/day and then I didn't have to valet at the hotel. We were on the 7th floor and never heard people in the hall at night (of course, we didn't get back to the room until around 11 PM). But, the hotel was completely booked and you really wouldn't have known it. My only 2 complaints are that there is no exhaust fan in the bathroom (it gets steamy in there) and that there was a line to check in. The line wasn't bad, but it was oppressively hot out and we ahd been walking around for several hours, so standing in line wasn't what I had in mind I would recommend this to anyone traveling to Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Total Bliss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the finest places to stay on the face of the earth. The staff goes above and beyond the call of duty. If there were 10 STARRSS I would give all 10 just based on my wonderful experience with the sleep number beds - I went right out and bought one for every bedroom in my house. The friendly folks there will always be remembered by me and my husband. Thanks Lord Bltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Small Room”
Reviews.Author: WWLJN
Reviews.Content: The bathroom was dirty with hairs found on the floor, sink, and in tub. The room was small with mismatched decor and no view. The $25 valet parking fee was an unpleasant surprise. The desk clerks were unfriendly. It is too far to walk safely after dark to Inner Harbor. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 3GoingPlaces
Reviews.Content: We won two nights at this hotel as a result of a charity auction in Baltimore. The room was so bad, that we decided to leave, even though the room was free. We went to the Harbor Court across the street for the next night. So many things were wrong with the hotel, so I'll just mention the most important ones. A) We were on floor 14. My husband opened the window to air the room out and realized that there was no screen, not barrier, nothing, protecting customers from falling out. VERY dangerous, especially if you have children. B) The bedspread was pilly as were the sheets, indicating that they were far beyond their useful life. C) The shower shot water over the curtain on to the floor, flooding the bathroom whenever we took a shower. D) We called the valet from our room so we could get our car and get the heck out of there--the attendant said, "No problem," and that the car would be on the street in five minutes. We waited and waited. We saw no car. We saw no attendant. This took about 20-30 minutes. Not good. We will never go back to this hotel and highly recommend against it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week for business purposes and it was a great choice. It was in close proximity to my meetings and the inner harbor (restaurants and site seeing). the rooms were nice, clean, and renovated and a great value for $99/night. the staff was very courteous and very helpful. i would definitely choose to stay here again if my work sends me to baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: amjohn
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a weekend stay at this hotel for his birthday. I received a wonderful rate of $45 by bidding on priceline. All of the staff that we encountered were very nice. The room was a bit smaller than the average standard room, but it was clean and the heat worked amazingling well. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great deal!”
Reviews.Author: mdoron5131
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night through priceline and got an amazing deal ... $50 for a Saturday night stay! Everyone we encountered at the hotel was polite and helpful. The room we stayed in was clean and recently renovated., very comfortable and big. The $25 parking was a bit much, we parked in a lot up the street which was $15 and less than a 5 minute walk. Overall, it was a great location and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for what we paid!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaDoll
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not a four-star hotel. HOWEVER, it was a very good deal for the price we paid---$101 for a double. The building is old and historic (in the National Register), and it has a little bit of a shabby chic feel, but our room was HUGE and had been recently redone. The bedding was very comfortable. The bathroom was the least impressive feature---clean but not updated or particularly modern. The toilet was hard to flush, but this was just a problem with the handle itself, not with the plumbing. The breakfast buffet in the hotel's "grill" was also an excellent value. I'd stay here again for the same price but would not pay much more. Very good harbor and convention center location.

Reviews.Title: “Pay Cash if you must go here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They charged me for 3 nights when I only stayed one on my debit/credit card. When I complained, the manager told me I should have paid cash!!!!! They were the most unprofessional employees Ive ever delt with in my life and Im a New Yorker saying this!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ask what events are booked before you check-in!!”
Reviews.Author: baclausn
Reviews.Content: The bellhop service, check-in service, floor concierge, all excellent...EXCEPT, we were NOT told during the check-in process that there was a large event being held that evening in the ballroom which was directly beneath our room. We were extremely happy about everything UNTIL we returned from our romantic evening out. It started with the line that snaked from 1/2 way up the block to the staircase in the lobby, the mob scene in front of the building, the security guard who had to identify us as guests before allowing us to enter the hotel, the empty beer bottle stashed in the elevator, and the absurd loudness of the music and the screaming people which caused not only the floor to vibrate strongly, but the bed as well! When I called the front desk (both times) I was told that the 'party' had a right to be there as they had paid their money and had been cleared by the management. Oh! And not to worry, the party would end at 3:00AM! During the second call I was assured that we were not the only guests who were complaining, there had been "many more" complaints and that I should "feel better" knowing that I wasn't alone in my irritation! Both times I stated to the desk clerk that we (the paying guests) had a right to a quiet night's sleep, and that the party's rights did not supercede our rights. My only request was for a decrease in the volume so that our bed and floor would not vibrate...this was refused, "I can't do that." Since there were no apparent rules governing the usage of the ballroom the music and noise continued to increase, to the point of being able to hear every word of every song clearly through ear plugs! Finally, shortly after 2:15am the police swarmed the hotel (No, I'm not joking!) with full lights and sirens from multiple sides, brandishing their nightsticks, and the music abruptly stopped at 2:17am. In addition to the police, a fire truck and fire rescue vehicle pulled up, with full sirens and lights. The next morning there was a stream of vomit in front of the elevators on our floor and drink glasses strewn about. In fairness to Radisson, their 100% money back guarantee if they are unable to resolve an issue is true: the hotel removed all charges from our bill and 'comp'ed the stay, but only after we were persistent about the matter, initially they tried to get away with taking 1/2 off of the bill. I would not choose to stay there again, however, my fiance' stated that he would choose to return, since they 'comp'ed the stay he feels that the matter was resolved and that they've maintained his patronage. The building is beautiful, our room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable...but you will need to make-up your own mind, and if you choose to stay there MAKE SURE that you ask what events will occur during your stay and MAKE SURE that you are put in a room on one of the highest floors they have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Untrained Employees”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a wedding and although the wedding was beautiful...I would NEVER AGAIN go back to the Radisson in Baltimore. When we checked in (my husband and I) we wanted to confirm that we will have a room next to my parents room since I called the day before and they said this is no problem. So the lady says to me, "no, it is not possible". I said "I called and they said it's fine". She said "there is no record in the system that you called for this". Now, fine, if for whatever reason they were not able to accomodate us with this, they can at least be somewhat apologetic rather than THERE'S NO RECORD OF THIS! And she was nasty about it too. Then we go upstairs to our room and I wanted to find out what time the bus will be coming to take the guests to the church. I called the front desk (which each time you do this, it automatically connects you to security somehow and they NASTILY connect you to the front desk) and I said "could you please tell me what time the bus will be coming for so and so's wedding". The girl NASTILY says "I DON'T KNOW"! So we sat there in silence for a few good seconds until FINALLY she goes.....HOLD ON! She gets back on and tells me to look at my goody bag I was given at check in (from the bride and groom). But when I say they are NASTY their, I mean NASTY. Then at the end of the night after the wedding, a big group of us went to hang out at the hotel bar. My sister gave her ATM card to the bartender and ran a tab. She was hesitant to do this but the miserable bartender was annoyed having to debit her card per drink. So at the end of the night she asked for her card back and the bartender says "I ALREADY GAVE IT TO YOU"! Well, she didn't. So my sister went back to her room w/ NO bank card. Then she calls her account the next day only to find out they charged her for 3 nights instead of one. Reason being (which makes NO sense) because she ordered room service they had to put her back into their system in order to go ahead with the charge. So they automatically checked her out in their system before 12noon, so when she ordered food they put her back in and ended up charging her another night (actually 2 extra nights because she ordered room service in twice). I have seriously never seen more incompetent untrained RUDE employees in my life. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT stay at the Radisson Plaza Lord Baltimore in Maryland. I am shocked that such a reputable hotel would allow their employees to treat GUESTS this way. Really really terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Just fine!”
Reviews.Author: DrifterGirlOne
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and all was well. Elevators are *very* slow though during day/convention/conference times. Took more than 15 minutes to get from Ballroom level to 19th floor conference rooms...short walk to inner harbor...very friendly and helpful staff...the Starbucks inside the hotel needs to open before 7 am. Rooms were clean and bright. High speed internet access worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Gives me the creeps!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was disgusting! The bed was worn and "hump backed" in the middle. Very uncomfortable. I woke up with a sore back every morning. The towels in the bathroom were grey instead of white, were fraying, felt like sandpaper and looked like rags that were used to clean the floors. The wall paper was peeling and the overall state of the room gave me the creeps. It just wasn't clean enough for me. It lseemed as though they were running the hotel with a skeleton crew. The bell captain doubled as the concierge and the front desk staff (if there was someone present) was not very helpful, polite or friendly. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend!”
Reviews.Author: kaydensmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after bidding on it on Priceline. We were very pleased and it was exactly what we thought it would be according to what we saw on the internet. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. Problems: parking was a little stressful but fine once we figured it out. The room was a nice size and there was a feather bed on top of the mattress and we slept under a down comforter. It was great! No pool but we knew that prior to going there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nvagirl
Reviews.Content: I was relunctant to book this hotel after reading the poor reviews, but the price was too good to resist. My stay was wonderful. I was only there one night, but would definately go back. We were able to check in to our room early and it looked like the room had just been renovated. The vanities were granite and the decor was very nice. The desk staff was very pleasant when I checked in and out, and helpful with directions. They only offer valet parking, but we asked about alternatives, and we were directed to a garage around the corner that was $15/day. The hotel is walking distance to Camden Yards. Other reviews complain about noise, but we were not in our hotel room until very late, so it wasn't an issue. I would definately recommend this hotel, especially for those like us who don't spend a lot of time in their rooms, but still want a nice room to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson fair”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on Sat night. I requested a non- smoking room and was given a room that was very smoky. I have 2 kids with asthma. I called the front desk and they moved us to a new room promptly. New room was on the " plaza level" and was not smoky. Room was not especially clean and ordinary. I would give it a 3 star. Supposed renovation in March 2005?? I saw nothing new. Staff was friendly. I did receive the rate I was quoted. Had breakfast buffet in Lord Baltimore Grill- hot food that was a usual buffet style. Good quality. I loved the Starbucks in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before I left on my trip I read some of the reviews of this hotel and cringed. I did not find what others found. Staff was helpful. Particularly, a waitress named Brenda at the Grill was impressive. I ate breakfast there both mornings. The second morning she ticked off what I had eaten the day before--oatmeal without brown sugar, skim milk, and decaf coffee--and asked if I wanted the same thing. I was with three other people and she was able to repeat what each had eaten. She was friendly and helpful. The room was acceptably clean, but not impressive. Some of the reviews I read were so negative that I think this lovely old hotel needs a break.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Plaza Lord Baltimore
HotelInfo.Address: 20 W. Baltimore St., Baltimore, MD 21201
